loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca has switched from selling dried fish to selling snacks. Her business is doing well when she doubles her time perfecting her own snacks recipe. With her husband's help, she has maximized her profits and she keeps pursuing her goals for the good of her family. The reason why she availed another loan from PMPC is to purchase flour, sugar, cheese, wrappers and other items for her snack vending business.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, cheese, wrappers and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La Señora es soltera no tiene hijos, es una persona trabajadora y responsable. La señora es la mayor de las hermanas mujeres que son cinco, muy pequeña se vino a la ciudad a trabajar con su tía con la cual aprendió a costurar, ya que a sus padres no les alcanzaba el dinero para poder mantener a sus ocho hijos. La Señora trabajo y estudio en las noches saliendo bachiller, como ha trabajado ha logrado comprarse una máquinas industrial con la cual ahora realiza la confección de deportivos, de esta forma a cubierto con los gastos de sus estudios y también a ayudado económicamente a sus padres. El préstamo lo solicita para cubrir gastos médicos ya que ha tenido una caída fuerte en la cual se ha lastimado la espalda y necesita de varios estudios y un tratamiento de fisioterapia según el primer informe médico que le hicieron, para seguir trabajando y ayudando a sus padres
texts.en:
The anonymous entrepreneur is single and does not have children. She is a hard-working and responsible person. She is the oldest of five sisters. At a very young age, she went to the city to work with her aunt, with whom she learned to sew, because her parents did not have enough money to care for their eight children.

The women worked and studied at nights, to earn her diploma. With her work, she was able to buy an industrial sewing machine, which she uses now to sew sportswear. With this, she has been able to pay for her studies, and she has also helped her parents financially.

She is asking for a loan to pay for medical expenses, because she had a hard fall that has injured her back. She needs several exams and physical therapy, according to her diagnosis, to be able to continue working and helping out her parents.

loans.use: to pay for treatments, physical therapy, and medications due to a fall that has injured her back and causes her great pain.

loans.name: Elsi

texts.en:
Elsi is 61 years old and married with two children.

Elsi is in the agricultural business, farming corn and vegetables in the Philippines. Elsi requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Elsi has been farming corn and vegetables for 20 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Elsi would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en: Merlie is a businesswoman who earns through retailing various items. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurances and financial assistance. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks. She is on her way to renovating her house. She wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks

loans.name: Naina's Group

texts.en:
Naina, 42, lives in her own humble home made of daub and wattle in a small village in Koraput district. She has lived there for a number of years with her husband and their two daughters, ages 20 and 18, and their 16-year-old son.

Naina works as a fruit and vegetable vendor in the community, and provides quality service to a large customer base. This is how she has been able to support the household finances. Naina is well known by her neighbors for being an honest and hardworking woman.The lady standing to the left hand side in the photograph is Naina.

Together with her group member, Naina is requesting a loan of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner, People's Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to buy sand, cement, a flush toilet, steel, and other materials to build a septic system so that she can provide her family with better hygiene.

Naina hopes to be able to rely on this loan, because she wants to do this project as soon as possible so that she can provide her family with better living conditions and safeguard their health.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, a flush toilet, steel, and other materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metallic sheeting and wood and to pay for labor to build his house with new materials of good quality.

loans.name: Tha

texts.en:
Tha, who is 36 years old, is a farmer who lives in Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham Province. She is a hardworking mother of three children who are enrolled in primary school. She can make a net profit of approximately $2.5 (USD) a day.

During this rainy season, Tha is faced with financial strain in her family. She needs some money to buy fertilizers and other related farming materials to use in the rice field. After getting to know that HKL provides loans with a lower interest rate, Tha has decided to apply for a Kiva loan. She would like to thank to all lenders for their kindness.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and others related farming materials

loans.name: Hiramani's Group

texts.en:
Hiramani, the lady standing on the right in the picture, is 47 years old and lives with her children. Three years ago, her husband met with an accident and lost his life. That was a very hard time for her because the entire family burden came onto her. In those days she had two cows so she tried to cover her family expenses by selling milk, but that was not sufficient. After one year she purchased another cow to earn more money as her children's study expenses are increasing.

Now Hiramani wants to purchase another jersey cow so that she can sell still more milk and milk products. She said, "If I get a jersey cow, I can sell more milk so I can spend more money on my children's studies."

Along with her other group member, she has requested a loan amount of 30,000 INR from which she will use her portion for purchasing a jersey cow. She wants her children to graduate from a good college, and she needs to save some money for her daughter’s marriage.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana’s husband owns a metal shop, in which he sells iron sheets and rods, in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been selling iron rods used for constructing concrete roofs and manufacturing iron accessories. He has been doing this business from his childhood, that is why he could not get qualified but he wants to educate and feed his children appropriately. He wants to generate maximum income so he can easily reduce financial constraints upon his family.

For the sake of his family's future and for cherishing them, he wants to increase the inventory of his shop on a daily basis. In this way he can easily generate maximum income to support his family but he does not have cash in hand.

Rukhsana is 40, the mother of four children, and she has to look after her children. She wants to financially support her husband, so he can easily be true to his holy aims. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy iron rods for her husband's metal shop.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 45 years old and married with six children, three of whom are in school.

She earns a living by farming citrus in the Philippines. Chona is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies. Chona has been farming citrus for two years, and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be humble. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals, flasks, soft drinks, and other items. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals.

Mary describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of soft drinks, cereals, and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of soft drinks, cereals, and other items.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Maribeth requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Maribeth has been in this business for six years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rechel

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rechel works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and raising livestock. Rechel is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her fishing business.

Rechel has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Severina

texts.es: La señora Severina siempre mantuvo la esperanza de mejorar su calidad de vida con trabajo constante y esfuerzo junto a su cónyuge, quien actualmente trabaja como minero en el cerro rico de potosí y la señora se dedicada a la elaboración de mantas a mano, actualmente los señores tienen hijos de 16, 13, 8 y de 2 años los 3 primeros hijos estudiantes solo el menor está al cuidado de la madre se hace notar que la familia es unida siempre buscando mejorar la calidad de vida de todos sus integrantes, es en tal sentido que hace 1 año atrás se capacitó en tejidos a mano con la fundación "educación para el desarrollo" Fautapo, en el instituto técnico industrial "Nuevo Amanecer" y actualmente es la principal fuente de ingreso de la familia elaborando mantas de mano de diversa variedad y posterior comercialización, y su cónyuge colabora con los gastos básicos con su actividad minera, siendo la actividad de su cónyuge una alternativa importante para el desarrollo familiar y así mismo buscan fuentes de financiamiento para incrementar su capacidad de funcionamiento y mejorar su nivel de inventarios, gama de sus mantas.
texts.en:
Severina always maintained the hope of improving her quality of life through constant work and effort together with her spouse, who currently works as a miner in Cerro Rico of Potosi. She works in the production of blankets made by hand. Presently, the couple has children aged 16, 13, 8, and 2 years old. The first 3 children are students, and only the youngest is in the care of the mother. It is noted that the family is united, always looking to improve the quality of life of all its members. 

It is in this regard that 1 year ago she was trained in knitting by hand by the foundation "Educacion para el Desarrollo" (Education for Development) Fautapo, in the industrial technical institute "Nuevo Amanecer" (New Sunrise). Producing blankets by hand of diverse variety and the subsequent commercialization is now the principal source of income for the family. Her spouse contributes to basic expenses through his mining work. Her spouse's work is an important alternative for the family development. Likewise, they are seeking financial sources to increase her operating capacity and to improve her inventory level and assortment of blankets.

loans.use: to buy supplies to increase her production of blankets and to improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of 10 children, Ofelia works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from catering services and raising pigs. Ofelia is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials for the maintenance for her motorcycle transport business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Ofelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Muhogo Group

texts.en:
Salumu is in his early 40s and is married with three children. Two of them are grown up and one of them is still at school. He has been selling second hand clothes since 1995. He works from 8am to 5pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Salumu's 12th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase his second hand clothes stock and has managed to pay back all his loans successfully. He is doing great with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. He will use this loan to buy first class second hand clothes and meet his customers' requirements. He dreams of owning a big second hand clothes shop.

Salumu will share this loan with his loan group Muhugo, which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy first class second hand clothes and meet his customers' requirements.

loans.name: Ma. Guia

texts.en:
Ma. Guia is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. and is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Ma. Guia dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Madeline

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Madeline works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell dry goods business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from direct selling Avon products. Madeline is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of dry goods to sell for her buy and sell dry goods business.

Madeline has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of dry goods to sell

loans.name: Lidia

texts.en:
Lidia is a business woman, so a loan of $800.00 is offered to Lidia to improve her business. She is taking this loan and will use it to buy more additional supplies to keep in her store such as oil, salt, noodles, coffee, sugar, cigarettes, slippers, lighters, scissors, shampoo, biscuits, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things.

Lidia has been involved in business activities since 2010, which she started with her own working capital of $ 300.00. She feels so comfortable to run her business because it’s become her activity. Running a business has made Lidia independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy oil, salt, noodles, coffee, sugar, cigarettes, slippers, lighters, scissors, shampoo, biscuits, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina is 41 years old. She is married and is a business women. She is applying for a loan of $800.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a shop business and also sells in the market.

Celestina has been involving in business activities since 2008. She started with her own working capital of $ 100.00. She is earning a good income from her business because many people like to buy it. So she is still happy to do her business.

All of the people around her in the market want to buy her goods. She is taking this loan so she can buy aqua, detergents, biscuits, candies, seasoning, slippers, soft drinks and other things to sell.

loans.use: to buy aqua, detergents, biscuits, candies, seasoning, slippers, soft drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Luningning

texts.en:
Luningning is 47 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of household goods to sell.

Luningning has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from boarding house rental.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Marie's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 20 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée le 31 décembre 2012. Il regroupe des femmes du même village qui ont de bonnes relations entre elles et sont très solidaires. Elles s'activent principalement dans le commerce et l'embouche. 
DABA debout à droite de la photo et levant la main gauche est âgée de 57 ans, elle est l'emprunteuse vedette.
Elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants dont 4 garçons et 3 filles. Elle s'active dans le commerce.
Avec le prêt reçu, elle va acheter 100 kilogrammes d’arachide à 40 000 FCFA pour les transformer en huile. Elle obtient 30 litres après transformation et revend le litre à 900 FCFA. Après extraction de l'huile, elle obtient 15 barres de tourteaux et revend la barre à 750 FCFA.Elle achète 1 sac de pomme de terre de 25 kilo à 9000 FCFA et revend le kilo à 600 FCFA. Elle achète aussi 1 sac d'oignons de 30 kilo  à 7500 FCFA et revend le kilo à 600 FCFA. Elle achète enfin 1 carton de vinaigre de 25 bouteilles à 3500 FCFA pour revendre la bouteille à 250 FCFA. Le reste servira à couvrir les dépenses imprévues. 
Avec les bénéfices, elle compte acheter un mouton pour démarrer une activité d'embouche et aider sa famille surtout ses enfants dans leurs scolarités mais aussi en leur achetant des vêtements.
texts.en:
This group of 20 members is part of the Banc Villageois that was created on December 31, 2012. Its members are women from the same village. They all get along well and are very supportive of each other. They mostly work in small-scale commerce and livestock raising.

Daba, standing on the right in the photo raising her left hand, is 57 years old. She is the featured borrower. She is married and the mother of seven children, four sons and three daughters. She works at small-scale commerce.

With the loan she has requested, she is going to buy 100 kilos of peanuts for 40,000 F CFA. She will press them to extract oil. She obtains 30 liters at the end of the process and sells the oil for 900 F CFA per liter. After extracting the oil, she is left with a residue of 15 bars of peanut cake for animal feed that she sells at 750 F CFA per bar. She will buy one sack of potatoes of 25 kilos at 9,000 F CFA and resells them at 600 FCFA per kilo. She will also buy one sack of onions of 30 kilos for 7,500 F CFA to resell at 600 F CFA per kilo. She will buy one carton of 25 bottles of vinegar at 3500 F CFA and resell the bottle at 250 F CFA. Any remaining funds from the loan will be used to cover unexpected expenses.

With the profit, Daba intends to buy a sheep to initiate a livestock business, and she wants to help her family, especially the children with their school fees, but also by buying them clothing.

loans.use: to buy peanuts, potatoes, onions, and vinegar.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela is married and she has a kiosk. Her husband is very supportive of her running her business. She said, if we want to open a business with our own money, then our efforts will not run properly as we can't predict the money coming in and going out. So she had the idea to take a loan from Tuba Rai Metin.

Manuela is applying for a loan of $1000. She is taking this loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk including sugar, salt, slippers, soaps, toothpaste, sardines, detergents, water, biscuits, milk, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell.

She started her business in 2012 with a working capital of $1000. She hopes to open a big store in the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, slippers, soap, toothpaste, sardines, detergents, water, biscuits, milk, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Sabeniana

texts.en: Sabeniana has wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities such as growing, caring for and harvesting and earning income as well. Sabeniana has supported her husband doing this type of work. Like a farmer, Sabeniana has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds, which will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. Someday, Sabeniana hopes to purchase another rice land to cultivate that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, which will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Tin

texts.en:
Tin is a 32-year-old married woman with a child in her care. She is a garment factory worker and has been since 2010. Her husband is 31 years old. He’s got an electric generator and bass box set for rent. They all live in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. Together, they can earn approximately $16 per day.

Tin would like to request a loan to buy a generator and musical instruments to rent. This equipment will be rented out for wedding parties or funeral ceremonies.

In the future, she is going to build a new concrete house and support her children to go to university.

loans.use: to buy a generator and musical instruments to rent out.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be loyal. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 11 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the rainy season, which affects business. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to have three more motorcycles within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a fleet of motorcycles.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 49 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Jesusa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles and other groceries.

In the future Jesusa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 6 years.

Anita requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has piped water and electricity. She cites school fees and food as being her greatest monthly expenses.

She has operated a beauty salon business for the past nine years. Her potential customers are her fellow neighbours and people at the market place. She dreams of earning more income and incorporating hairdressing skills in the future. In addition she also operates a business of selling cosmetics that earns her another source of income.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her beauty salon business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her beauty salon business

loans.name: Somai's Group

texts.en:
Somai, 35, is married and she has three dependent daughters. She lives in Tbaung Khmum province, where she and her husband have been running a cassava and rice business as their main source of income for years.

The past loan has helped her buy more household supplies for the family. Now, leading a group of three to get loans, Somai will use her loan to buy organic fertilizer and organic pesticide and to pay for labor fees. She hopes that she can buy a two-hectare area of arable land to grow more cassava and another two-hectare area to grow rubber trees. She also wants to support her daughters’ studying until they graduate.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer to improve crop productivity so as to buy more plots of farmland to grow cassava and rubber trees and support her daughters' studying.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en: Jenny lives in Same and her business is restaurant food. She lives near many people, so she had an idea to open a restaurant for everybody to come and eat. She is earning a good income every day because many people come to eat in her restaurant so she is very happy with her business. Now she is applying for a loan of $1000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business because she wants to open a bigger restaurant in the future. She started to open a restaurant in 2015 with her own working capital of $1000. She is taking this loan because she wants to use it to buy more ingredients such as rice, beef, pork, fish, chicken, herbs, eggs, instant noodles and other materials for the restaurant. She hopes with this loan, her business can improve in the future.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients such as rice, beef, pork, fish, chicken, herbs, eggs, instant noodles and other materials for the restaurant.

loans.name: Joaquina

texts.en:
Joaquina has been involved in business activities since 2000. She started her business with her own working capital of $300.

Joaquina has a shop. She is requesting a loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to buy additional supplies that people like, including shampoo, toothpaste, soap, lighters, noodles, biscuits, sugar, slippers, cigarettes, candles, hand body lotion, milk, sardines, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell.

She is happy because, with this loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she can build her business in the future and her income will increase.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, toothpaste, soap, lighters, noodles, biscuits, sugar, slippers, cigarettes, candles, hand body lotion, milk, sardines, soft and hard drinks.

loans.name: Teresa Del Jesús

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Sagrado Corazón se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Teresa, tiene 62 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo mayor de edad el cual tiene capacidades especiales y requiere de muchos cuidados. Su esposo es empleado privado.
Doña Teresa es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para ayudarle a su marido a  salir adelante, ella tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa,  allí vende todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas, allí ella también tiene unas vitrinas en las cuales exhibe productos Yanbal y Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas) los mismos que vende ahí mismo y también sale a vender, su esposo le ayuda en su trabajo cuando puede, pero por lo general es ella la que mas pasa en su negocio, le gusta su trabajo ya que allí se gana lo suyo y está al tanto de los cuidados de su hijo. Tiene más de 20 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y  productos Yanbal. Lleva más de 13 años en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta por los servicios que recibe del grupo. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y contando con la ayuda de los créditos.
texts.en:
The community bank "Sagrado Corazón" meets every 15 days in the city of Manta. Manta is a city known for its beautiful beaches, which are visited frequently all year round, and for being a city with unrivaled beauty with many tourist attractions.

In this city lives Teresa. She is 62 years old, married, and with her husband has an adult child who is disabled and has special needs. He needs a lot of care. Her husband is a private employee.

Teresa is a woman who likes to work to help her husband succeed. She has a grocery store in her house. There she sells a variety of products, such as rice, sugar, cooking oils, detergent, legumes, vegetables and fruits. She also has some display cases where she sells Yanbal and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories). She also goes out to sell these products. Her husband helps her in his work when he can, but in general Teresa is the one that works most in this business.

She likes her work, because this is where she earns enough for herself as well as what is needed to are for her son. She has been working for more than 20 years in this activity, and it is going very well for her.

This loan will be used to stock her store more. She will buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, meats, and Yanbal products. She has been with the community bank for more than 13 years, and she likes the services that she receives from the group. Her dreams are to move forward, with the help from the loans.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, meats, and Yanbal cosmetic products.

loans.name: Barrio 3 Group

texts.en:
In the romantic town of San Marcos La Laguna, a destination for tourists from all of the world and country of Guatemala, live the eight women of “Barrio 3”, or Neighborhood 3 Trust Bank. A group of women of Mayan origin who speak Tzutuhil, these ladies have deep roots in their beautiful home.

Micaela, a 26-year-old member of the trust bank who lives with her husband, cares for their two children: a 13-year-old daughter and a little 4-year-old son. The family is busy, as Micaela, with the assistance of her husband, manages her lakeside restaurant, specializing in traditional food. A visionary woman, Micaela plans to use her loan to invest in her current project opening a cafe where she will sell natural fruit juice. This includes buying a blender, glasses, disposable cups, fruit, sugar, and more products, such as food for her restaurant.

The members of Barrio 3 Trust Bank have seen profit in their businesses, and for good reason, are excited to continue receiving credits, hoping to see the resulting growth that will come in their lives, through the success of their businesses. Thank you Kiva!!

loans.use: to buy a blender, glasses, disposable cups, fruit, sugar, and more product for her restaurant.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is 45 years old and from Baggao, Cagayan. She is married and blessed with two children. One of the children is Shiena, who is in her second year studying for her Bachelor of Science in Industrial Engineering. She wants to finish her studies and help her family to improve their life. To help send Shiena to college, Patricia wants to request an education loan of PHP 150,000 from the Kiva lenders. She is hopeful that lenders will approve her loan for Shiena to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition fee.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a married woman who has three children. She describes herself to be faithful. She operates a farm where she grows maize and other crops. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to have a big cereals shop within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 50 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a business selling soft drinks and beers in the Philippines.

Mary Jane has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more cases of soft drinks and beers to sell. She has been in this business for two years. In the future, Mary Jane would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more cases of soft drinks and beers to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with no kids. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Fatuma operates a grocery stall selling vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of competition in her business.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita is requesting a loan of $ 1,000 to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as aqua, milk, noodles, cooking oils, eggs, cigarettes, detergents, salts, sardines, candies and other things to sell. She must have the type of items that people like. Rosita opened her kiosk a few years ago with her own working capital. She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin so that she could have more working capital to buy more goods. She also raises animals like pigs, dogs and cows.

loans.use: to buy aqua, milk, noodles, cooking oils, eggs, cigarettes, detergents, salts, sardines, candies and other things to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as loyal. She operates a farm where she grows maize. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in weather. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov, 32 years old, is a millstone seller who lives in Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham Province. She is a hardworking mother of two children who are enrolled in the primary school. Her husband also does millstones. This couple can make a net profit of approximately USD 13 a day.

During this time, Pov is facing a financial issue in her family. She needs some money to make the millstones to sell, but she can’t afford to. After getting to know that HKL provides loans with a lower interest rate, she has decided to apply for a KIVA loan to help them. She would like to thank to all lenders for their kindness.

loans.use: to make  millstones to sell.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Aida works hard to support her family.

She has a business direct-selling Avon products in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Aida is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more products from Avon to sell to her customers for her business direct-selling Avon products.

Aida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more products from Avon to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
As a parent of five children, Gloria works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and business buying and selling fruits and vegetables. Gloria is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Vyrene

texts.en:
Vyrene is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Vyrene is 35 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Vyrene has a business buying and selling silver jewelry in the Philippines. Vyrene requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more silver jewelry to sell.

Vyrene has been in this business for four years. In the future, Vyrene would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more silver jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Celedonia

texts.en:
Celedonia is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with 10 children.

She earns a living by farming coconut in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She supplements this income with earnings from farming rice.

Celedonia dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business and save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Annaliza works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Annaliza is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Annaliza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell

loans.name: Meng's Group

texts.en:
Meng, who is a farmer from Tbaung Khmum province, is 48 years old and married. He has three children, two of whom are dependent and too young to go to school. He has been growing cassava for 28 years to earn his main source of income. In order to add more income, he is growing paddy rice. He earns around USD 8 per day and can save approximately around USD 4 per day. Low cassava is the challenge to his business.

Meng has been with VisionFund for five cycles already and he has paid them completely. Leading a group of two members to get loans, he will use his loan to buy organic fertilizer and organic pesticide to boost crop yields. He hopes that he can increase his income, buy an additional plot of farmland and send his children to school.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and organic pesticide to boost crop yields in order to buy an additional plot of farmland and send his children to school.

loans.name: Nivrado

texts.es:
El sr. Nivardo es una persona activa, responsable y emprendedor que desea realizar un emprendimiento en producción de uva, para esto el Sr. Nivardo participo y aprobó el curso técnico básico en la carrera de producción de uva, estos cursos se realizan bajo el convenio de FAUTAPO y CEA THAQU THAQU, que son instituciones que brindan capacitación y apoyo a emprendimientos productivos en la región de Mizque. 
Actualmente por las mañanas el Sr. Nivardo trabaja como profesor de música por las tardes se dedica a la agricultura cultiva zanahoria y cebolla, aprendió desde niño sobre la agricultura por la afluencia de su padre. Su padre el Sr. Temis Tocles tiene plantaciones de uva de ahí le vino la curiosidad y el impulso de emprender en el negocio de producción de Uva, para esto invertirá en: la compra de plantas de uva, viguetas, alambres y otros para el cultivo de uva. Esta es una iniciativa de Nivardo quien está muy entusiasmado con el proyecto que tiene de producir uva y ofrecer al mercado su producto.
texts.en:
Nivardo is an active, responsible and enterprising person who wants to start a grape growing business. Toward this goal, Nivardo participated in and passed a basic technical course in grape production. These courses are conducted under the agreement of Fautapo and Thaqu Thaqu CEA, the institutions that provide training and support for productive enterprises in the Mizque region. 

Nivardo works in the morning as a music teacher, and in the afternoon he works farming carrots and onions. Since he was a boy, he has learned how to farm from his father. His father, Mr. Themis Tocles, has grape plantations, and that is how Nirvado became interested in taking on this business of growing grapes. For this reason, he will invest in purchasing grape plants, joists, wire, and other supplies for growing grapes.   

This is Nivardo's idea and he excited about this project to produce grapes and bring his to product to market.

loans.use: to purchase grape plants, joists, wire, and other supplies to grow grapes, bring his products to market, and generate better income.

loans.name: Erlina

texts.en: A 56-year-old woman named Erlina is selling dried fish in the market of Baybay, Leyte. She is married and has two adult children. Erlina has been selling dried fish for 15 years. It is the business that helps her and her husband raise their children. They earn a living through this business and it is their main source of income. That is why she wanted to improve this business for their sustainability. With the help of the funds she is requesting, she will be able to buy a box of dried fish that can increase her profit and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a box of dried fish.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 51 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by farming mangoes in the Philippines. Mila is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Mila has been farming mangoes for 10 years and also earns additional income from fruit vending. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Adeline

texts.en:
Adeline is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Adeline is 45 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Adeline has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines. Adeline requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers.

Adeline has been in this business for four years. Adeline would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta works hard to support her family. Julieta has a live-in partner and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Julieta requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Julieta has been in this business for four years now.

Julieta would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Roselie

texts.en:
Roselie works hard to support her family. Roselie is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Roselie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Roselie has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Roselie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Donthai Group

texts.en: Som is excited that the filter was available on an affordable payment plan.  Som and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years.  The water filter Som and her group purchased is guaranteed for two years but is known to function for up to five years.  Som and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for waterborne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Som and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Xeinglaetha Group

texts.en: Bounchan understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families.  Bounchan knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Bounchan purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.   Bounchan is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for two years, so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Xeinglaena Group

texts.en: Phanmaha’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Phanmaha and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.  Phanmaha and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years; within this two years filter users, like Phanmaha’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Nasomboon Group

texts.en: Khan’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Khan and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.  Khan and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years; within these two years filter users, like Khan’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Martinha

texts.en:
A $1,000 USD amount is offered to Martinha to improve her business. She has a small kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She wants to add more items according to people likes such as slippers, sugar, nuts, cigarettes, noodles, candies, soaps, salts, soft drinks and other things to sell. She has been involved in her business activities since 2010. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Martinha independent because she can be responsible for her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future, with the loan offered from Tuba Rai Metin.

loans.use: to buy slippers, sugar, nuts, cigarettes, noodles, candies, soaps, salts, soft drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
In spite of the obstacles that Avelina has encountered in her life, she still has the courage to go on and continue dreaming for her loved ones. Avelina is a mother of 10 children. Most of them have their own families, but she still needs to work hard for her school-aged child and her grandchild. Currently, she does a manicure and pedicure business to earn. She also sells food to the community aside from cleaning nails (refer to her business manicure and pedicure).

Thus, she is requesting a loan buy assorted nail polish and cuticle remover. She will also buy food ingredients such as cooking oil, sugar and flour. In the future, Avelina is thinking of other business opportunities that will enhance their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy nail polish and cuticle remover and also food ingredients such as cooking oil, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is a Kiva borrower who has four children. He describes himself to be reliable. He operates a retail business where he sells phone accessories, and printing paper. He has been involved in this business for two years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of phone accessories, and printing paper. He hopes that in the future, he will be selling phones. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of phone accessories and printing paper.

loans.name: Nafije

texts.en: Nafije is still working as a hairdresser but finally in her own salon. She was able to start working on her business after she renovated her house. She already has a lot of customers. She was able to create space in her home with the renovation and now she is requesting a loan to be able to fix her salon up well to attract more clients and create a pleasant atmosphere that her clients will enjoy. She promises to once again pay on time and thanks all of the lenders for their continued support.

loans.use: to be able to fix her salon up well to attract more clients and create a pleasant atmosphere.

loans.name: Zekirja

texts.en: Zekirja is 28 years old and single. He earns a living by installing and fixing blinds that block out the sunlight. He also is involved in agricultural work, keeping cows to sell their milk. He is very hardworking, working long hours and days with little salary, but he dreams of one day having a big private company of his own. Recently, he had to sell his cow to use the money for unexpected family expenses. Now he is requesting a loan to be able to purchase another cow and continue to sell the milk and dairy products. He hopes that in the near future he will be able to have a small farm and add more cows and calves. He is very ambitious and hopes to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to purchase another cow and continue to sell the milk and dairy products

loans.name: Nazmi

texts.en: Nazmi is married and has a nine-month-old daughter. In order to earn a living, he works making decorations for walls. He has a lot of clients, especially those that are building new homes. He is able to travel to wherever his client is with his equipment and is planning to have a workshop in the near future and expand his business. He is very talented and enjoys his work, having gained experience in the past by working under someone else. Nazmi needs a loan in order to buy material for his work. He promises to pay on time and looks forward to the opportunities from the loan.

loans.use: to buy material for his work.

loans.name: Kusuma's Group

texts.en:
Kusuma is a 30-year-old married woman living with her two children and her husband in a village of Odisha, India. She has a small vegetable shop at her house from which she earns 2,000 INR per month. Her children are studying. Her shop is the only shop for the 50 to 60 families living near her house in the village. She says that she feels good about making some daily household needs accessible to her customers without them having to travel far.

She plans to start a grocery shop where she will sell grains, lentils, rice, wheat etc. for which she, along with her group member, has requested a loan of 30,000 INR. She will use her 40% of the loan to buy more rice and stock up for the monsoon season. There is a lot of demand for rice during this season as there is not enough stock available in the market. Kusuma's dream is to see her children continue school and give them a quality life.

She is the one standing on the left hand side in the photograph.

loans.use: to add more stock of rice for resale.

loans.name: Mensur

texts.en: Mensur is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for his previous loan which he used to renovate his house and improve the living conditions of his family. He is still working as an accountant and working with his brother in the family business of installing electricity. His business gets a lot of requests for work, helping them to remain busy and generate a decent income for his family. Since they are mobile workers and travel anywhere there is a need, he is able to satisfy many customers in a large area. At this time Mensur is requesting a loan to purchase materials for electrical work. He hopes soon to have a workshop and to be able to expand his business even more. He is grateful for the opportunity once again and the continued support.

loans.use: to purchase materials for electrical work

loans.name: Mwananchi Group

texts.en:
Gerwalda is in his late 30s and is single with no children. He has been running a retail shop for three years now. He works from 7:30 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Gerwalda's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase his shop inventory and has paid back all his loans successfully. He used the profit to take care of his family and himself, to repay loan, to reinvest in business and to cover household expenses. He will use this loan to restock the out-of-stock items in his retail shop. He dreams of expanding his shop into a supermarket.

Gerwalda will share this loan with his loan group Mwanachi, which has seven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out-of-stock items in his retail shop.

loans.name: Tap

texts.en: Tap is a 33-year-old married father with three children living in a village in the Takeo Province of Cambodia. Tap and his wife sell water for home use. Beside this, they also set traps to catch crickets to sell. Three of his children are students. Together, they can earn approximately $15 a day. To improve his family’s finances, Tap would like to request a loan to buy a motorcycle with a trailer to carry water to sell in his village. This loan will help him to earn more income to improve his family’s living. For his future plans, he is going to build a new proper house for living and support his children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle with a trailer to carry water to sell in his village.

loans.name: Mariegene

texts.en:
Mariegene is 29 years old and still single. She is now focusing to manage her retailing business. Mariegene has a grocery business in the market. She has one assistant to serve their customers better. She has been in this line of business for eight years and hopes to expand it while operating.

Mariegene is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy grocery items to sell. She will do her best and manage well the business for the growth of it. She will use her earnings to purchase farmland for an additional source of income.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one child.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. and is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She supplements this income with earnings from selling vegetables.

Carmen dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives at her house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Sobpeang Group

texts.en: Seethong is excited the filter was available on an affordable payment plan.  Seethong and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years. The water filter Seethong and his group purchased is guaranteed for two years but is known to function for up to five years.  Seethong and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for waterborne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Seethong and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Gjynejt

texts.en:
Gjynejt is engaged and lives in the southern part of Kosovo. He is a businessman and earns a living through his private business selling paper for printing, and supplying the different printing businesses in the whole Kosovo region. He is able to purchase paper at a cheap price and sell it for a profit and has a lot of demand.

He is very satisfied with his income and work, and for the first time he is requesting a loan in order to purchase more paper to sell. His goal in the future is to have his own printing company. He is very grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase more paper to sell.

loans.name: Blerim

texts.en:
Blerim is 23 years old, single, and working in construction to support his family and earn a living. He is the main source of income for his family, as his father is sick and unable to work. In order to be able to provide for his family, he had to stop his studies and work for a living. His work typically involves various types of construction and painting and facade work. He gained his experience working for others and hopes that he will be able to expand his business soon.

He is requesting a loan in order to purchase new working tools. He knows that this will help him to be able to do better work at a faster rate and satisfy his customers even more. He is very grateful for the opportunity and thanks all of the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new working tools for his construction business.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en: Aurelia opened her business a few years ago. She started her business with her own working capital. She also cultivates animals like pigs, chickens and cows. Aurelia is married, and her husband is very supportive of her doing business. Aurelia has a business shop in her house. She is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to buy additional supplies including biscuits, hand and body lotion, cigarettes, shampoo, noodles, cooking oils, detergents, hard drinks and other things to sell. She is happy because with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin she can grow her business in the future and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, hand and body lotion, cigarettes, shampoo, noodles, cooking oils, detergents, hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Kulwa

texts.en:
Kulwa is in her early 40s and is married with three children. Two of the children are grown up and one of them is still in school. She has been selling second-hand clothes since 1995. She works from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Kulwa's 12th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her second-hand clothes stock and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is doing great with the loan. She will use this loan to buy top-quality second-hand clothes and meet her customers' requirements. She dreams of owning a big second-hand clothes shop.

Kulwa will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy top-quality second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hair accessories and clothes.

loans.name: Malonie

texts.en: Malonie is a hardworking father of two children. He is also adorable to his grandchildren. Malonie has engaged in buying and selling of banana fruits in different villages from the time he got married up to the present. He started the business with a small amount of capital and he strives to grow the business. Malonie still wants to grow the business and earn greater income. Because of this, he is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy bananas to export to another town. He wishes to maintain good health in order to be able to manage the business to attain his business goals.

loans.use: to buy bananas to export to another town.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is a single woman. She has two children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use. Her business goal is to open a beauty college within five years. She hopes that in the future she will educate her children to university level. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use

loans.name: Fortunata Rhodora

texts.en:
Fortunata Rhodora is 33 years old and married with three children. She runs a general store in her village and wants to continue improving her sales and use the profit as revolving capital. Fortunata Rhodora wants to buy more merchandise, which is why she is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, and other grocery items to sell.

In the future, Fortunata Rhodora would like to keep selling goods and save money for emergencies.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, and other grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 45 years old and married with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Janet has a fishing business in the Philippines. Janet requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Janet has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Janet would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Huch's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Kampong Cham province, Huch is 37 years old. She is married with three dependent children, one of whom is in school. Growing rice on a hectare area of farmland for 19 years is her family's main business. Sometimes she works for others for a fee to supplement income. Around USD 10 is earned every day and Huch can manage to save around USD 8 each day.

In a group of three members, Huch is the group leader. She will use her loan to buy organic fertilizer to boost crop productivity. She dreams of expanding her business so as to better support her children’s studying.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to boost crop productivity so that she can support her children’s studying.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Remzije

texts.en:
Remzije is a mother of three children and works on her small farm in an Ashkali community. She has also adopted a baby whose mother died. Her family is very poor and her husband works transporting goods.

She used to keep cows, but is now only keeping goats, selling the milk and cheese to supply income to her family. She works very hard and is requesting a loan in order to renovate her stable, since it is very old. She is very thankful for the support and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to renovate her stable since it is very old.

loans.name: Minavere

texts.en:
Minavere is a mother of three children; one boy and two girls. (The picture is Minavere with her husband and her son). She works together with her husband in their family business, installing flooring in new homes and buildings. Minavere helps her husband to clean the machine and register the clients.

They are very happy that their company does well, and they are able to support their family through it since they have a lot of customers and demands. Minavere hopes to expand their company, and for the first time is requesting a loan to purchase a new machine for their work. She believes that this investment will help them to be able to provide better quality services and customer satisfaction.

loans.use: to purchase a new machine for their work.

loans.name: Vetim

texts.en:
Vetim is 39 years old with a daughter and comes from the western part of Kosovo. He has his own business repairing vehicles and works all day long as the main source of income for his family. He has a lot of customers, which helps him to be able to earn a good salary to provide for his family.

He is asking for a loan in order to renovate his workshop as he has not had the opportunity to do so and the roof is in need of repairs for the wet and cold winter season. He hopes that this loan will help him to be able to continue his work and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to renovate the roof of the workshop

loans.name: Qendrim

texts.en:
Qendrim is a loyal customer who has borrowed twice before in the past. For this third time, he is requesting a loan for his business selling ice cream in the summer and chestnuts in the autumn and winter. His business has been going very well and he has been satisfied with the loans, the results and his business for some time now.

This time, Qendrim is requesting a loan to renovate and expand his storage area/shop where he keeps the materials he uses for his sales. He hopes to expand his business in the near future to include an additional city to sell in. He promises to pay on time and continue to be a good client.

loans.use: to expand his storage area/shop where he keeps the materials he uses for his sales

loans.name: Bac's Group

texts.en:
Bac, 45 years old, is a Thai ethnic man. He currently lives with his wife, his daughter and his son in Thuan Chau district, Son La province. His family’s main income is from the married couple. After deducting all costs and repayments, the remaining amount is not much. One of his children is at a college and one is at senior high school. He wants to invest more in his children’s education but he does not have enough money to do it. Therefore, he wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

He will find an extra job to work to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time. He hopes that the loan will help his children have good learning conditions, and then when they graduate they will have a good job with a stable salary.

loans.use: to invest more in his children’s education

loans.name: Coi's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Coi, is a Kinh ethnic majority woman. She joined the program of M7-MFI’s forerunner in January 2000. She currently lives with her husband in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main occupation is cultivation and breeding. The annual income is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and save a small amount. She intends to repair her house but the saved amount is not enough to buy material for repairing her house. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time, and she hopes that the loan amount will help her family have a clean and spacious house.

loans.use: to buy material for repairing her house

loans.name: Kany's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé depuis novembre 2012,rassemble des membres qui habitent le même village et ont comme activité le petit commerce.

Kany qui se trouve à l'extrême droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la représentante du groupe,elle est âgée de 45 ans,est mariée et mére de 02 enfants dont une fille.

Son activité est le commerce de légumes,elle vend des choux,de la carotte,de l'aubergine,de l'igname,du manioc.
Elle s'approvisionne à koungheul pour venir revendre chez elle et les villages environnants.

Avec le crédit,elle va acheter 02 sachets de carottes pour une valeur de 30000f,50 kg de choux à 200f le kg,100 kg d'igname à 25000f,100kg d'aubergine à 300f le kg et supporter 5000f pour le transport de la marchandise.

Le bénéfice servira à payer la nourriture et les frais de santé de la famille.
texts.en:
This group has been created in November 2012. Its members live in the same village and work as vendors. Kany, the one on the far right raising her hand in the photo, is 45 years old, married, and the mother of two children: a daughter and a son. Her business is selling vegetables such as cabbage, carrots, eggplant (aubergine), yam, cassava (manioc). She stocks up in Koungeul and sells from home and in the nearby villages.

With this loan, Kany will buy two bags of carrots for 30,000 West African francs; 50 kg [110 lbs] of cabbage at 200 francs per kilo; 100 kg [220 lbs] of yams for 25,000 francs; and 100 kg [220 lbs] of aubergine at 300 francs per kilo. She will also cover 5,000 francs of transportation costs. Her revenues will pay for her family's food and healthcare expenses.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Nit

texts.en: Nit is 20 years old, and a single freshman who resides in the Battambang Province in Cambodia. He is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in finance and banking at a university in the province. His parents are rice farmers and they depend on faming as revenue. Nit has decided to take out a loan because he is short of the money to cover his university fees from the first to the fourth year. This loan will help him to successfully earn a bachelor’s degree. After graduation, he dreams of having a proper job with a reasonable salary and he also wants to save money to build his own house. If he has children, he wants his children to study to pursue a bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to cover his university fees from the first to the fourth year

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.en:
Ermelinda is requesting a loan of $800 to improve her business. She is selling gasoline because she earns a good income from this business. She lives near the main road and every day many people come to buy her gasoline, so she is still happy to do her business. She also sells in the market on market day. Ermelinda has been involved in business activities for a few years. She started with her own working capital of $500.

When Tuba Rai Metin offered the loan to her, she said she will use this loan to improve her management of her business in order to run a bigger business in the future. She is taking this loan because she wants to buy more gasoline.

loans.use: to buy gasoline.

loans.name: Horn's Group

texts.en:
A 52-year-old woman, Horn is a resident living in Kampong Cham province. She has four children, one of whom is under the age of school. She is a farmer growing rice to earn her main source of income. To add more income, she works for others for fees too.

This is the second time for her with VisionFund. Her past loan helped her to upgrade their standard of living. In a group of four members, she is the group leader, and will use her loan to buy organic fertilizer to enrich her farmland so that she can get more yields. She hopes she can expand her rice growing business and to send her school-aged children to school.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to enrich farmland to get more yields, to send her school-aged children to school.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a manicure and pedicure business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fattening pigs.

Marita is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF in order to buy new tools and equipment for her manicure/pedicure business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment.

loans.name: Thapachom Group

texts.en: Intong understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families.  Intong knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Intong purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    Intong is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for two years, so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Gioi's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Gioi, 46 years old, is a Kinh ethnic majority woman. She lives with her daughter, her son-in-law and a child of her daughter in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main occupation is breeding and cultivation. The annual income from selling several pig herds after deducting costs is just enough to cover the family's living expenses and to save a small amount. She intends to buy a breeding pig to raise but the saved amount is not enough to do this. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan will help her family invest in breeding effectively, and that selling the next pig herd will bring her family a considerable profit. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to buy a breeding pig to raise.

loans.name: Parkphanang Group

texts.en: Bounmee’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Bounmee and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.  Bounmee and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years; within this two years, filter users, like Bounmee’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food to sell

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a 74-year-old retail shop proprietor in Kenya. He is a father of two adults. His wife provides for additional income, and for the past sixteen years he has been doing well in this business.

This is William's fourth loan from VisionFund to finance his asset purchase. He will use the money to purchase a motorcycle for additional profit and use the anticipated profit to repay his loan and purchase a second motorcycle. He hopes to own a fleet of several motorcycles in the future.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
From Talisay City, Cebu, here is Erlinda, a 57-year-old entrepreneur. According to her, she wants to live a peaceful life and see herself worthy in the sight of God. She tries to be honest in all undertakings, including management of her business. She runs a variety store and sells personal care products from Avon. Just like other business owners, she also experiences stiff competition and lack of capital. Besides, she has many debtors who just fled and left behind their debts. Sometimes her honesty and consideration for others doesn’t always come back to her. This faith-testing situation hampers the continuous operation of her business, and consequently affects her income.

Now she is the one who needs additional capital of PHP 50,000, which she can use to buy added items for sale in her variety store. She will also buy additional products from Avon such as cosmetics and toiletries. Her profits can supplement her husband, Aude’s, income as a construction painter. They are both working hard to support their three children who are still studying. Later on she plans to put up another store beside her grandmother’s house, where she can also entice more customers. She will be relieved of her children’s educational expenses soon, and she aspires to improve her store and convert it into a mini-mart.

She regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more Avon products such as cosmetics and toiletries, plus added items for sale in her variety store.

loans.name: Manjusha's Group

texts.en:
Manjusha, 34 years old, is a widow from a small village in Umred, Maharashtra, India. She is the one standing to the right in the photograph. She lives with her elder brother and sister-in-law in their house and has one daughter in her care. For the last five years, she has been engaged in weaving clothes. She has inherited this from her ancestors as this was her family's business. She earns a pretty good amount of money from this business and has a very large customer base.

Manjusha is a very ambitious lady who has never looked back. Her high aspirations and dreams have always helped her in moving forward in life, overcoming all the hurdles.

She, along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR.
