She will use her portion of the loan amount to repair her weaving machine, which is not working properly and is causing a delay in processing her orders, and the other part of the loan amount will be used to purchase raw materials for her weaving business like colourful threads, ribbons, needles, etc.

Manjusha dreams of opening a boutique someday and attracting the attention of premium segments of customers.

loans.use: to repair her weaving machine and to purchase raw materials like colourful threads, ribbons, and needles.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 51 years old, married, and has two children.

Fatima is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Fatima requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Fatima has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Fatima would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.en:
Ermelinda is 37 years old. She is married and is a business women. She is applying for a loan of $ 1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business.

Ermelinda has a shop selling second-hand clothes. She sells in the market. Ermelinda has been involved in business activities since a few year ago. She started with her own working capital. She is earning a good income from her business because she is selling in center of the market, so many people like to buy it. She is still happy to do her business.

Ermelinda is taking this loan because she wants to buy more clothes such as jackets, shirts, turtleneck shirts, long-sleeve shirts, short-sleeve dresses, children's clothes and other clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nga's Group

texts.en:
Nga, 27 years old, is aThai ethnic man living with his wife and his son in Mai Son district, Son La province. His family’s main income is from his and his wife’s civil service salary. Their income after deducting all costs and payments is just enough to cover the living expense for the family and to save a small amount.

Nga is studying at a university but he does not have enough money to pay for the education fee for the next term. Therefore, he wants to borrow a loan for this purpose. He will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time, and he hopes that the loan amount will help him have good condition for studying in order to have a good and stable income.

loans.use: pay for his education fee.

loans.name: Quang's Group

texts.en:
Quang, 32 years old, is a Thai ethnic man. His family consists of four members, including his wife, his son and his daughter. His family is living in Thuan Chau district, Son La province. His family’s main income is from cultivation and animal breeding, and the income after deducting cost is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and also to save a small amount.

Quang intends to raise breeding goats but he does not have enough money to invest in the breeding. Therefore, he wants to borrow a loan for this purpose. He hopes that the loan amount will help his family invest effectively in a breed with high productivity, and next year the breeding goats will bring his family a herd of baby goats.

loans.use: to raise breeding goats

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Ella es una joven ama de casa que actualmente esTa laborando, después de su embarazo presento problemas de descalsificación por lo que requiere un tratamiento urgente para poder reforzar su dentadura, desafortunadamente no cuenta con los recursos suficientes para solventar el gasto.
texts.en:
She's a young homemaker who currently works.

After her pregnancy she had problems with decalcification, so she needs urgent treatment to strengthen her teeth. Unfortunately she doesn't have adequate resources to cover the expense.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment

loans.name: Tien's Group

texts.en:
Tien, born in 1971, is a Thai ethnic man. His family consists of four members, including his wife, his son and his daughter. They are living in Thuan Chau district, Son La province. His family’s main occupation is cultivation and animal breeding.

The income after each harvest is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and paying for his two children’s education fees. Tien wants to buy a breeding cow but he does not have enough money. Therefore, he wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

Tien hopes that this loan amount will help his family have money to invest well in breeding, and then in the coming time, the breeding cow will bring his family lovely calves.

loans.use: to buy breeding cow.

loans.name: Huong's Group

texts.en: Huong is a Thai ethnic woman living with her husband and her two lovely daughters in Mai Son district, Son La province.  Her family’s main income is from her and her husband’s civil salary, so the income can just cover the living expense of the family and also save a small amount. However, the saved amount is not enough to pay her children’s education fees and to buy learning tools for them. Therefore, Huong wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.  She hopes that the loan amount will help her children have good condition for learning, and then they will have a bright future.

loans.use: to pay her children’s education cost

loans.name: Tadong Group

texts.en: Khamdeang is excited that the filter was available on an affordable payment plan.  Khamdeang and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the cost of treating the local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  The water filter Khamdeang and his group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Khamdeang and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne diseases. And after totaling up the costs, Khamdeang and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to buy TerraClear water filters for safe drinking water.

loans.name: U's Group

texts.en:
U is a Thai ethnic man. His family consists of three members, including his wife and his son. They are living in Thuan Chau district, Son La province. His family’s main income is from his salary, and the income is just enough to cover food for the family. U has to find a part-time job to get more additional income for his family and to pay for his son’s educational fee. He wants to borrow a loan to invest in his son’s education.

U hopes that this loan amount will help his son have good condition for studying, and when his son graduates from the university, he can have good job with a stable income. U will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to pay for his son's education.

loans.name: Lark 10 Group

texts.en:
Khenkong understands the difference a water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families. Khenkong knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption, and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources. The water filter Khenkong purchased will increase his family’s disposable income, by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.

Khenkong is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for two years, so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so he can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan was able to sustain her store through the tireless support of Kiva and its lenders. This has encouraged her to be more diligent in growing her business and is forever thankful for your help.

Once again she trusts that you could lend her funds in the amount of Php 30000 to refill her store with more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles which she sells at retail. Her store means a lot to her since it has been her source of income to fund her family's basic needs and send her college child to school. Although at times her sales is low she maintains her pleasant disposition that things will get better in no time. She is hopeful for your positive response.

Susan's priceless dream is to see her children earn a college degree as this is their path to improve their quality of life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items like toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Minh

texts.en:
Mr Minh is 35 years old and he is married. He has been working in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years. Minh lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
His family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. And the income from this business is not high enough to do what he really needs to comfort his life.


One of the most critical difficulties that concerns him is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase cement, sand, brick and equipment to build a new toilet and bathroom.

Minh joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve his business. He hopes that this loan could make his little dream come true.
In the future, Minh hopes for his business to do well, and for his family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, brick and equipment to build a new toilet and bathroom.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 42 years old and married with five children, four children are still in school, Marites works very hard to provide for them.

Marites runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, snack foods etc.

Marites has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Marites would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, snack foods etc.

loans.name: Véronique

texts.fr: Mariée, Véronique a 22 ans, son mari est menuisier. Le couple a un enfant scolarisé dans une école privée. Elle gère seule son activité de magasin général : approvisionnement et vente des produits. Son objectif est de pouvoir reprendre  ses études à l’université et suivre une formation professionnelle pour rechercher un emploi beaucoup plus rémunérateur en espérant que la constitution d’une épargne suffisante lui permettra de réaliser son projet. Véronique était vendeuse après ses études, après l’obtention d’un diplôme de baccalauréat. Le petit magasin a débuté en 2014 dans un local en bois qui lui appartient. Elle a obtenu le premier crédit en 2014. Elle ne cesse pas d’améliorer l‘activité, la construction en dur du local est en cours pour servir d’un point de vente. L’objectif est de diversifier les produits vendus et de disposer un stock en quantité suffisante et de qualité pour son activité de vente de produits de première nécessité.
texts.en: Veronique is 22. Her husband is a carpenter. They have one child who attends a private school. She manages her grocery business by herself: the stocking up and sale of the produce. Her goal is to be able to return to her university studies and to follow professional training so that she can find a much better paid job. She hopes that saving up a sufficient amount of money will enable her to achieve her goal. Veronique was a saleswoman after her studies, having obtained a baccalaureate. She started the little shop in a wooden structure that belongs to her. She obtained her first loan in 2014. She improves her business constantly, she is in the process of replacing the wooden structure with a bricks and mortar construction that she will use as the shop. She hopes to diversify the products she sells, and have sufficient stock of good quality for her business selling basic necessities.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of rice , 1 sack of sugar, 2 cans of cooking oil, 2 cartons of soap, 1 carton of candles.

loans.name: Islim

texts.en:
İslim is married with 3 children.  She makes “kibbeh” (a traditional meal) and sells to the restaurants.  With her first loan, she bought a freezer.  She can store her products ready in the freezer and meet the orders easily.  This really has been helpful for her business.  With her second loan, she will replace her broken deep fryer and some supplies.  And frying kibbeh will be a lot easier saving time.  She will also make a bulk purchase to increase her profit.  She want to open a small shop.
Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
İslim hanım evli, üç çocuk annesi.  İçli köfte yapıp lokantalara satış yapıyor.  ilk kredisi ile difriz dolap almış. Köftelerini yapıp burada muhafaza ediyor ve siparişler geldiğinde hazır olan içli köftelerini satıyor.  Bu da işini daha kolaylaştırmış.  Aldığı ikinci kredi ile bozulan fritözünün yerine yeni bir fritöz  ve malzeme alacak.  Kızartma işi kolaylaşıp zaman dan kazanacak.  Halden toplu mal alarak da karını arttıracak.  Kendine ait ufak bir dükkanı olsun istiyor.

loans.use: to buy a new fryer for making kibbeh and some supplies

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El señor Francisco de 65 años de edad  vive con su esposa y tiene casa propia,  vive en la Ciudad de Nacaome Valle y se dedica desde hace 10 años a la  compra y venta de pan,  sus clientes son todos los amigos y vecinos de su comunidad.
Don Francisco es un hombre trabajador y  honesto,  tiene muchos deseos de salir y está solicitando el préstamo para compra de pan como semitas, polvores, pan blanco, chiguenes, etc. Con el apoyo del préstamo pretende surtir y mejorar su negocio y obtener los ingresos necesarios para poder salir adelante con su familia.
Su sueño es que en su próximo préstamo pueda realizarle mejoras a su vivienda.

San Lorenzo,  Honduras - Septiembre 2015.
texts.en:
Francisco is 65 years old and lives with his wife in a house they own. He lives in the city of Nacaome Valle and has made a living by buying and selling bread for the last ten years. His customers are all his friends and neighbors in his community. Francisco is a hardworking and honest man. He has a great desire to get ahead, and he is asking for the loan to buy bread like cookies, shortbread, white bread, "chiguenes", etc. 

With the support of the loan he intends to stock and improve his business, and obtain the earnings necessary to be able to get ahead with his family. His dream is that he will be able to do improvements on his home with his next loan.

San Lorenzo,  Honduras - September 2015.

loans.use: to buy cookies, shortbread, white bread, "chiguenes", etc. for his business

loans.name: Senghor's Group

texts.en:
Senghor, who is 31 years old, lives in Mondulkiri province. She has two dependent children, one of whom is in school while the other is still too young to attend. For years she has farmed cassava to earn an income. She also will work for others to earn extra money.

Senghor decided to form a group of five members to apply for loans from VisionFund Cambodia. As leader she has applied for a 8,400,000 KHR loan to be apportioned among her group members. She will use her own share to buy organic fertilizer to improve her cassava yields.

Senghor hopes that she can upgrade the family’s standard of living and keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to improve her cassava yields.

loans.name: Nihal

texts.en:
Nihal is married and a mother of two. Her children are babies so she doesn’t work.

A year and a half ago Nihal started to make and sell wedding ornaments and candies in order to contribute to the family’s budget and utilize her free time at home. She has her own website and gets most of her orders online.

Nihal has taken out and repaid two previous loans through Kiva's field partner Maya. She has now applied for a 1,500 TRY loan to buy materials in bulk to make her merchandise. Her aim is to open a store on her own and become a known brand.

--Translated from Turkish by Maya’s staff

Nihal hanım evli iki çocuk annesi. Çocukları küçük olduğundan çalışamıyor. Evine maddi katkı sağlamak ve boş durmamak için nikah şekerleri ve süsleme işine başlamış. Bir buçuk sene önce başladığı nikah, bebek, mevlüt sekerleri, süsleme işine devam ediyor. Kendine ait internet sitesinden yaptığı ürünlerini sergiliyor ve siparişlerinin çoğunu internet üzerinden alıyor. Aldığı üçüncü kredi ile ürün alacak. Hedefi bir dükkan açmak ve marka olmak.

loans.use: to buy materials in bulk to make her wedding ornaments and candies to sell.

loans.name: Napangkang Group

texts.en:
Bounthor is the leader of the Napangkang Group and is shown here with its members. His village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams and collected rainwater. This water, however, is not safe to drink without boiling and if not treated can bring about illnesses that have a bad impact on the villagers’ health and budgets.

Bounthor and his group are now borrowing 2,590,000 LAK through Kiva's field partner TerraClear to buy water filters for their families. They are happy that the filters are available on a payment plan that makes them much more affordable. The filters are guaranteed for two years, which should result in a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

For Bounthor, treating drinking water has always meant spending valuable time, cash and effort. Now he can shift that time to other pursuits.

loans.use: to buy a water filter for his family.

loans.name: Grettel

texts.es:
Grettel tiene 46 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto año del colegio, vive con su esposo y 2 hijos menores de edad, uno está en el colegio y el mayor en la Universidad. Llegó a Fundación Mujer por referencia de una clienta, quien tiene una panadería y ha trabajado con esta institución desde el año 2004.
Grettel  está solicitando su sexto crédito y ha tenido una excelente conducta de pago.
La clienta se dedica al comercio de ropa de hombre, mujer y niño desde hace más de 10 años, ella trabaja con su esposo quien se dedica también al comercio, su herramienta principal es el vehículo, el cual utilizan para el transporte de mercadería y el cobro.
Entre sus labores diarias esta la visita a sus clientes, recoger pedidos y atender las labores del hogar. Una de sus metas es realizarse como comerciante y poner un local en la zona céntrica de Puntarenas, ciudad de la costa pacífica de Costa Rica, donde ella reside.
El beneficio con el crédito sería enorme, ya que va a adquirir mercadería para la temporada de verano, que es una época importante para el comercio en la zona costera de Costa Rica. Negocio estable, con más de 8 años, buenas referencias de crédito y de sus proveedores, atiende un mercado regional, donde atiende más de 50 clientas. Busca ofertas de liquidación para mejorar los ingresos de su negocio. Cuenta con los medios para distribuir su mercadería, cuenta con una urna en su casa, donde recibe a clientes.
texts.en:
Grettel, 46, studied up to the fourth year of high school. She lives with her husband and two minor children, one of whom is in high school and the other in college. She went to Fundación Mujer on the recommendation of a client who has a bakery and has worked with this institution since 2004.

Grettel is requesting her sixth loan and she has had an excellent payment record.

She has earned a living selling men's, women's, and children's clothing for more than 10 years. She works with her husband, who also works in the business. Her main tool is the vehicle they use to transport merchandise and collect payment.

Among her daily tasks is visiting her customers, taking orders, and tending to her household chores. One of her goals is to become a shopkeeper and set up an establishment in downtown Puntarenas, a city of the Pacific coast of Costa Rica, where she lives.

The loan would be enormously beneficial because she's going to acquire merchandise for the summer season, an important time for sales on the coast of Costa Rica. The business is stable, with more than eight years, good credit references from her providers, and a regional market where she has more than 50 customers. She looks for liquidation offers to improve her business income. She has the means to distribute her merchandise and a display case in her house, where she sees her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing for women, men, and children.

loans.name: Napangtha Group

texts.en: Liab understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families. He knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Liab purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    Liab is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Bonifacia Group

texts.es: El grupo Bonifacia conformado por 3 mujeres que han demostrado ser fieles clientes de nuestra institución, del cual actualmente solicitan crédito para seguir invirtiendo en el crecimiento de sus micro negocios. Coordinado por Anielka, quien se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva para poder obtener ingresos económicos que le ayuden a sustentar a su adorada familia. Este negocio lo tiene desde hace 7 años con el dinero que recogió de su trabajo anterior. Actualmente tiene a cargo la responsabilidad de un hijo de 8 años, quien ella y su acompañante desean brindarle un mejor futuro. Ahora el crédito lo desea invertir en la compra de camisas, blusas, pantalones para dama y caballeros. Las demás socias son Tomasita de 58 dedicada a la comercialización de venta de ropa desde hace 15 años y Bonifacia quien tiene una pulpería en su domicilio.
texts.en:
The Bonifacia group is made up of 3 women who have demonstrated that they are faithful clients of the institution. At present, they request a loan from this institution to continue investing in the growth of their small businesses.

The group is led by Anielka, who is dedicated to selling new clothing to be able to earn income that helps to sustain her loving family. She started this business 7 years ago with the money she saved from her previous work. At present, she is responsible for her 8-year-old son, to whom she and her partner want to offer a better future. The loan will be invested in buying shirts, blouses, and pants for women and men.

The other members are Tomasita, who is 58 years old and has sold clothing for 15 years, and Bonifacia, who has a grocery store in her home.

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, and pants for women and men.

loans.name: Vololonatoandro Blandine

texts.fr: Blandine a 42 ans, et est mariée, le conjoint est un receveur de taxi bus. Le nombre d’enfants est de six, tous scolarisés, dans des établissements publics, d’autres suivent leurs études dans des écoles privées. Devant les charges familiales à supporter: la scolarisation des six  enfants, notamment le paiement d’écolage dans les écoles privées, elle doit travailler dur et améliorer le revenu. La réussite de ses enfants dans leurs études et l’amélioration de leurs conditions de vie sont ses principaux soucis . Blandine a commencé par une activité de vente de légumes à l’âge de 22 ans  en 1995. La diversification des produits de l’activité de commerce a été sa stratégie. Disposant de 20 années d’expérience dans l’activité, elle vend aussi actuellement des chaussures d’occasion et des légumes. Le point de vente se trouve devant sa maison.
texts.en:
Blandine is forty-two years old and married. Her spouse is a taxi-bus driver. They have six children; some of them attend public schools, others study in private schools.

She faces family expenses for which she must provide, including sending the six children to school, especially given the education fee in private schools. She must therefore work hard and improve their revenues. Her children's success at school and the improvement of their living conditions are her main worries.

Blandine started by retailing vegetables when she was twenty-two, in 1995. Her strategy was to diversify what merchandise she sells. With twenty years of experience in her business, she also currently sells second-hand shoes and fruits. Her point of sale is located in front of her house.

loans.use: to buy one parcel of second-hand shoes, fruits, and vegetables.

loans.name: Delicias Del Valle Group

texts.es: Grupo ¨Delicias del valle¨ conformado por mujeres emprendedoras provenientes de la zona rural del país, luchando y solicitando crédito para seguir financiando sus negocios y así poder engrandecer y recibir mayores remuneraciones. Coordinado por María quien por 5to ciclo trabaja el crédito para invertirlo en compra de productos. Invertirá en la compra de zapatos, ropa para dama como blusas y pantalones igualmente para varón como pantalones y ropa de niños. Este negocio lo inicio desde hace 3 años con el dinero que recogió de su trabajo en zona franca. Yeri de 28 se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva desde hace 4 años y Maribel de 51  años destace de cerdo.
texts.en:
The "Delicias del Valle" group is made up of enterprising women who come from a rural part of the country. They are striving and requesting a loan to continue to finance their businesses and be able to grow and obtain more remuneration.

It is coordinated by María who in her fifth loan cycle who will work the loan to invest in purchasing products. She will invest in the purchase of shoes, woman's clothing like blouses and pants as well as men's pants and children's clothing. She started this business three years ago with the money she made in the Free Trade zone.

Yeri is 28 years old and has been selling woman's clothing for 4 years and Maribel is 51 and she butchers pigs.

loans.use: invest in buying shoes, woman's clothing like blouses and pants, men's pants and children's clothing.

loans.name: Los Tres Girasoles Group

texts.es:
Grupo “Los tres girasoles”, lo conforman 4 mujeres quienes formaron este grupo solidario para salir adelante y seguir emprendiendo, logrando obtener ingresos que le permitan mejorar sus condiciones económicas. Coordinado por Jeaneth de 38 años, acompañada, y con dos hijos de 3 y 8 años de edades respectivamente. Se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, cosméticos de manera ambulante y también tiene una mini pulpería en su domicilio. Estando 11 ciclos en ADIM, ahora requiere del crédito para la compra de cajas de jabón, pampers, arroz aceite, blusas y jeans para damas y caballeros. Gracias al crédito ha mejorado su negocio y confía en que seguirá adelante.
Las otras socias son Jessica de 29 años dedicada a la venta de cosméticos de la marca Arabela, y venta de ropa. Miladis 49 años también vende ropa, Escarleth de 32 años dedicada a la venta de ropa, cosméticos y calzados en su comunidad. Seguras de que seguirán unidas para defender sus negocios y a la vez ser cumplidas en los abonos del crédito.
texts.en:
The "Three Sunflowers" (Tres Girasoles) group is made up of 4 women who started this solidarity group to go forward and to earn income that will allow them to improve their financial conditions.

The group is coordinated by Jeaneth, who is 38 years old, married, and has two children, who are 3 and 8 years old. She is dedicated to selling new clothing and cosmetics as a street vendors, and she also has a small store in her home.

After 11 cycles with ADIM, she now needs a loan to buy boxes of soap, diapers, rice, oil, and blouses and jeans for women and men. Thanks to the loan, she has improved her business and trusts that she will go forward.

The other members are Jessica, who is 29 years old and sells Arabela cosmetics and clothing; Miladis, who is 49 years old and also sells clothing; and Escarleth, who is 32 years old and sells clothing, cosmetics, and shoes in her community. They are sure that they will continue together to defend their businesses and, at the same time, to comply with the loan installments.

loans.use: to buy boxes of soap, diapers, rice, oil, shirts, and jeans for women and men.

loans.name: Lluvia De Mayo Group

texts.es:
El grupo lluvia de mayo, está por segunda vez trabajando con los créditos de ADIM, siendo mujeres trabajadoras, unidas y fiadoras solidarias necesitan del crédito para los fortalecimientos de sus negocios. La líder del grupo es Mercedes de 50 años, soltera, quien desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, iniciando con el financiamiento de otra financiera. Requiere del crédito para comprar , ropa como blusas, jeans, faldas, zapatos nuevos, zapatos usados, así ofrecerlos a su variada clientela. Su hija le ayuda en el negocio distribuyendo productos en su trabajo, pudiendo así cubrir la demanda de sus clientas. 

Darling de 27 años, dueña de una pulperia en su hogar, Aminta de 50 años se dedica a la hecha y venta de tortillas y verduras. Irma de 64 años vende productos varios como planchas, blusas y jeans. Todas ellas integrantes del grupo.
texts.en:
The "May Rain" (Lluvia de Mayo) group is, for the second time, working with ADIM loans. The members are hard-working, united, and solid borrowers who need the loan to strengthen their businesses.

The leader of the group is Mercedes, who is 50 years old and single. For 4 years, she has been dedicated to selling new clothing, starting the business with a loan from another institution. She needs the loan to buy clothing, such as blouses, jeans, skirts, new shoes, and used shoes to offer a variety of products to her clients. Her daughter helps her in the business, by distributing products through her work. This is how she meets the demand of her clients.

The other members are Darling, who is 27 years old and owns a store in her home; Aminta, who is 50 years old and makes and sells tortillas and vegetables; and Irma, who is 64 years old and sells various products, such as irons, blouses, and jeans.

loans.use: to buy new shoes, used shoes, and clothing (blouses, jeans, and skirts) to offer variety to her clients.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a widow with three children. They live in a three-bedroom house in Bamenda, in the North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced difficulties in life, which are the sudden death of her husband and the death of her brother.

With her new loan, she will buy jewelries, body cream and soap and other chemicals for rubbing oil.

She is confident that this business will succeed because she has been in it for a long time. She has a good business site and many customers. With this business activity, the community will benefit from a reduced distance to go and buy in the market, and goods will always be available at all times.

With the profit made from this loan, she will cater for the family, diversify her business, and take care of her children’s education. She prefers a GHAPE loan because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and the sociability of members.

loans.use: to buy jewelries, body cream and soap and other chemicals for rubbing oil.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one child.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like a charcoal-retailing business.

Judy dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Vale La Pena Group

texts.es: Grupo ¨Vale la pena¨ provenientes del una comarca rural del país, integrados por personas emprendedoras y luchadoras, solicitando por 4 vez crédito para el progreso de sus actividades económicas. Aracely es quien coordina al grupo, tiene 24 años, ajuntada y madre de 3 hijos de edades 3,4 y 7 años, con la ayuda de su esposo se dedican a la venta de procederos de manera ambulante en el mercado. El crédito lo requieren para invertirlo en la compra por mayor de tomates, chiltomas, cebolla y papas, así lo podrán vender al detalle y las ganancias será mayor. confiando que seguirán invirtiendo en la buena educación de sus hijos. Las otras socias son Cecilia, de 36 años quien tiene una granja de pollo, Mayela de 20 años y Maria de 31 años, ambas dedicadas de manera ambulante a la venta de perecederos.
texts.en:
The “Vale la pena” group, which comes from a rural region of the country and is made up of enterprising and determined people, is requesting a loan for the fourth time for the progress of their economic activities.

Aracely is the coordinator of the group. She is 24 years old, lives with her husband, and is the mother of three children, ages 3, 4, and 7. With the help of her husband, they work selling perishable food items as street vendors in the market. They need the loan to invest in the purchase of tomatoes, chiltoma peppers, onions, and potatoes. That way, they will be able to sell them at retail, and their profits will be greater, giving them confidence that they can keep investing in their children’s education.

The other group members are Cecilia, age 36, who has a chicken farm; Mayela, age 20; and Maria, age 31, both of whom work as street vendors, selling perishable food items.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, chiltoma peppers, onions, and potatoes at wholesale.

loans.name: Hinkhok Group

texts.en:
Samlan’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.

Samlan and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.

Samlan and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years; within these two years, filter users, like Samlan’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs. One of the borrowers photographed is the guardian of the child in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: Don Gerardo, es uno de nuestro apreciable cliente, desde varios años ha solicitado créditos para el crecimientos de sus cosechas de diversos productos como maíz o frijoles. De 70 años, casado y estando con ADIM por 43 ciclos, solicita nuevamente crédito para la compra e inversión de sus cosechas, para la cosecha actual comprara maíz, urea, tierra y fertilizantes para que la calidad de su producción sea exitosa. Con los créditos anteriores expresa que han sido beneficioso porque siempre puede seguir creciendo y manteniendo el hogar.
texts.en: Gerardo, an esteemed client of ADIM, has requested loans for several years to grow his crops of diverse products, such as corn or beans.  He is 70 years old, married, and has been with ADIM for 43 loan cycles.  He is requesting a loan again to invest in his crops.  For this current harvest, he will buy corn, urea, soil, and fertilizer, so that his production quality will be a success.  He comments that the previous loans have been beneficial because that way he is always able to continue growing and providing for his household.

loans.use: to buy corn, urea, soil, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Vandana's Group

texts.en:
Vandana is 34 years old, standing to the left-hand side in the photograph, and she is a single mother who has business selling vegetables. She hails from the small village of Umred, Maharashtra, India. Through her business, she provides for herself, her two sons ages 9 and 10, and her two daughters ages 14 and 19. Santana, being a very hardworking woman, goes to work every day to provide for herself and her family.

In light of the necessity and demand that exists for her products, she along with her group member is requesting a loan of 30,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to buy tomatoes, cabbage, peppers, carrots, and onions among other vegetables to grow her business and make more profit in order to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, cabbage, peppers, carrots, and onions among other vegetables to grow her business

loans.name: Vibha

texts.en:
Vibha is a humble lady who hails from the Umred district of Maharashtra, India. She currently lives with her husband and her two daughters.

Her family’s main income is from the harvest that they get from their rice farmland, so the income is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family and a small amount of savings.

She wants to build a sanitation work for her house but she does not have enough money to buy materials. Therefore, she wants to take a loan for this purpose. She is requesting for a loan of 15,000 INR to build a toilet in her house which she currently lacks so as to increase her convenience.

She very much hopes that the loan amount will help her family have a clean sanitation work, which will make them feel more convenient and comfortable.

loans.use: to build a toilet in her house

loans.name: Indira's Group

texts.en:
Indira is a 33-year-old divorced lady living with her son, aged 6 years, and her old mother in a small village in Umred district, Maharashtra, India.

She owns and manages a tailoring shop where she stitches clothes for her customers when they place orders for stitching. She stitches salwars, blouses, and suits, all of which are Indian traditional dress clothing, for her customers.

She has one sewing machine in her shop. She has a very good relationship with her customers but she is not able to take orders in large amounts as she has only one sewing machine. She has a plan to purchase one more sewing machine for her shop and appoint another person as her helper so that she can take orders in bulk and satisfy her customers.

Indira and her group partner have applied for a loan amount of 30,000 India Rupees (INR) each. Indira will use her portion for purchasing a sewing machine and fabric, and for appointing a person as her helper in her shop.

She has a dream to have her son study in a good school and save some money for his higher studies. In the picture the lady standing in left is Indira.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and fabric

loans.name: Francisca Paula

texts.es: Francisca, de 43 años, soltera y madre de dos hijos de edades 18 y 20 años. Es dueña de una pulpería ubicada en su hogar, de ella extrae ganancias que le permiten mantener los gastos familiares y personales. Desde 7 años puso su negocio con dinero propio, y con la ayuda de sus hijas sigue en pie el negocio. Ahora requiere del crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite y maíz. Así tener en inventario mayor productos demás demanda por la clientela. En sus metas esta seguir progresando empresarialmente
texts.en:
Francisca, age 43, is single and the mother of two children, ages 18 and 20. She owns a convenience store, located in her home. From this, she obtains profit which allows her to cover her family and personal expenses. Seven years ago, she started up her business with her own money, and with the help of her daughters, she keeps the business running.

Now, she needs the loan to buy rice, sugar, oil, and corn. That way, she will have a greater inventory of products and other items demanded by her customers. Among her goals is to continue progressing as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, and corn.

loans.name: Nalu's Group

texts.en:
Nalu is a 24-year-old divorcee living with her parents and a child in Umred District of Maharashtra, India.The lady standing to the right hand side in the photograph is Nalu.

She is engaged in the activity of making and selling handmade wall hangings, cushion covers, paper bags, candles, purses, etc. She makes these items in her home and sells them to the dealers in the nearby market. Her father is not financially strong enough to manage the family, so she helps her father manage the family expenses.

Nalu, along with her group member, has requested a loan of 30,000 INR (Indian rupees), and she will use her portion for purchasing fabrics, colours, paper, glue, glitters, decorative glass, wax, etc., in bulk so that she can make her crafts in a large amount. She also wants to appoint one more person, who can assist her in the business and help her to make more of the products.

In the future, she wants to give training to the village girls about this art. She also has a dream of giving her parents a quality standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, colours, paper, glue, glitters, decorative glass, wax, etc., in bulk

loans.name: Elvira Rosa

texts.es: Doña Elvira, de 58 años, con la ayuda de su compañero se dedica a la venta de calzado. Desde hace 4 años, cuando tenía su propio taller y de los ingresos recibidos pudo comenzar a comercializar zapatos a otros países. Ahora se dedica a la compra-venta de calzados, y por primera vez solicita crédito a ADIM para comprar al por mayor y llevar variedad a su clientela, requiere de la compra de calzado para niños y niñas variados y calzados colegiales los cuales son los más demandados en estas temporadas.
texts.en:
Elvira is 58 years old. With her partner's help, she earns a living selling footwear.

For 4 years, she had her own studio and from the income she received, she was able to begin selling shoes to other countries. Now she earns a living buying and selling shoes. For the first time, she is requesting a loan from ADIM in order to buy wholesale and bring variety to her clientele. She needs to buy various boys' and girls' footwear and student shoes, which are in higher demand in these seasons.

loans.use: to buy various boys' and girls' footwear and student shoes, which are in higher demand in these seasons.

loans.name: Aigul

texts.ru: Айгул, 46 лет, в разводе, 2 сыновей. В качестве источника дохода для своей семьи, Айгул 16 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством. На участке мерою 1,0 Га выращивает кукурузу. Также есть 3 коровы и 5 овец. Бизнес Айгул приносит прибыль в размере около 16,000 сом (KGS). На данный момент она планирует расширить свою деятельность, поэтому обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от бизнеса Айгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Aigul is 46, divorced, and she has two sons.  She has been involved in agriculture and animal husbandry for 16 years and these two activities provide a source of income for her family.  She grows corn on one hectare of land and she also has three cows and five sheep.  Thanks to her farming business, she makes a (monthly) income of about 16,000 som (KGS).  At the moment, she wants to expand her activity, so for this reason she has turned to Kiva's partner, Bai Tushum bank.  She is taking a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy additional livestock.  Aigul is planning to use the earnings from her business to further expand her activity.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a Kiva borrower. She has two children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a farm where she keeps livestock and also grows watermelons. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy watermelon seedlings. She hopes that in the future she will educate her children to university level. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase another cow.

loans.use: to buy watermelon seedlings.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is married and has five children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a fruit and coconut-selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenges are high transportation costs to her place of operation.

With the 30,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of fruits and coconuts to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and coconuts to resell.

loans.name: Al Chahroura Group

texts.en:
Hiba is the featured borrower of Al Chahroura group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends, and they seek to improve their families' living conditions.

Hiba is the lady on the far right side of the picture. She is a 26-year-old married mother of one child, who is acquiring a loan to pay for his tuition. She has been working as a hairdresser for seven years and is seeking to develop her business properly.

The other two members' acquired loan will be invested for the same educational need, where Zeinab is the lady in the center, and Houda is the lady on the left.

loans.use: to pay for her child's school tuition.

loans.name: Paolina

texts.en:
Paolina is 66 years old. She is married with three children. She has had a selling of clothes business for 10 years.

She will be using the loan to purchase stock and hopes this will help her pay school fees. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to increase her business stock and have a better life.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell to help her pay school fees.

loans.name: Thol

texts.en:
Thol is 56 years old. She is a widowed mother and resides with four children in her care in the Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening animals for more than five years, earning approximately $3 a day. Two of her children are factory workers and another two children attend school. They make an income of $14 a day.

To improve her family finances, Thol is asking for a loan of $1,200 to buy cows to breed and sell for a profit. By doing so, she would be able to generate additional income for the family. In the future, she is going to support her youngest children to earn higher education.

loans.use: to buy cows to breed and sell for a profit

loans.name: Chorn's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of Cheung Prey district in Kampong Cham province, Chorn is 58 years old with three children. She earns income to support her family living via selling grocery items for 10 years and weaving mats to supplement her income. The main challenge in her family’s business is that there are fewer customers than before.

Chorn leads a group of four members to seek this first loan with VisionFund. As the leader of the group, she will spend her loan portion to buy more grocery items to improve her selling business to get more customers. She hopes that her business is improved and earns her more income to upgrade her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items to expand her selling business in order to get more income to support her family's living.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Ya's Group

texts.en:
Ya is 51 years old and a mother of three children living in Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province. She has grown rice as her main business to earn income to support her family’s living for 10 years. Moreover, she can get more income via snack selling. Her rice did not grow well because it was destroyed by insects.

This is first time for Ya with VisionFund, and she is a group leader of two members. She will manage her loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her farmland in order to get a better yield than last year. She dreams that her farming produces a higher yield with a decent income to upgrade her living condition better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to improve her farmland to produce good yield to expand her family's business better than last year.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is married with two school-going children. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a khanga (women's wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of a lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khangas (women's wrap cloth) for resale.

loans.name: Mary Jul

texts.en:
Mary Jul is a hardworking woman and entrepreneur with three children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Mary Jul dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a married man with 2 children. He describes himself as jolly.

He operates a retail business where he sells plastic chairs, water storage containers and other items. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals.

He explained that his biggest business challenge is low stock, so he will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of plastic chairs and water storage containers. His business goal is to have a wholesale shop within 5 years, and he hopes to be successful in the future.

This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank, and his previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of plastic chairs and water storage containers.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a widow with four children and lives in a two bedroom house in Bamenda Mezam Division in the Northwest Region of Cameroon. She has faced a lot of challenges in life, some of which were the death of her husband, the death of her father, and the collapse of her un-roofed house. She was advised to become a member in GHAPE by some friends, and has been a member for some time now and has taken and successfully repaid loans four times. 

With her new loan Gladys will buy tins of palm oil, seedlings foodstuffs to sell and pay for the clearing of her farm. She is very optimistic about this business succeeding because she has a good business site and has been in the business for a long time. The community will benefit from her activity in that they will not go long distances to buy things and everything will be available at all times.

The profit from this loan will help her to settle her bills, provide some basic food for the family, pay for her family’s medication and plough back some of the profit to pay for her children’s school fees. She prefers GHAPE loans because of the low interest rate, convenient repayment times and the sociability of members towards each other.

Gladys knows her business is going to succeed because she has been doing it for a long time, the demand for food is increasing and she has a good business site. With this business activity the community will benefit from quality food, moderate prices, reduction in distance to the market and food will be available at all times.

loans.use: to buy tins of palm oil, buy foodstuffs, buy seedlings and clear her farm.

loans.name: Ye's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Kampong Cham province, Ye is 23 years old and married. To support her family’s living expenses, she grows rice as her main source of income. As well as this, she can earn extra income by working as a laborer for others.

This year her rice did not produce a good yield because it was destroyed by insects. She has been involved with her business for 5 years, and she can save about 5 USD per day from her daily income.

In this group of four, Ye is the group leader and this is her first microloan with VisionFund. She will use her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and organic pesticide for her rice farm. She hopes that she can get a better yield than last year in order to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and organic pesticide for her rice farm in order to get a better yield than last year and more income for her family

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Pineay

texts.en:
Originally from Kandal province, Pineay is 35 years old and a father of one child.

His main sources of income, which he can support with his living conditions, are from rice cropping and working for others for a fee. He has been in this business for 10 years and he can save about 5 USD per day from his daily income. However, the price of rice is now lower than before, and this is his main challenge.

This is Pineay's second microloan with VisionFund and he fully paid back his past loan on time. He can get more yield from his farming than before because of his past loan.

Pineay will spend his entire loan portion on buying rice seed, fertilizer and organic pesticide for his farmland in order to get a higher yield. He hopes to be able to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and organic pesticide to support his farming, and to purchase more rice seed to plant on his farmland in order to gain more yield.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 60 years old, married and has four grown-up children.

Juliana sells different merchandise to earn income. She sells assorted items of household goods such as water jugs, pails, slippers and notebooks. She wants to keep offering more products but she had insufficient funds, and that is why she is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy school supplies, household wares and slippers to sell.

Juliana hopes to save money for emergency needs because she is also getting older.

loans.use: to buy school supplies, household wares and slippers to sell.

loans.name: Khamro

texts.ru: Этому мужчину 64 года. Он из района Кубадиен. Его зовут Хамро. У него есть прекрасные внуки. Хамро живет вместе с женой, детьми, невестками и внуками. Сыновья самостоятельные и умные парни. У них есть свой бизнес. Жена Хамро занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельности в районе. Она выращивает скота во дворе и работает на земле. Жена очень трудолюбивая и заботливая. Сам Хамро пенсионер, он тоже занимался сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Но сейчас он не может работать на земле, потому что он болен. Хамро много лет трудился на районе. Он болеет и ему нужно его здоровье. Хамро хочет сделать операцию, чтобы вылечиться и сохранить себе здоровье. Ему необходимо денежных средств для операции и лекарство. По этой причине Хамро просит кредит. Вы можете поддержать его финансовыми трудностями.
texts.en: This man is 64 years old. He is a resident of Qubadiyon region. His name is Khamro. He has amazing grandchildren. He lives with his wife, children, daughters-in-law and grandchildren. His sons are independent and smart guys. They own a business. Khamro's wife is in agriculture. She breeds livestock and cultivates plans in the yard. She is very hard-working and caring. Khamro himself is retired, he had been working in agriculture, too. However, he can't work on land now because of his sickness. Khamro has been working hard in his region for many years. He is sick and he needs his health. He needs a surgery to heal and improve his health. He needs money for the surgery and prescription drugs which is why he requested a loan. You could help him in his financial hardship.

loans.use: to pay for the surgery and prescription drugs

loans.name: Kenzhekan

texts.ru: Кенжекан, 47 лет, замужем, вместе с мужем воспитывают 2 детей. У нее высшее образование, работает преподаваелем в начальных классах. Также с 1998 года занимается животноводством. У Кенжекан есть 5 коров, 22 овцы. выращивает фрукты в саду для собственного потребления. Ежемесячная прибыль - около 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кенжекан обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) для покупки бычков для откорма и перепродажи. Сено и сараи приготовлены на зиму. Доходы от кредита Кенжекан хочет вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Kenzhekan is 47 years old, married, raising two children with her husband. She has completed higher education, currently works as an elementary school teacher. Since 1998 she has been breeding livestock. She owns 5 cows and 22 sheep, and also cultivates fruit for household consumption. Her monthly income is 20,000 som (KGS). To further develop her business, Kenzhekan turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) to purchase calves and resell them. Hay and barns are already prepared for the winter. Kenzhekan wants to invest the borrowed money to further develop her business.

loans.use: to buy calves for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Don Chichi Group

texts.es:
Victoria es una mujer de 25 años, vive con su pareja, tiene 1 hijo de 3 años y su negocio es la venta de comida.
Ella es buena madre, trabajadora y muy optimista. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘mutualista’ área central donde conviven lado a lado la mayor parte de oficinas públicas y privadas.
Victoria es morena, de cabello negro y está embarazada (la 1 de la derecha, viste chamarra roja). Su vida la realiza en compañía de su pareja que trabaja como constructor y con su bebé que aún no se encuentra en edad escolar. Viven en un cuarto alquilado, construido de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. La necesidad por mejorar su negocio la llevó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; taller de chapa y pintura, venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de cosméticos, venta de productos naturales, tienda de barrio, confección de ropa deportiva y venta de sabanas. Su negocio es la venta de comida y su especialidad es el ‘locro’ que es una sopa de charque (carne deshidratada), carne cortada en pedacitos, yuca y huevo, es una comida tradicional y muy popular, “este es un plato único y delicioso propio del oriente…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que funciona todos los días, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para la compra de insumos como carne, huevo, aceite y otros. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio antes que nazca su hijo, ella desea comprar insumos de cocina por mayor para trabajar constantemente. Esta es la 1 secuencia de créditos con la institución en 1 año que realiza este negocio.
Es por esos motivos que Victoria solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos de cocina por mayor para cocinar todos los días.
texts.en:
Victoria is a 25 year old woman, she lives with her partner and has a three year old child. Her business is in food sales. She is a good mother, who is hard working, and very optimistic.

She works in the 'Mutualista' zone, a central area where the majority of public and private offices sit side by side.

Victoria has a dark complexion, black hair and is pregnant. (She is on the far right, wearing a red jacket.) She shares her life with her partner who works in construction, and her baby who is not yet school age. They live in rented accomodation, which is built from brick and is supplied with all the basic utilities.

The necessity to improve her business has led her to set up a bank of people who own businesses such as: car body shop, second hand clothes sales, cosmetic sales, natural products sales, local store, sports clothing making, and bed sheet sales.

Victoria's business is in food sales, and her speciality is 'locro', a soup made from charque (dried meat), meat chopped into small pieces, cassava and egg. It is a traditional meal and is very popular, "it is a unique, delicious dish, which is typical of the east..." she says. The advantage of the business is that it is open every day, but the disadvantage is the lack of money to buy ingredients such as meat, egg, oil etc.

Her dream is to improve her business before her child is born, she wishes to buy cooking supplies wholesale so that she can work without interruptions. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the year that she has been working with this business.

This is why Victoria is requesting a loan to buy cooking supplies wholesale to be able to cook every day.

loans.use: to buy cooking supplies wholesale, to be able to cook every day.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Mujeres Esforzadas Group

texts.es:
Banco Mujer Mujeres Esforzadas
Fray Casiano Puntarenas

	Banco Mujer Mujeres Esforzadas presenta la solicitud de crédito de 4 integrantes,  quienes han trabajan en una comunidad de Puntarenas (Fray Casiano) con altos niveles de pobreza. El  grupo de mujeres en la zona mantiene un  ahorro y participan en las actividades grupales para la generación de ingresos.  Tienen 8 años de trabajar en sus actividades, han solicitado préstamos y conocen la modalidad de trabajo grupal.  Se forma la Junta Directiva y se levanta el acta No.6 de solicitud de crédito del Banco Mujer Mujeres Esforzadas, en esta oportunidad la  presidenta es Katia.

	Su trabajo y esfuerzo,  les ha permitido tener su  actividad consolidada como es el  comercio en general (venta de ropa, zapatos, perfumes, panadería y venta de comidas).  El préstamo va a contribuir a mejorar las condiciones de trabajo de su grupo,  les va a permitir invertir para fin de año, incrementando su inventario y cubriendo pedidos para la  época de navidad y vacaciones de verano.

	 Realizan la recuperación de la cuota en forma semanal lo que les permite tener un margen más amplio del pago a realizar, la cual se comprometen a cancelar en un plazo de 8 meses. 

Algunas de ellas son mujeres jefas de hogar, tal es el caso de Katia, quién se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos en la zona, la va a traer a San José y realiza viajes a la frontera con Panamá, es apoyada por su esposo y mantiene una cartera de clientes grande, tiene 38 años y es una mujer trabajadora y de respeto en la comunidad. Además de atender sus actividades económicas por las tardes, también ve  a sus hijos y  cumplen con  las reuniones grupales. 

	El objetivo es mejorar las condiciones de sus empresas, obteniendo un financiamiento acorde con sus necesidades y apoyar el desarrollo de la zona  y por su puesto  mejorar la calidad de vida  de las familias. El nombre del grupo las motiva a ser mejores cada día, Mujeres Esforzadas.
texts.en:
Banco Mujer Mujeres Esforzadas

Fray Casiano, Puntarenas

The women's bank Mujeres Esforzadas is requesting a loan for four members, who have been working in a community in Puntarenas (Fray Casiano), where there are high levels of poverty. The group of women in this zone have savings and participate in group activities to generate income.

They have eight years of experience working in their businesses, and have requested loans and understand the system of group work. The board of directors was formed, and the article of requesting a loan for the women's bank Mujeres Esforzadas, for this the president is Katia.

Katia's hard work and effort has allowed her to strengthen her work in general commerce (sales of clothing, shoes, perfumes, bakery and food sales).

The loan will go towards improving the working conditions of the group, and will allow them to invest for the new year, increasing their inventory and convering orders for the Christmas period and summer holidays. The loan will be paid weekly, which allows them a larger margin of the payment due, which they are commited to paying off within eight months.

Some of them are female heads of households, such as Katia, who sells clothing and shoes locally. She takes them to San José, and travels to the border with Panama. She is supported by her spouse and has a large portfolio of customers. She is aged 38 and is a hard working, respected woman in the community.

As well as taking care of her work in the evenings, she also sees to her children and attends the group meetings.

The aim is to improve the conditions of their respective businesses, obtaining funding according to their needs, and supporting the local development, and of course to improve the quality of life for their families. The name of the group, Mujeres Esforzadas [hardworking women] motivates them to be better every day.

loans.use: to buy women's and children's clothing, and ingredients for the bakery and food sales.

loans.name: Elizabeth Del Carmen

texts.es: Elizabeth, de 27 años, soltera y con dos hijos de 12 y 13 años, quien el día a día lucha para sacarlos adelantes, y que no les falte lo necesario para poderlos verlos progresar. Inicio su negocio y tiene una pulperia, vende ropa nueva y cosméticos, este negocio lo inicio desde hace 5 años. Y con la ayuda de sus hijas quienes ayudan en la venta de los productos, requiere del préstamo para la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijoles, gaseosas de la marca coca cola, Pepsi y big cola. Asi su negocio será mas visitados debido a la variedad de productos y sus ingresos serán mayores, los cuales les permitirá cumplir con los abonos y comprar cosas personales para el desarrollo del hogar.
texts.en: Elizabeth is 27 years old. She is single and has two children, aged 12 and 13 years old, whom she fights day to day to get ahead. She wants them to lack for nothing they need and to see them progress. She started her business and she has a store. She sells new clothing and cosmetics, a business she started 5 years ago. With her daughters' help selling the products. he needs the loan to buy rice, sugar, oil, beans, and Coca-Cola, Pepsi and Big sodas. This way, her business will be more frequented due the variety of products and her income will be bigger. This will allow her to make her payments and buy personal items for the development of her home.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, beans, Coca-Cola, Pepsi and Big sodas.

loans.name: Real Sociedad Group

texts.es:
¨Real sociedad¨ es provenientes de los lugares rurales de la ciudad, pero no significa que por eso  dejan de ser personas responsables a quienes les guste el trabajo día a día, todo esto para el desarrollo personal y sacar adelante a su apreciada familia. Por 8va vez solicitan crédito para seguir desarrollando sus labores diarias. Coordinado por Josefa de 24 años, ajuntada y con dos hijos de edades 8 y 3 años, se dedica a la compra y venta de cosechas desde hace 11 años, con los préstamos de otras financieras. Ahora con el crédito requiere de la compra de aguacate al por mayor para así poder cubrir la demanda solicitada por la clientela. 
Las otras socias son Julia de 46 años dedicada a la preparación y venta de comida, Juana de 35 y Angelita de 37 las dos se dedican a la venta de cosechas de manera ambulante en diferentes lugares. Así proporcionan a su familia el dinero necesario para sobrevivir de manera digna.
texts.en:
"Real Sociedad" are from the rural areas near the city, but that doesn't mean that they are not responsible people who life to work day to day. This is all for her personal development and to get their cherished families ahead. For the 8th time, they are asking for a loan to continue developing their daily work. It is coordinated by Josefa, aged 24, who is in a relationship and has two children, aged 8 and 3. She has bought and sold crops for 11 years, with loans from other institutions. Now, with the loan, she needs to buy avocados wholesale to meet the demand of her clientele.

The other members are Julia, who is 46, and who makes and sells food, Juana aged 35, and Angelita, aged 37 who sells crops as traveling sales people in different places. This is how they provide their families with the money necessary to survive in a dignified way.

loans.use: to buy avocados wholesale to be able to cover the demand of her clientele.

loans.name: Denia Vanesa

texts.es: Denia es una muchacha, trabajadora, emprendedora y muy consciente de su futuro, del cual desea que sea prosperante y ver su negocio crecer. De 26 años, se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y cosméticos de manera ambulante. Con 3 hijos a su responsabilidad y con la ayuda de compañero económicamente y una concuña quien le ayuda en la comercialización de los productos, solicita por 4vez  del crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de pantalones de varones y mujeres, ropa interior como blumers, bóxer, calcetas, brazzieres y calzado. Así podrá ofrecer variedad a sus clientes. Con esto asegura su futuro con más ingresos que le ayuden a superarse.
texts.en: Denia is a hard-working and enterprising young woman, very conscious about her future, in which she wants to be prosperous and see her business grow. She is 26 years old and works selling new clothing and cosmetics as a street vendor. With 3 children in her responsibility and with the economic help of her partner and a sister-in-law who helps with selling the products, she asks for the fourth time for a loan to be able to invest it in men's and women's pants, underclothes such as panties, boxers, socks, bras, and shoes. In this way she will be able to offer her customers a variety. With this, she will assure more income in her future which will help her to improve herself.

loans.use: to be able to invest it in the purchase of men's and women's pants, underclothes such as panties, boxers, socks, bras, and shoes.

loans.name: Victoriana Group

texts.es: Grupo Victoriana, lo coordina Pilar de 45 años, casada y con 1 hijo de 17 años, quien se esfuerza para poder enviarlo recibir la educación secundaria  y poder ser una profesional mas adelante. Tiene su negocio de venta de cosméticos y venta de ropa nueva. Negocio iniciado desde hace 5 años con la ayuda de su esposo. Ahora con el dinero solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de calzado, pantalones de mujeres y compra de cosméticos como cremas, perfumes, lápiz labiales,vanidades, sombras y delineadores. Su clientela podrán observar variedad de productos y recibirá mas pedidos, viendo asi el aumento de sus ingresos. Las otras integrantes es Anelia de 34 años quien prepara y vende comida y Sandra de 41 años quien vende ropa nueva.
texts.en: The Victoriana group is coordinated by Pilar, 45 years old, married, with 1 son who is 17 years old, she works hard to be able to send him to get a secondary education and to be able to be a professional in the future. She has her business selling cosmetics and new clothing. She began the business 5 years ago with the help of her husband. Now, with the money requested, she will invest it in the purchase of shoes and pants for women, and to purchase cosmetics such as creams, perfumes, lipstick, compacts, eye shadow and eyeliner. Her customers will be able to see a variety of products and she will get more orders seeing, in this way, an increase in her income. The other members are Anelia, 34 years old, who makes and sells food, and Sandra, 41 years old, who sells new clothing.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and women's pants, and to purchase cosmetics such as creams, perfumes, lipstick, compacts, eye shadow, and eyeliner.

loans.name: Cruzche Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Cruz Che” is located the small town of Cruz Che, which is 50 miles west of Guatemala City in the state of Quiche. Nine small-business women, who are wives and mothers, make up the Trust Bank. They are working together with the vision of being able to create better and more successful lives through increased profits from their businesses and education for themselves.

Rutilia is one of the “Cruz Che’s” members. She is 32 years old with a small business making and selling tortillas - the staple of all Guatemalan cuisine. Because tortillas are eaten with every meal, Rutilia makes fresh tortillas for her customers three times each day.

She is requesting a loan now to buy supplies for her business including several large sacks of corn, lime and firewood. The loan not only helps her business, but indirectly helps her sister, who works with her taking tortilla orders.

The women in the “Cruz Che” Trust Bank meet monthly with a Friendship Bridge facilitator to transact business on their loans and to participate in educational training on relevant subjects. Friendship Bridge believes that the combination of small loans and education, called “Microcredit Plus” is a winning one. A different topic is presented each month using role playing, games, diagrams and photographs.

The loans that Kiva investors provide to Friendship Bridge clients like Rutilia and her friends in the “Cruz Che” Trust Bank frequently extend to help other family and community members. The loans, in essence, do double duty as they support the growth and well being of many in small towns like Cruz Che.

Many thanks, Kiva investors, for helping Rutilia and the members of “Cruz Che” in their quest for a brighter and more prosperous future!

loans.use: to buy corn, lime and firewood.

loans.name: Flor De Angel Group

texts.es:
Por 4ta vez, se encuentra solicitando crédito para el desarrollo de sus diversas actividades económicas del grupo llamado ¨Flor de Angel¨. Quien coordina el grupo es Hilda, dedicada a la venta de ropa nueva, desde hace 3 años con la ayuda de su esposo. Actualmente tiene un hijo de 3 años, quien preocura darle las mejoras condiciones de vida para su desarrollo. Con la ayuda de su prima, quien comercializa en una zona franca su venta va aumentando. Es por ende que requiere del préstamo para la compra de pantalones y blusas para damas, de las cuales son las mas demandadas. 
Las otras socias son Meyling de 26 años, dedicada a la venta de ropa nueva y usada. Y Luisa de 36 años a la venta de ropa nueva de manera ambulante en la comunidad.
texts.en:
For the 4th time, the group called "Flor de Angel" is asking for a loan to develop their diverse businesses. Hilda is the one who coordinates the group, she has worked selling new clothing for 3 years with the help of her husband. Currently, she has a 3-year-old son and she is concerned with giving him the best living conditions for his development. With the help of her cousin, who sells in a free zone, her sales are increasing. It is for this reason that she needs the loan to purchase pants and blouses for women, which are in the highest demand.

The other borrowers are Meyling, 26 years old, who works selling new and used clothing, and Luisa, 36 years old, who sells new clothing as a street vendor in the community.

loans.use: to purchase pants and blouses for women.

loans.name: Samoeun's Group

texts.en:
A mother of four children, Samoeun is 38 years old and living in Kandal Steung district of Kandal province. Nowadays, she needs to support three children; one is in school and other two are too young.

She has earned income to support her family’s living by selling groceries and growing rice for 18 years. Because of the lack of capital, her family’s business has not grown well.

For Samoeun, this is her first loan with VisionFund and she leads a group of four members to seek this loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farming to get good yield for her family. She wishes that her rice farm can produce a better yield so she can get a higher price to upgrade her family's living.

loans.use: to purchase more fertilizer and rice seed to get a higher yield for her family to sell at a good price.

loans.name: Wambui

texts.en:
Wambui is a married woman. She has seven children. She describes herself to be humble.

She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals.

Her business goal is to have a big cereals store within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to the university level.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Doneway Group

texts.en:
Sangvan is excited the filter was available on an affordable payment plan. Sangvan and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years.

The water filter Sangvan and his group purchased is guaranteed for two years but is known to function for up to five years. Sangvan and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne diseases. And after totaling up the costs, Sangvan and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Nongkhone Group

texts.en:
Kan’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.

Kan and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.

Kan and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years; within this two years filter users, like Kan’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is 50 years old and married. She has five children, one of whom is in school. Ruby works very hard to provide for them.

Ruby has a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack food and other groceries.

Ruby requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

In the future, Ruby would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Hakob

texts.en:
Hakob is 45 years old and he lives in Gavar city of Gegharkunik region. Hakob is constructor and he is hired for different construction work in his city.
