Simultaneously, he is an owner of a small farm where he takes care of cows and calves. Having a big family, Hakob is very overloaded with work on the farm as well as construction work, and still he lacks finances for his family.

Hakob lives with his wife (his wife works as a hairdresser), three children and his retired mother. Hakob built a barn for his farm cattle and here his mother milks the cows and they sell milk, cheese and macun (the national dairy-product) from their farm. Meat also is sold perfectly, thanks to Hakob’s accurate and attentive care of his farm cattle.

Now Hakob has decided to use this loan of 500,000 Armenian drams to purchase cattle fodder, as his farm cattle already lack food. The pastures provide very little fodder for the cattle , and the storage of fodder, little by little, is the best decision for any farmer.

loans.use: to purchase cattle fodder as he needs it for his farm cattle

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
This unbelievably nice and shining lady’s name is Naira, and she is 19 years old. She lives in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region with her parents and brother. Her mother and father are farmers and they are a very nice couple who all day long are engaged in farming and agriculture and working hard. They want to organize their children's care properly and cover their numerous needs.

Naira’s brother is contractual serviceman.

Naira is a student at the Yerevan State Medical College and she is a future midwife. She mentions that she chose her profession with great love and she would like very much in future to find work in her profession as a midwife. The only hardship is that Naira studies at the paid division and she is very upset that her education fee causes so many difficulties for her parents. This loan of 240,000 Armenian drams Naira asks for the repayment of her tuition fee for the first semester, and she is greatly thankful beforehand for the Kiva loan and support.

loans.use: to repay her tuition fee for the first semester, and she is greatly thankful beforehand for the Kiva loan and support.

loans.name: Zahraa

texts.en:
Zahraa is a 21-year-old married lady who has been working as a tutor for five years, since she had to work hard to pay for her university tuition fees.

She is well known in the region with her special teaching talents. Her income is good enough to cover her living needs, and the living expenses of two other members of her family.

Unfortunately, her acquired income combined with her husband's isn't enough to cover increasing unexpected living expenses.

For this reason, her acquired loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua will be invested in paying hospital expenses for her baby's delivery.

She hopes that in the future she can open her own tutoring center, since she is skilled in this area.

loans.use: to pay hospital medical expenses for the delivery of her baby.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 54 years old and he lives in Gavar, a city in the Gegharkunik region. He is married and he has a son and a daughter (both of them are grown up and employed).

For many years, Martin worked at the local dairy products factory as a distributor-driver. Now he has changed his workplace but he still works as a driver. Martin mentions that he is a master in driving and he can even drive with closed eyes, but farming is his favorite activity.

He likes caring for his very cute farm with several cows and calves in it. With the help of his wife, Martin sells his farm’s milk, macun (a national dairy-product) and also some beef.

Martin has a new idea now of swine breeding in his farm, and he greatly relies on Kiva lenders’ support. He wants to start this with hope of selling more meat, which is very profitable for any farmer.

With this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams, Martin will purchase pigs and piglets and seriously start swine breeding in his farm. This will improve his farm and the income for his nice family as well.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and piglets and seriously start swine breeding in his farm.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 50 years old, married, with six children. Two of her children are in school; she is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Teresita has a food vending business in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Teresita has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Parkthone Group

texts.en:
Vnai and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years.

Vnai and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. After totaling up the costs, Vnai and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

The water filters Vnai and his group purchased are guaranteed for two years but are known to function for up to five years.

Vnai is excited the filter was available on an affordable payment plan.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man. He has six children. He describes himself as honest.

He operates a dairy farm where he sells milk. He has been involved in this business for 30 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge as low milk production.

He will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy another dairy cow. His business goal is to have a well established dairy farm within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to purchase another cow.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow.

loans.name: Napoung Group

texts.en:
Tham understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families. Tham knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.

The water filter Tham purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost of foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.

Tham is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule. The filter is guaranteed for two years, so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Germaine

texts.fr:
A 50 ans, Germaine a encore à sa charge ses quatre enfants depuis la mort de son mari.  Actuellement ses fils vivent encore sous le même  toit qu’elle. Elle est grand-mère d’un enfant dont la scolarisation est à sa charge car son fils ne dispose pas encore de moyens financiers.
Germaine a commencé l'activité de vente de légumes depuis 1999. Elle a toujours cherché les moyens pour développer cette activité qui constitue sa principale source de revenus : recours à un prêt : recherche d’un point de vente. Chaque jour,  le matin  elle vend les produits à la place du marché des agriculteurs. Les produits non vendus sur cette place sont écoulées sur le grand marché du quartier.
Son rêve est d’offrir une meilleure condition de vie à son arrière petit enfant et de pouvoir aider ses fils à sortir de leur situation de vulnérabilité.
texts.en: At 50 years of age, Germaine still has four dependent children since her husband's death. At the moment, her sons still live under the same roof as her. She is a grandmother of one child, whose schooling is at her expense as her son does not have financial means available. Germaine began her vegetable-selling business in 1999. She has always looked for the means to develop this business which makes up her main source of income: help of a loan: search for a sales point. Each day, she sells products at the agriculture's market place in the morning. The un-sold products at this place are sold at the large neighbourhood market. Her dream is to offer a better living condition to her great-grand children and to be able to help her sons get out of their vulnerable situation.

loans.use: to buy carrots, cucumbers, green beans, tomatoes, onions, leaks etc.

loans.name: Khady's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis 2012 et rassemble des membres qui habitent la même commune et ont comme activité le petit commerce.

Rama,habillée en bleue, qui se trouve à l'extrême droite de la photo en position debout et levant le bras,est la représentante du groupe,elle est mariée et mére de 9 enfants dont 03 garçons.

Elle vend de l'encens depuis plusieurs années,elle s'approvisionne au niveau du marché central pour revendre dans son quartier et sur commande.

Avec le crédit,elle va acheter 50kg d'encens pur à 500f le kg,de l'encens gowé 25kg à 1000f le kg et de l'encens maniang kassé 25 kg à 2000f le kg.

Son objectif est de pouvoir assurer les besoins de sa famille et augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
This group was created in 2012 and gathers together members who live in the same village and have small trade as their business. Rama, dressed in blue, who is found on the extreme right of this photo, standing up and raising her hand, is the group's representative. She is married and mother of 9 children, 3 of whom are boys. She has been selling incense for several years, she gets her supplies at the level of the central market in order to re-sell in her neighbourhood and on order. 

With the credit, she is going to buy 50 kg of pure incense at 500f per kilo, 25kg of gowé incense at 1000f per kilo and 25 kg of maniang kassé incense at 2000f per kilo. Her goal is to be able to cover her family's needs and increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy incense.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be outgoing. She operates a retail business where she sells flour, bread, sugar, cooking oil, ,juices and other items. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. She will use the KES 90,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour and other items. Her business goal is to have a large scale shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will be successful.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour and other items.

loans.name: Ignacio Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio es un señor con 52 años de edad y vive en el municipio  de Planeta Rica. Debido a que no cuenta con un empleo estable, este hombre desea emprender su propio negocio, quiere dedicarse a la cría y venta de ganado porcino, piensa que con esta actividad se puede obtener mejores ingresos.
Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual invertirá en la compra de cerdos, cuido al por mayor y construirá tres marraneras.
Su meta es continuar trabajando hasta cumplir el sueño de remodelar su casa.
Con su aporte Antonio invertirá en un mejor futuro para él y su familia, anímate, haz un préstamo.
texts.en:
Antonio is 52 years of age and he lives in the Planeta Rica municipality. As he does not have stable employment, he wishes to start his own business. He wants to earn a living raising and selling pigs as he believes that he will be able to obtain a better income with this activity.

He is requesting a loan which he will invest in the purchase of pigs, wholesale feed and in the construction of three pig pens. His goal is to continue working until he has achieved his dream of renovating his house. With your support Antonio will invest in a better future for him and his family. Go ahead, make a loan.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, wholesale pig feed, and to build three pig-pens

loans.name: Grupo De Jesús Group

texts.es:
Hay una comunidad de origen mazahua dentro del Estado de México que se caracteriza por su relajante tranquilidad y la amabilidad de sus habitantes. No obstante cuando se trata de festejar lo hacen de manera especial, sobre todo,  los 14 de febrero; fecha en que celebran a la virgen local. Además cuentan con varios centros arquitectónicos donde pueden jugar, comer y divertirse en compañía de sus seres queridos. 
   De dicha comunidad es un grupo integrado por mujeres muy emprendedoras quienes se muestran emocionadas ya que éste es su primer préstamo. Todas decidieron invertir en el futuro de sus negocios y saben que con esfuerzo lograrán sobresalir. Ellas son: Paula quien invertirá en pollos; Claudia, en papas y Cristina, en cría de animales.
   Claudia es, quizás, la más alegre del grupo pero comparte con todas su entusiasmo por el trabajo. Lo que la motivó a llevar a cabo una actividad económica fue el brindarle mejores oportunidades a su pequeña hija. Su esposo, por otro lado, se dedica a la venta de frituras y botanas como papas, chicharrones de harina, plátanos, etc. ya que si bien inicio como un empleado ahora cuenta con un negocio propio y sustentable. "Yo le ayudo a vender el producto ya que me gusta brindar siempre una sonrisa a los clientes, pero no preparo las botanas por miedo al aceite caliente" comentó Claudia con una sonrisa.
   Actualmente venden todos los fines de semana aprovechando la afluencia de personas que pasan por su puesto, la clientela que más le compra, no obstante, siempre ha sido de pequeños. Con la oportunidad de este préstamo compraría más litros de aceite, y materia prima. Considera que su negocio es muy productivo si se sabe administrar ya que con sus ganancias puede solventar los gastos de su hogar y reinvertir. Una de sus metas es abrir un segundo puesto para incrementar las ganancias.
*La fotografía fue tomada debajo del quiosco, Claudia es quien viste la chamarra color café.
texts.en:
There is a community that is native Mazahua within the state of Mexico that is known for its relaxing tranquility and the kindness of its inhabitants. However, when it comes to celebrating, they do so in a special way, especially on February 14, the day of their local celebration of the Virgen. They also have several architectural centers where they can play, eat and enjoy themselves in the company of their loved ones.

A group made up of enterprising women comes from this community, who are excited because this is their first loan. They all decided to invest in the future of their businesses and they know that with effort they will manage to get ahead. They are Paula, who will invest in chickens, Claudia, in potatoes, and Cristina, in raising animals.

Claudia is perhaps the most cheerful of the group, but she shares her enthusiasm for work with the others. She was inspired to get involved in an economic activity in order to provide better opportunities to her young daughter. Her husband sells fried foods and snacks, such as potatoes, flour-based cracklings, plantains, etc. He started out as an employee and now has his own business which is profitable. "I help him sell the products because I always like to greet the customers with a smile, but I don't prepare the snacks, because I am afraid of the hot oil," Claudia mentioned with a smile.

Currently they sell on weekends, taking advantage of the wealth of people who pass by their stand. The clientele that buys from them the most, however, has always been the children. With the opportunity of this loan, she would buy more liters of oil, and raw materials. She feels the business is very profitable if you know how to manage it, because with the profits she can pay the household expenses and reinvest in the business. One of her goals is to open a second stand so she can increase their earnings.

*The picture was taken below the kiosk. Claudia is wearing the coffee-colored jacket.

loans.use: to buy fried foods.

loans.name: La Chunca Group

texts.es:
Una comunidad en Oaxaca se caracteriza por su diversidad étnica, en chinameco es llamada Guemáquie, y en mazateco, Naxhingee. Desde el punto más alto en cualquiera de sus calles se logra apreciar la represa, los ríos y la iglesia ofreciendo un panorama único y agradable. La pesca y la cosecha de caña de azúcar son las actividades que activan la economía de la región, por ello durante las mañanas se puede ver a los pescadores adentrarse en la presa para poder obtener el pescado local llamado mojarra. 
   En una de las colonias de dicha comunidad se formó un grupo llamado  La  Chunca palabra de origen zapoteco cuyo significado es “la más pequeña”; los integrantes son: Sonia quien se dedica a la venta de ropa; Teodora y Hermelinda, comida; Santa, dulces y botanas mientras que Maximino y Rosa, tortillas.
   Desde niña, Santa ayudaba a sus padres a vender raspados, lo que consiste en obtener la escarcha de una barra de hielo para después incorporar jarabes de distintos sabores. Juntos recorrían las calles de su comunidad y sobre carretillas instalaban todos los ingredientes y herramientas necesarias en su actividad. “De mis padres aprendí el valor del trabajo” expresa Santa quien desde los 18 años realiza su labor sola a bordo de un triciclo totalmente acondicionado; “ahora vendo raspados para ofrecer a mis hijos estudios y una calidad de vida diferente a la que mis hermanos y yo tuvimos” agrega.
   Para obtener este refrescante producto se lava perfectamente las manos, destapa la barra de hielo, toma el “cepillo” y frota sobre el éste hasta obtener la escarcha que coloca dentro de un vaso para después preguntar el sabor que el cliente prefiera. El último paso es verter el sabor, colocar un popote y listo, el producto final está terminado. Cabe mencionar que cuenta con combinaciones de sabores que requieren una preparación más detallada pero que sin duda tienen un sabor más especial.
   Este es su primer préstamo y lo invertiría en la compra de agua, fruta de temporada, leche, azúcar, picante, vasos, popotes, servilletas y una barra de hielo pues las altas temperaturas benefician su labor.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el patio de Santa quien viste blusa azul con rosa, en la foto, además de los integrantes, se puede apreciar el triciclo con el que recorre las calles de la comunidad.
texts.en:
A community in Oaxaca is characterized by its ethnic diversity, en Chinameco it's called Guemáquie, and in Mazateco, Naxhingee. From the highest point of any of its streets one can appreciate the dam, the rivers and the church, offering a unique and agreeable panorama. The fish and sugarcane harvest are the activities that activate the economy of the region, thus during the mornings one can see the fishermen delving into the dam to be able to obtain the local fish called mojarra. In one of the neighborhoods of said community, a group formed called La Chunca, word of Zapotec origin whose meaning is "the smallest." The members are: Sonia, who works selling clothing; Teodora and Hermelinda, food; Santa, sweets and snacks, while Maximino and Rosa sell tortillas.

Since she was a girl, Santa helped her parents sell shaved ice, which consists of obtaining the frost of a block of ice to later incorporate syrups of distinct flavors. Together, they traveled the streets of their community and on carts, they installed all of the ingredients and tools necessary in their activity. "From my parents I learned the value of work," expresses Santa, who, since she was 18, does her work only on board a totally equipped tricycle. "Now I sell shaved ice to offer my children education and a quality of life different from my siblings and I had," she adds.

To obtain this refreshing product, one washes the hands perfectly, uncovers the ice block, takes the "brush" and rubs this until the frost is obtained, which is placed inside a cup to later ask the client which flavor he prefers. The last step is to pour in the flavor, put in a straw and done - the final product is finished. It's worth mentioning that she has flavor combinations that require a more detailed preparation but without doubt have a more special flavor. This is her first loan and she will invest it in the purchase of water, seasonal fruit, milk, sugar, hot sauce, cups, straws, napkins, ice blocks; well, the high temperatures benefit her work.

*The photograph was taken in on the patio of Santa, who is dressed in a blue blouse with pink in the photo, in addition to the members, the tricycle can be seen with which she travels the streets of the community.

loans.use: to buy: water, seasonal fruit, milk, sugar, hot sauce, cups, straws, napkins, ice blocks.

loans.name: Longdy

texts.en:
Longdy, 18, was an outstanding student when he was in high school. Currently, he is studying at university to pursue a bachelor degree, majoring in Information Technology at a university in the province.

Longdy’s family are rice farmers and they totally depend on farming as revenue, which makes it hard to pay for his tuition fees from the first to the fourth year. To pay for his tuition fees, he is applying for a loan of USD 2,200.

When he finishes his bachelor degree, he wants to run his own business. He also wants to build a new house for his family and if he has children, he wants his children to study to pursue bachelor or master degrees if he can support it.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition fees in I T from the first to the fourth year.

loans.name: Prosperidad Ii - Saños Grande Group

texts.es: Angelica es una socia de la alcancía comunal “Prosperidad II - Saños Grande”, el préstamo obtenido lo invirtió en la compra de mercadería de abarrotes al por mayor para así implementar su negocio, con eso ha podido aumentar su capital en su negocio, sus metas ahora es ampliar su tiendita, además darle una mejor educación a sus hijos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Angelica está muy agradecida por todo el apoyo económico que se le ha dado, al igual que a los demás integrantes de la alcancía comunal "Prosperidad II - Saños Grande". Angelica es la que esta con una chompa a rayas de color negro con blanco. Aamir no se muestran en la fotografía porque no pudo asistir el dia de la reunion por problemas personales.
texts.en: Angelica is a member of the “Prosperidad II - Saños Grande” communal bank. She has used the loan she obtained to purchase wholesale grocery stock to set up her business, and with this she has been about to increase her business capital. Her current goals are to extend her store, as well as to give her children a better education and in this way improve her family's quality of life. Angelica is very thankful for all of the economic support that she and the rest of the members of the  “Prosperidad II - Saños Grande” communal bank  have been given. Angelica is seen in the photo wearing a black and white striped jumper. Aamir is not in the photo because he could not attend the meeting because of personal problems.

loans.use: to purchase general groceries wholesale

loans.name: Vazgen

texts.en:
This young man’s name is Vazgen and he is 26 years old. He is a student of Gavar State University in the faculty of geography. He lives in his native city Gavar, of the Gegharkunik region, with his mother and retired grandmother. He also has a sister who is married and she lives with her family. Vazgen’s father is in the Russian Federation and he works there to support his family’s needs. So Vazgen, being the only man in the family now, feels great responsibility of his family's care.

Vazgen, besides being a student, is also a farmer. In his farm he has cows, calves and heifers. Vazgen says that he likes his farming so much that while he is at the University and on the bus on the way back home, he thinks of his farm work and plans what he will do first when he reaches his farm. Vazgen sells his farm’s milk, meat, macun (national dairy-product) and cheese, with the help of his beloved grandmother, to their neighbors and regular customers.

Vazgen asks for a loan of 500,000 Armenian Drams from the Kiva lenders as he made a decision to start swine breeding on the farm. He will buy several pigs and develop his new occupation with great hope of more income for his lovely family.

loans.use: to buy several pigs and develop his new occupation with great hope of more income for his lovely family.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a single mother of one child who attends school. She lives in her own house, which has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past 10 years, Halima has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and to passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting of 15,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Nimanjewa

texts.en:
Nimanjewa is a married mother of five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over 15 years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of theft in her business.

With this loan of 15,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Charline

texts.fr:
Charline a 62 ans. Elle est mariée. Ils ont eu quatre enfants dont deux décédés, les deux autres (45 et 44 ans) sont déjà mariés. Son mari est maçon, surtout pour les travaux de construction de tombeaux. C’est une femme courageuse.  
Charline dispose d’une trentaine d’années d'expérience dans l‘activité de vente de légumes sur la place du marché du capital. C’est sa principale source de revenus. Le revenu généré par cette activité et celle de son mari ont permis au couple de subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Le prêt sert à acheter de l’ail, oignon, bananes, carotte, pomme de terre, tomate et gingembre. L’objectif est de diversifier les produits et de disposer suffisamment de stock pour satisfaire les besoins des clients.
Le rêve du couple est d’avoir une vie aisée.
texts.en: Charline is 62 years old. She is married. They had four children, two of whom have deceased, the two others (45 and 44 years old) are already married. Her husband is a mason, mainly for construction work of tombs. She is a courageous woman. Charline has 30 years of experience in the vegetable-selling business at the capital's market place. It's her main source of income. The income generated by this business and that of her husband's has allowed the couple to meet the family's needs. The loan helps to buy garlic, onion, bananas, carrot, potatoes, tomato and ginger. The goal is to diversify the products and to have sufficient stock available to meet her client's needs. The couple's dream is to have a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy garlic, onions, tomatoes, carrots, potatoes and bananas.

loans.name: Lo Van's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Van, born in 1986, is a Thai ethnic woman. Her family consists of six members, her parents-in-law, and her husband, her two children (one son and one daughter). The family is living in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main occupation is cultivation. Her family has over 8,000 square meters of cultivated land for the coffee, so the income after deducting all costs is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and saved a small amount. She wants to pay for her children’s education fees but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her children have better condition for learning, and then they will have brighter future. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to pay for her children’s education fees

loans.name: Sovann's Group

texts.en:
A mother blessed with two children and one of whom is in school, Sovann is 40-year-old living in Kampong Cham province. To support her family’s living, she grows cassava and rice as her main sources of her income for 20 years. The insects have destroyed her cassava, so she did not get good yield.

This is first time for Sovann with VisionFund and she is the group leader of two members to seeking this loan. She will use her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and organic pesticide to improve on her cassava farm to get more yields for her family. She hopes that she can gain good yield from her cassava farm to upgrade her family’s living and to support her child’s education as well.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and organic pesticide to improve on her cassava farm to get more yields so that she can sell it in good price to have a better living.

loans.name: Nigina

texts.en:
Nigina is very kind woman. She is married, has 3 children and she is the main keeper of the family because her husband’s income is small. Nigina 5 years ago has begun own business. She has been busy with buying and selling children clothes. She likes little children and she always wants to see children with beautiful clothes and so she tries for it.

Nigina has a selling place in a local market. She is asking for a loan of 7000 Somoni to buy children clothes for increasing sales during the new autumn season. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy clothes for increasing working capital.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 52-year-old married father of five and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Fifteen years ago, he started working in car painting to cover the needs and expenses of his children. He is a hard worker and ambitious man who has a good reputation among his region.

Hasan is trying hard to improve his family's living conditions inside the camp, thus today he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to renovate his house and make it a better and healthier place. Hasan hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and stay capable of providing his family with descent living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his house and make it a better and healthier place inside the camp

loans.name: Habib

texts.en:
Habib is a 37-year-old married Syrian citizen, the father of four children for whom he works hard as a carpenter since 2005.

Habib's limited monthly salary is barely enough to cover his increasing living needs. Thus, an acquired loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua will be invested in paying for his childrens' school tuition fees.

Habib is working hard to provide his family with a better living and hopes to make their dreams come true. He will also make sure to buy the winter season Mouneh (traditional preserves made with seasonal ingredients), as well as necessary needs because they live in a region that is known for its hard winter season.

He hopes to promote in his work and open his own business in the future.

loans.use: to pay for his childrens' school tuition fees.

loans.name: Saiid

texts.en:
Saiid is a 38-year-old Palestinian Refugee, a married father of one child who has been working in fish selling for ten years.
He used to work as a plumber, but he decided to turn to fish selling business, which he believes comes with a daily income business for his family.

His income is just good enough to cover his family's daily living needs, but unfortunately any unexpected living need requests and external financial support.

That's why, Saiid is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to make the necessary maintenance to his house to keep it a healthy living place before the winter season. He will also try to buy living room furniture for his family to improve their living place.

He hopes to develop his business, and find the suitable location to open a fish selling shop in the future instead of the current pavement fish display

loans.use: to make necessary maintenance to his house to keep it a healthy living place before the winter season.

loans.name: Wenceslao

texts.en:
Wenceslao is a 54-year-old entrepreneur from Talisay City, Cebu. He buys bananas in high volume and different varieties from direct suppliers or farmers, then sells it per kilo in his stall located along the street. His usual customers are commuters and passersby. He braves the rain and heat of the sun so as to supply the daily needs and education expenses of his children. His wife, Nille, is selling ready-to-wear clothes, and she also takes a turn in watching over his banana stall.

Armed by his desire to acquire a jeepney or multicab, Wenceslao plans to buy a truckload of bananas that he can supply to his contact vendors in the town’s public market. He needs 50,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) in additional capital for this. He’s positive that he can earn a higher profit that will gradually lead his family towards a more comfortable life someday.

He regularly meets with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy a truckload of bananas.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with three children. She describes herself to be caring.

Jane operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a populated place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to have a big boutique within 5 years. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children. She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Alma dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Hermine

texts.en:
Hermine is greatly thankful for her first Kiva loan and she hopes that Kiva lenders one again will support her in her request. She lives with her beloved husband and lovely children in Vanadzor city of Lori region. Having higher pedagogical education and being very good specialist of Armenian Language and Literature she happily mentions that already 16 years she works of her profession; as a teacher of Armenian Language and Literature at the local school.

Hermine also gives private courses of Armenian Language and Literature, preparing them for the entrance examinations and she mentions proudly that her pupils always manages to have success and high scores in their exams. This time the loan 700.000 Armenian drams Hermine asks as she greatly wants to take part in training courses for teachers in Vanadzor and these courses are paid one, and Hermine also wants to buy a table for her working room, where her pupils can have their courses in comfort.

loans.use: to pay for a teacher's course and also buy a table for her working room, where her pupils can have their courses in comfort.

loans.name: Vileta

texts.en:
Vileta is hard working woman from Berdik village of Ararat region, where she lives with her husband and two son. Vileta's two sons are pastors, and her husband is a teacher at local village school. Vileta herself has been involved in farming business for already 15 years. She cultivates wheat and grows peach trees and her primary income comes from the sale of harvest at the local market.

Vileta asks this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer for land cultivation and also pears to keep in a refrigerator and sell in the spring with good price.

Vileta plans to use extra income from this loan to cover family's basic needs.
This is Vileta's first loan and it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizer for land cultivation and also pears to keep in a refrigerator and sell in the spring with good prices.

loans.name: Sarom's Group

texts.en:
Sarom is 34 years old and she is married. She is blessed with three dependent children, two of whom are in school while the remaining one is too young to attend school. She lives in Kampong Cham province where she and her husband have been growing tobacco for 16 years. Her husband sometimes works as paid worker to supplement income.

She has been with VisionFund for a cycle loan already. The past loan has helped her improve her family’s living condition. In a group of four members, Sarom is the leader and she will use her loan to buy organic fertilizer to improve her crop products and to buy fuel to support her tobacco farming business too. She hopes she can upgrade the standard of living and keep supporting her children’s studying.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to improve her crop products to upgrade the standard of living and support her children’s studying.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Mareme's Group

texts.fr:
ce groupe créé depuis novembre 2012,rassemble des membre qui habitent la même commune et ont comme activité le petit commerce.

Khady,habillée en boubou blanc, se trouvant à l'extrême droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la représentante du groupe,elle est âgée de 48 ans,est mariée et mére de 06 enfants dont 02 garçons.

Elle pratique comme activité le commerce de draps,de rideaux et de vêtements pour enfants.

Avec le crédit,elle compte acheter 04 draps au prix unitaire de 6000f,08 rideaux au prix unitaire de 3500f,des vêtements pour enfants d'une valeur de 4500f.

Son objectif est d'assurer les besoins vitaux de sa famille et d'augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
This group was created in November of 2012 and groups together people who live in the same same commune and are small retailers.

Khady, wearing a white boubou, standing on the far right of the photo and raising her hand, is the group's representative. She is 48 years old, married and the mother of 6 children, 2 of whom are boys.

She sells sheets, curtains and children's clothing for a living. She plans to use this loan to buy 4 sheets (at 6 000 francs per sheet), 8 curtains (at 3 500 francs per curtain) and 4 500 francs worth of children's clothing. 

Her goal is to ensure that her family's basic needs are covered and to build her savings.

loans.use: to buy sheets, curtains and children's clothing.

loans.name: Sorpresa Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad muy tranquila del Estado de México se integró desde hace varios años un grupo muy unido llamado Sorpresa. Sus integrantes decidieron nombrar así al grupo porque haberse encontrado con los beneficios que brinda VF México fue una verdadera sorpresa. Cabe mencionar que su comunidad se identifica por practicar el cultivo de maíz alrededor de todo el territorio; una vez que el producto final es cosechado se alegran en demasía ya que es el fruto de todo un año de esfuerzo.
   Doña Juliana aventaja a todas sus compañeras en cuanto al trabajo se refiere y siempre mantiene un espíritu emprendedor. Hace hasta lo imposible por mantener a su familia unida y contenta, junto con su esposo Teofilo y sus dos hijos quienes se encuentran estudiando y son el orgullo de la pareja. 
   Desde hace más de veinte años inicio con la cría de ganado ovino dentro de su comunidad ya que los animales pueden recorrer plácidamente los campos de la región y comer de la fresca y limpia hierba que crece en los alrededores.  El proceso hasta que alcanzan su desarrollo óptimo es de seis meses, después los vende con personas dedicadas a cocinar un platillo típico de la región: la barbacoa.
   Como se mencionó al inicio, se encuentra muy agradecida con VF México y KIVA ya que siempre han confiado en ella y los préstamos los utiliza para reinvertir en sus negocios. "Cuando inicié con la cría no tenía prácticamente nada, pero con el tiempo  he mejorado y el número de mis ovejas va en aumento y las ganancias también" comentó muy contenta y sonriente.
     Las demás integrantes del grupo son Leticia R, Erika, Hilaria, Mónica y Leticia quienes invertirían en ganado ovino mientras que Juana y Adelina harán lo propio con sus bordados artesanales.
* La fotografía fue tomada en el jardín del municipio, Juliana es quien porta el llamativo collar rojo.
texts.en:
In a very tranquil community of Mexico State, a very united group formed several years ago called "Sorpresa" [Surprise]. Its members decided to name the group like that because of having found the benefits that VisionFund México provides was a real surprise. It should be mentioned that their community is identified by practicing the cultivation of corn around the whole territory; once the final product is harvested, they rejoice excessively since this is the fruit of an entire year's effort.

Juliana outstrips all of her companions in terms of work and always maintains an entrepreneurial spirit. She does even the impossible to keep her family united and content, with her husband Teofilo and their two children who are found studying and are the pride of the pair. More than twenty years ago, she started raising sheep in her community since the animals can roam the fields of the region peacefully and eat fresh and clean grass that grows in the surrounding areas. The process, up until attaining their optimal development, is six months. Later, they sell them with people dedicated to cooking a typical dish of the region: barbecue. As mentioned at the beginning, she is found very thankful for VisionFund México and Kiva since they've always trusted her and she will utilize the loans to reinvest in her businesses. "When I started raising, I didn't have practically anything, but with time I've improved and the number of my sheep is increasing and the earnings too," she commented very content and smiling.

The remaining members of the group are Leticia R, Erika, Hilaria, Mónica and Leticia, who will invest in sheep while Juana and Adelina will do their own with artisanal embroideries.

*The photograph was taken in the garden of the town, Juliana is the one wearing the striking red necklace.

loans.use: comprara borregos.

location.town: San Nicolas Guadalupe, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Jeyson Antonio

texts.es: Jeyson es un joven de 27 años, apasionado por la porcicultura y la ganadería que emprendió su propio negocio hace tres años, él cría cerdos para posteriormente sacrificarlos y comercializar su carne, también oferta carne de res que compra a ganaderos de la región. Él habita en Soledad y en esta misma localidad tiene su expendio y sus clientes son amigos, vecinos y transeúntes del lugar.  Con la finalidad de comprar concentrado y crías de cerdo para su engorde y posterior comercialización en la temporada decembrina, está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo que invertirá en este proyecto. Jeyson es un emprendedor que desea ver a futuro su negocio más competitivo y mejorar su imagen.  En lo personal desea conseguir los recursos que le permitan comprar su vivienda y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jeyson is 27 years old and he is passionate about pig farming and cattle. He started his own business three years ago. He raises pigs for slaughter in order to sell the meat, and he also sells beef that buys from cattle farmers in the area. He lives in Soledad, which is where he has his small store. His clients are friends, neighbours and local passersby.

He is requesting a Kiva loan in order to purchase concentrate and piglets for fattening so that he can later sell them in the holiday season. It's the first loan that he is applying for through the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, which will invest in the project. Jeyson is an entrepreneur who wishes to see his business become more competitive and to improve its image in the future. He hopes to obtain the resources necessary so that he can buy a house and improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed concentrate and piglets

loans.name: Manushak

texts.en:
Manushak lives in Gavar city in the Gegharkunik region of Armenia. In Armenian, her name means "violet". Manushak has two sons; her elder son is now in the Russian Federation working in a furniture workshop while her younger son is studying at the college of the department of economics.
Manushak is a very devoted mother who does her best to provide her two sons with good living conditions as much as she is able. She is also a farmer who keeps cows and heifers. She makes very tasty cheese, curd and butter from her milk, as well as macun (a yoghurt-like product). She takes these products to the city's wholesale market and sells to her regular customers. Manushak also has a plot of land on which she cultivates potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbers, peppers and sunflowers on her land. She sells these for extra income for her family.
Now Manushak is worried because her cattle do not have enough fodder. But she is hopeful that she will receive a loan via Kiva's support, and she has decided to use this to buy cattle fodder.

loans.use: to buy fodder for her cattle

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with no children. She lives at her own house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, she has operated a shoe-selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 20,000, she wants to purchase a stock of shoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of shoes for resale.

loans.name: Andranik

texts.en:
Andranik is a 48-year-old married man living in Hovtashen village, which is in the southern part of Armenia in the Shirak region. He has two children, ages 18 and 24.

Andranik has been running his mixed farm for many years, and he sells a wide variety of products at the local market. His primary income comes from selling milk, meat, cereals, vegetables, chickens, and cattle (occasionally). The main challenge that he faces is a lack of sufficient capital to take advantage of business opportunities.

Andranik has now requested this loan to purchase fertilizer to cultivate his land and forage to feed his livestock to increase his family's income. He hopes that extra income generated with this loan will help him pay for his family's basic needs and allow him to provide proper nutrition for his family.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer to cultivate his land and for forage to feed his livestock to increase his family's income.

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en: Sophy is 58 years old and a married mother with one child in her care. She lives in the Kandal Province in Cambodia. She has worked as a teacher for over 20 years. Her husband, 52, is a grocer. Sophy and her husband can earn around $18 per day. Now, she would like to buy more groceries for her husband to sell. With this loan, she will be able to have enough money for her husband to expand his business. In the future, she is going to build a new proper house and wants to help her child earn higher education.

loans.use: to buy more groceries for her husband to sell

loans.name: Russel

texts.es: Russel es un joven universitario de 26 años. Actualmente se encuentra cursando el noveno ciclo de su carrera de Administración. El decidió estudiar esta carrera porque para el es muy importante el espíritu emprendedor, capaz de participar en la creación, gestión y dirección de empresas que satisfagan de manera óptima las necesidades de la sociedad. Ademas de ser un joven aplicado en sus ratos libres le gusta salir a jugar fútbol con sus amigos. Para obtener algún ingreso trabaja esporadicamente como taxista. El solicito el préstamo para poder pagar sus pensiones de estudios. Ya se encuentra a un tan solo medio año de terminar su carrera. Se siente agradecido con las personas que le pueden ayudar a cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Russel, 26, is a university student in the ninth cycle of his Administration degree studies. He chose this field of studies because for him the entrepreneurial spirit is very important, being able to participate in the creation, operation and management of businesses to meet society's needs in the best way.

In addition to being a diligent student, Russel likes to play soccer with his friends in his free time. He works occasionally as a taxi driver in order to get some income. 

He has applied for this loan to pay his student fees. He is just half a year away from completing his degree studies. He is grateful to the lenders who are able to support him in reaching his goals.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Mukrima

texts.en:
Mukrima, born in 1982, is a woman with a higher education. She is divorced and has a daughter, for whom she is the sold provider. Mukrima has been working in a local market in her region for seven years. She works hard to provide good living conditions for her daughter.

Now, she needs financial support because she needs to buy medicines for her ill daughter's treatment. She is asking for a 5,000 TJS loan to purchase the medicines, and she awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy medicines for her daughter's treatment.

loans.name: Bokk Ndeye Tilene Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le quatre juin 2010. Ce groupe est composé de dix femmes qui se soutiennent mutuellement et remboursent leurs prêts sans difficultés. Madame Aissatou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de trente deux ans et mère de trois garçons. Elle s'active dans la vente de petit déjeuner depuis plus de cinq années. Le prêt sollicité va servir à renforcer son activité. Les bénéfices vont servir à subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en:
This "banc villageois" was inaugurated on June the 4th, 2010. The group is made up of 10 women who support each other and repay their loans without difficulty.

Aissatou, who is on the right of the photo and raising her hand, is the group representative. She is married, 32 years old and the mother of 3 boys.

She has been selling breakfast for over 5 years. She is requesting this loan so that she can strengthen her business. The profit that she earns will be used to meet her needs.

loans.use: to buy the basic ingredients she needs to be able to make and sell breakfast.

loans.name: Avetik

texts.en:
Avetik is 22 years old and he lives in Gavar city of the Gegharkunik region. This young man is the single son of this family. Because of having a vocational education, he decided to become a farmer and develop the farm established by his father. Avetik lives with his mother (she has a vocational medical education and works at the pharmacy). His father is away from home working in the Russian Federation.

Avetik has cows, a calf and pigs on his farm. The farm products that Avetik sells with his mother are milk, macun (national dairy-product), cheese and meat. He also has a hay field from which he gathers hay for his farm cattle as a fodder. Avetik has an idea of developing swine breeding on the farm, an idea that his father also wanted to realize but could not due to lack of finances. Now, since Avetik found out about Kiva support and a Kiva loan, he thinks it is right time to make his idea come true. With this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams, he wants to buy a pig and several piglets which will mean more meat sales from his farm and more income for his nice family as well.

loans.use: to buy a pig and several piglets which will mean more meat sales from his farm and more income for his nice family as well.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en:
Habiba is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past ten years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Wayua

texts.en: Wayua is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells bread, soap, flour, soda and other items. She has been involved in this business for 11 years. Her business is located in a busy place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of products. She will use the KES 9,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, soda, flour and other items. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standard. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, soda, flour and other items

loans.name: Dianky Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de deux femmes existe depuis 2010. Elles sont très fidèle à CAURIE MICROFINANCE et remboursent régulièrement leurs prêts. Madame Aissatou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 44 ans et mère quinze enfants dont dix fille. Elle s'active dans la vente de boutique villageoise depuis plusieurs années. Elle va acheter des produits alimentaires pour renforcer sa boutique. Elle a beaucoup d'expérience dans son activité. Les bénéfices vont servir à participer à la dépenses quotidienne.
texts.en:
This group, which has existed since 2010, is made up of 2 women. They are very loyal to CAURIE Micro Finance and regularly make their loan repayments.

Aissatou, who is on the right of the photo and raising her hand, is the group representative. She is married, 44 years old and the mother of 15 children, 10 of whom are girls.

She has been selling products in a shop in the village for several years. She will reinforce her inventory with food products. She has a lot of experience in her line of work. The profits will be used to cover the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Vahe

texts.en: Vahe is 29 years old and he lives in Gavar city of the Gegharkunik region. Vahe is a farmer who is also employed. He works as a driver-distributor. Vahe now lives with his parents and sister. His mother and sister are doctors. Vahe has 10 cows on his farm and he sells a nice assortment of dairy-products. He sells milk, macun (national dairy-products), cheese, butter, curd and also beef. Vahe greatly hopes that the enlargement of the variety of his farm cattle will increase the assortment of his farm products and the income from their sale as well. Vahe also wants to start swine breeding because with the coming of the cold seasons pork is especially demanded by the butchers. With this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams, he wants to purchase piglets and also fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and also fodder for all his farm cattle because with the coming of the cold seasons pork is especially demanded.

loans.name: Gulsen

texts.en:
Gülşen's husband is deceased, and she has three children, all of whom are adults and married. She lives alone and sells cosmetics and cleaning products through a network system. She has used loans three times. With the help of these loans, she bought products in bulk, sold them, gained money, and expanded her business.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Gülşen hanım eşi vefat etmiş üç çocuğu var. Çocukları yetişkin ve evliler yalnız yaşıyor. Netwörk sistemi ile kozmetik ve temizlik ürünleri satıyor. Üç kez mikro kredi kullandı aldığı mikro kredi ile temizlik ve kozmetik ürünlerini toptan alarak ve satarak para kazandı.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and cleaning products.

loans.name: Dianky Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois dont fait partie ce groupe a été inauguré en juin 2010. Ce est composé de vingt femmes qui prennent des crédits qu'elles remboursent avec succès. Madame Oulimata qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de trente neuf ans et mère de sept enfants dont six filles. Elle s'active dans la vente de poissons secs depuis plus de quatre années. Elle va acheter avec le prêt sollicité des poissons secs en quantité. les bénéfices vont servir à subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
The "banc villageois" to which this group belongs was inaugurated in June of 2010. This group is made up of 5 women who take out loans that they successfully repay.

Oulimata, who is on the right of the photo and raising her hand, is the group representative. She is married, 39 years old and the mother of 7 children, 6 of whom are girls.

She has been selling dried fish for over 4 years. She will use the requested loan to buy a large amount of dried fish. The profits that she makes will be used to meet the family's needs.

loans.use: to buy dried fish.

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
Salima is a 47-year-old, married mother of seven children. 28 years ago, she opened a grocery shop to help her husband cover the needs and expenses of their children.

Salima is hardworking and ambitious. She has a good reputation in her region and is well known by her customers. She is trying desperately to develop her business. Thus, today she is taking a loan from Al Majmoua (a Kiva field partner) to increase her merchandise and offer new items and products to satisfy her customers during the upcoming winter season.

Salima hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise and offer new items and products to satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Challenge Accepted - Lminhhtrường Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hóa is 41 years old and she is married with 2 children. She has operated a food stall selling fish for more than 10 years. Hóa lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. And the income from this business is unstable because the price and the amount of fishes depend on the weather conditions.

The main hardship that Hóa faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to resell.

In 2006, Hóa joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Hóa has successfully repaid eight loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is the group leader of "Challenge accepted - LMinhHTrường", which consists of six members.

In the future, Hóa hopes for her family to be healthy and happy and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell.

loans.name: Dianky Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois dont fait parti ce groupe a été inauguré en juin 2010. Ce groupe est composé de six femmes qui remboursent toujours leurs prêts sans difficultés. Madame Dieneba qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est divorcée, âgée de quarante cinq ans sans enfant. Elle s'active dans la vente de poissons secs et des jus depuis cinq années. Le prêt sollicité va servir à renforcer son activité. Les bénéfices vont servir à faire face aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The "banc villageois" that this group belongs to was inaugurated in June of 2010. The group is made up of 6 women who always repay their loans without difficulty.

Djeneba, who is on the right of the photo and raising her hand, is the group representative. She is divorced, 45 years old and has no children.

She has been selling dried fish and juice for 5 years. The loan she is requesting will be used to strengthen her business. The profit that she earns will enable her to cover her family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy dried fish and the basic ingredients needed to make juice.

loans.name: Begiemar John

texts.en: Begiemar John is a security guard and a member of Paglaum MPC. He decided to give a try in hog raising after he learned he can avail financial assistance for his chosen business. Begiemar John has maintained his membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. He has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. Recently, she availed a loan to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins for his chosen business. Begiemar John wishes to continuously manage his business more effectively with the support of his family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en: Teresia is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells bread, soap, flour, cooking oil, soda and other items. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a busy place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of products. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, soda, flour and other items. Her business goal is to expand and open other branches within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, soda, flour and other items

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Inspired with her dream of buying a multicab or tricycle for business, Evangeline is working really hard to improve her general store. She knows that the income derived from her store varies from time to time. It is affected by the school schedule and presence of students to whom she usually cater. That is why she added different types of beverages plus gallons of mineral water which are in demand in their community. She is also targeting to have an alternative business like small canteen or eatery. These are the reasons why Evangeline needs some help from you in the amount of PHP 11,000 to buy additional supplies of assorted groceries, beverages and mineral water. She is positive that she can pay it back because she holds minor responsibilities now that her children are already grown-up and nurturing their own families. Her husband, Ligorio, continues to work in the Local Government Unit.

She draws inspiration from her co-fellowship* members at CCT Credit Cooperative in Bayugan, Surigao Del Sur. They meet every week to share stories of their life and business and to draw strength from the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies of assorted groceries, beverages and mineral water

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy works hard to support her family. Juvy is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Juvy requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Juvy has been in this business for 38 years now.

Juvy would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Andranik

texts.en: Andranik lives in the village of Chapni in the Syunik region. This man lives here with his wife and three sons. In this village, he has large farm with 24 cows and also a lot of chickens. Andrnik sells a lot of beef and also eggs, poultry, milk, macun (national dairy-product), cheese, butter and curd. For all his farm products, his wife very skillfully finds customers. Farming is their only source of income for their living. Andranik mentions that he has been farming since he was a very young age and that many years and efforts were needed in order to establish and keep his farm. He is very hopeful that maybe one of his sons will continue his work and even make his farm bigger and richer with cattle. Now, Andranik hurries to store a lot of fodder for his farm cattle since in the region it is already cold and pastures are already too poor to feed the cattle. He wants to use the loan for the purchase of a lot of fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.use: to purchase a lot of fodder for all his farm cattle since in the region it is already cold and pastures are already too poor to feed the cattle.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is farmer living in Artashat town with her husband and their son. With 12 years of experience in farming behind her, Anna currently cultivates wheat and corn and keeps livestock of 2 sows, 6 piglets and 20 hens.

Her income mainly comes from selling her harvest at the local market. Currently, the main challenge she faces is the lack of sufficient capital to take advantage of business opportunities.

Anan asks for this loan to purchase wheat seeds, fertilizer and forage for feeding the livestock for the farm to function well and continue bring income for Anna's family.

This is Anna's first loan so it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for wheat seeds, fertilizer and forage for feeding the livestock for the farm to function well and bring income for family

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en: Susanna is 61 years old and she lives with her smallest son in Kapan city of the Syunik region. Susanna’s elder son is married and he lives with his family separately. Susanna has a vocational medical education and has already worked for 30 years at the city’s hospital as a nurse. At the same time, Susanna with great pleasure takes care of her vegetable and fruit garden. She cultivates potatoes, beans, cucumbers and peppers. Her fruit garden is also very nice as she has apple, plum, fig and mulberry trees. She sells all these goods right from her house and also uses them for her family, wisely placing them in her pantry so that during all the winter period she can provide her family with fresh and sweet fruits from her garden. Susanna likes her fruit and vegetable garden very much. It is where she works, rests and dreams. Her smallest son already promised her that he will surely continue his mother’s beloved occupation and make their garden bigger and richer with the harvest. With this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams, Susanna wants to buy diesel fuel, fertilizer, seedlings and also young trees of persimmon and apple.

loans.use: to buy diesel fuel, fertilizer, seedlings and also young trees of persimmon and apple

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Lay, 47, is living in Kampong Thom province. She is a widowed mother of two dependent children, one of whom is studying in university. To earn main source of income, she is growing rainy- and dry-season rice. She is milling rice to earn additional income too. 
She is now applying for a loan from VisionFund to pay for school fees for her daughter who is studying Accounting. She dreams of seeing her daughter graduate and succeed in her career life. She also hopes to increase more yields to support her family’s living.

loans.use: to pay for school fees for her daughter who is studying Accounting.

loans.name: Thu's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thu, 26 years old, is the Kinh ethnic majority. Her family has three members, including her husband and her lovely daughter. The family is living in Son La city under the Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from small trading. However, the profit from trading is not much, so the income is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and saved small amount. She intends to repair her house but the saved amount is not enough to do. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan to buy materials for this purpose.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time, and she hopes that the loan amount will help her family have better living condition with the spacious house.

loans.use: to buy materials for repairing her house.

loans.name: Vy

texts.en: Vy is a 20-year-old single freshman who resides in the Battambang Province in Cambodia. He is pursuing a Bachelor’s degree, majoring in Law at a university in the province. His father is a rice farmer and his mother sells fish. Currently, Vy would like to request a loan because he needs finances to pay his university fees from the first to the fourth year. With the loan, he will be able to earn a Bachelor’s degree successfully. As for his future dreams, he hopes to have a good job in a financial institution with a reasonable salary, so he will be able to build a proper house.

loans.use: to pay his university fees from the first to the fourth year.  He is studying Law.

loans.name: Hiya's Group

texts.fr:
Créé le 22 Mai 2009, ce groupe est composé de femmes très actives. Il existe une bonne entente entre elles. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Hiya (debout à l’extrême droite avec la main levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 31 ans et mère de 04 enfants. Elle s’active dans la vente de savon qu’elle achète dans les marchés hebdomadaires pour le revendre dans son village. 

Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 02 sacs de savon à 25000f l'un pour le revendre en détails.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle compte participer à la prise en charge de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Created on the 22nd of May, 2009, this group is made up of very hard-working women who get along well together. They are principally small retailers.

Hiya (standing on the far right with her hand raised) is the group's featured borrower. She is married, 31 years old, and the mother of 4 children.

She sells soap which she buys at the weekly markets and resells in her village. She plans to use this new loan to buy 2 bags of soap (at 25 000 francs per bag) to resell to retail customers. She plans to use her profits to help take care of her children.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of soap (at 25 000 francs per bag) for resale to retail customers.

loans.name: Fairu

texts.en:
Fairu is in his late 20s and is single with no children. He has been running two projects, a retail shop and selling charcoal, for three years. He works from 7 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Fairu's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to restock the out-of-stock items in the shop inventory, started selling charcoal and has paid back all his loans successfully. He used the profit to take care of himself, to repay the loan, to build a charcoal store and to cover household expenses.

He will use this loan to increase the shop inventory and to buy sacks of charcoal. He dreams of becoming an international businessman.

Fairu will be accountable for paying back his loan.

loans.use: to increase the shop inventory and to buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Zhasmen

texts.en:
Zhasmen is thankful for her first Kiva loan and partnership that greatly developed her business. She lives in a rented flat in Yerevan with her youngest daughter. Her eldest daughter is already married.

Zhasmen started her sewing business during a very hard time in her life (she lost her husband). As she mentions, her responsibility and great love toward her children outweighed her grief, and she became stronger and ready to start from the very bottom. Since then (25 years ago), she has sewn and taken great orders, which she always manages on time and cutely. She has a lot of regular customers who give orders for men's and women's clothes (e.g., trousers, shirts, dresses, etc.). Zhasmen’s daughter very skillfully helps her mother with her work and picks up the skills needed to do the work quickly.

Now she needs a 500,000 AMD loan to fulfill a big order. She needs to buy a lot of materials and threads for her sewing business. Zhasmen dreams of having her own flat, where she will be able to have a workplace for her sewing activities. With her work day and night, she believes that she will manage to fulfill this dream one day.

loans.use: to buy materials and threads to fulfill a big order for her sewing business.

loans.name: Mwafatime

texts.en:
Mwafatime is a married mother of five children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For over three years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.

With the KES 25,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: William

texts.en: Willam is 26 years old. He is not married and has no children. He has had a motorcycle transport business for 2 years. He will be using the loan to buy a motorcycle to help serve more clients and get more income and hopes this will enable him to start another business. His hopes and dreams for the future are to buy more motorcycles and open more businesses and be able to build a house.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to help serve more clients and get more income and be able to start another business.

loans.name: Aise Betul

texts.en:
Betül started selling from catalog from her home. Later on, with the help of the loan from MAYA she opened a little millinery store in the neighbourhood. When her business went well, she decided to enlarge her store and opened her new store on the main street with a large potential forcustomers.

Now, in addition to her millinery store she opened a stationary store near it and expanded her business. With the help of her third loan from MAYA she bought stationary in bulk.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Betül Hanım iş hayatına evde katalogdan satış yaparak başladı. Daha sonra MAYA’dan aldığı kredi ile mahalle arasında çok küçük bir tuhafiye dükkânı açtı. İşleri iyi gidince tuhafiye dükkânını büyütmeye karar verdi. Müşteri potansiyelinin daha fazla olduğu bir cadde üzerine yeni dükkânını açtı. Şimdi tuhafiye dükkânın yan tarafına birde kırtasiye açarak işini geliştirdi. Maya dan 3. kredisini kullanan Betül Hanım kırtasiye dükkanına toptan ürün aldı.

loans.use: to buy stationary products in bulk.

loans.name: Sema

texts.en:
Sema is married and has one child. Sema is selling cosmetics through a network system. She has used loans twice. With the help of the loans, she bought products in bulk, sold them, and gained money.

With the help of this new loan, she will buy bulk products, gain money and expand her business. Her aim is to make a career in this business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Sema hanım evli bir çocuk annesi. Sema hanım netwörk sistemi ile kozmetik ürünleri pazarlaması yapıyor. İki kez mikro kredi kullandı. Aldığı kredi ile kozmetik ürünlerini toptan olarak aldı sattı ve para kazandı. Aldığı yeni kredi ile de kozmetik ürünlerini toptan alacak ve satarak para kazanacak ve işlerini geliştirecek. Hedefi netwörk sisteminde kariyer yapmak.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products.

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
Maya has been selling fruits and vegetables in Noyemberyan town since 2010. She is 52, mother of two sons. Being in this business for 5 years, enabled Maya to gain loyal client base. Currently, the main challenge to her business problems with transportation to bring the fruit and vegetables stock from neighbouring regions.

Maya asks this loan to purchase tires for the truck and also purchase stock of fruits and vegetables to develop her small business in Noyemberyan town.

Maya hopes to receive lenders' support and improve her business, so her family will have the opportunity to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for tires for the truck and purchase stock of fruits and vegetables to develop her small business

loans.name: Nahad Group

texts.en: Weang’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Weang and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.  Weang and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Weang’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima has been running a school for 7 years. Saima was always interested in providing education to the children in her community, and was determined to be successful. She desired to provide maximum facilities to her school students, but due to lack financial capacity she could not make it possible.

She is providing education to 126 students 55 % of which are females. A loan of PKR 110,000 will allow her to buy lab equipment and also furniture and renovate her school. Saima's mission is to continue running this school for the long run and to expand by enrolling more students.

loans.use: to buy lab equipment and also furniture and renovate her school.

loans.name: Suo's Group

texts.en:
Suo, 31, is a local resident living in Battamnang province. She is a mother blessed with three children, two of whom are in school and other one is under age of school. She has grown rice as her main source of income to support on her living condition. Beside this, she can get extra income via pigs and cows-raising. Drought is her main challenge in her family’s business; it has made her rice grow poorly.

Suo has involved with her farming for 10 years and she can save from her income about 5 USD per day. She leads a group of four members to seeking her first loan with VisionFund.
