As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy rice seed and to pay for plowing fees in order to improve on her farming to produce more yields for her family. She hopes that she can get more income from her family’s business to expand her farmland and support her children’s studying on time.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and to pay for plowing fees in order to make her farm produce a good yield for her family.

loans.name: Hilala

texts.en:
Hilala is a 59-year-old, widowed Palestinian refugee and mother of two who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. She has spent most of her life working hard to provide her children with necessities. Her husband passed away, leaving her responsible for their living.

Hilala started her own vegetable selling business 20 years ago in the Palestinian camp where she lives. In addition to vegetables, Hilala sells special seasonal Mouneh needs, in addition to oven spare parts and accessories to make sure that she can benefit from several sources of income in one place.

Today, Hilala is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop her business and increase her merchandise with vegetables and gas.

Hilala hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to develop her business and increase her merchandise with vegetables and gas.

loans.name: Melane

texts.en:
Melane is engaged in a hog-raising business to earn a living while her husband is engaged in a fish-selling business. They work together to raise their three school-aged children, ages 14, 13 and 10 years old.

Melane and her husband want to give their children a better future someday. Hence, they wanted to improve their business to have enough money to send them to school. That is why Melane is asking for a loan to buy feed for their pigs to have better growth and become profitable. She will also use the money she is requesting to buy more fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy feed and fish.

loans.name: Emine

texts.en:
Emine is married and has a child. Emine is selling cosmetics and cleaning products through a network system.

With the help of the loan, she is planning to buy a bulk amount of products, sell them, gain money and expand her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Emine hanım evli bir çocuk annesi. Emine hanım netwörk sistemi ile kozmetik ve temizlik malzemeleri satışı yapıyor. Aldığı mikro kredi ile kozmetik ve temizlik malzemelerini toptan alarak satarak para kazanmak ve işlerini geliştirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and cleaning products.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en: Cristina lives in Merida in the province of Leyte, Philippines. She raises hogs near her house to provide for her two young girls. This has been her business for three years. Her husband earns income through a motorcycle transport business. Cristina is asking for a loan to buy piglets and feed and to buy materials to repair the barn. She plans to make room for more pigs in the future so she can earn a better income and continue supporting the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and materials for barn repair

loans.name: Abisunganye Group

texts.en:
Leoncie is a 47-year-old, married mother of two children. She is the leader of the Abisunganye Group. She is the one who is holding a paper in her hand. All members of the group are requesting funds to expand their businesses with the hopes of supporting their children and families.

Leoncie sells beans, tomatoes, vegetables, etc., at the market. She works hard to support her family and provide them with a better life. Every morning Leoncie opens her stand at 7 a.m. and works tirelessly until her daily supply is sold. Beans, tomatoes and vegetables are staple foods in the Rwandan diet, so Leoncie foresees an unwavering demand, which she hopes will allow her to expand her business as she acquires more funds.

She is requesting a loan from Kiva, via Vision Finance Company, to buy larger quantities of beans, tomatoes, and vegetables to sell to her community.

With her profits, she will be able to get medical insurance for her family, pay the school fees for her children, build her own house and buy some animals like goats and pigs.

loans.use: to buy larger quantities of beans, tomatoes, vegetables, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a 34-year-old, married mother of one child. Two years ago, she started selling clothes from her house to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of her family. She is a hard worker and ambitious lady who is trying hard to develop her business and improve her family's living conditions. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to pay for her driver's license in order to visit her customers easily. Fatima hopes to expand her business in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions. More immediately, she wants to buy a new bedroom set for her child.

loans.use: to pay for her driver's license in order to visit her customers easily.

loans.name: Umurungawiminsi Group

texts.en: Anitha is 29 years old and is married with three children between the ages of six and eight. She is the president of the group that is called Umurungawiminsi and is the one who has a bag on her lap. She owns a business selling wedding clothes. She has four years of experience in this business, and she works from 6 a.m. until 7 p.m. every day except on Sunday sometimes. Anitha has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy various wedding clothes. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future, reinvest in her business, renovate her house, and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy various wedding clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jeysel Faviola

texts.es: Jeysel de 33 años, esta con ADIM por primera vez, solicitando crédito para el mejoramiento y crecimientos de su microempresa, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva ambulante y a la preparación de cócteles en su domicilio. Con la ayudo de su compañero de vida y su hermana tienes estos negocios desde hace varios años. Y ahora invertirá en la compra de pantalones para damas y caballeros, zapatos de mujeres y una cocina para la preparación de calidad de sus cócteles.  Asegurando que con este crédito las ganancias serán mejores y lograra sus demás metas.
texts.en: Jeysel, 33, is with ADIM for the first time, applying for a loan for the improvement and growth of her microenterprise. She works selling new clothing on foot and the preparation of seafood cocktails in her home. With the help of her life partner and her sister, they've had these businesses for several years. And now she will invest in the purchase of pants for women and men, women's shoes and a kitchen for the preparation of her cocktails. Assuring that with this loan, the profits will be better and she will achieve her other goals.

loans.use: to buy pants for women and men, women's shoes and a kitchen for the preparation of her seafood cocktails.

loans.name: Linette

texts.en:
Linette is a 47-year-old woman from Calape, Bohol. She is married and has three children. Her oldest child is 24 years old, while her youngest child is 11 years old.

She earn a living by buying and selling sandals, shoes, apparel, underwear and cosmetic products from Avon and MSE (a company that sells products mentioned earlier).

She is in need of a loan for additional capital (to buy the products mentioned earlier). Linette wants to improve this business to help her husband in raising their children so they could give them a better future.

loans.use: to buy sandals, shoes, apparel, underwear and cosmetic products.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en: Sandra is a married woman. She is a mother of six children that are still dependent. Her oldest child is 19 years old while her youngest child is 10 years old. Her husband provides for them by driving a “habal-habal” (visayan term for motorcycle with extended seat to accommodate more passengers). To help her husband improve his livelihood, Sandra started her own business. She does “buri” (the largest palm in Philippines) weaving and makes mats. She has been doing this for 11 years. Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy “buri” leaves. Early this year, she successfully started other business opportunities like running a sari-sari store. She will also use the money to buy assorted stock for her store. Additionally, Sandra is very determined woman. She wants to improve her business and have a sustainable means of living in the future.

loans.use: to buy "buri" leaves and assorted stock for her store.

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es: Fredy es un emprendedor de 37 años, propietario de un taller de soldadura ubicado en el municipio de Soledad, en donde conjuntamente con su padre trabaja principalmente con hierro y se realizarán trabajos de forja, cerramientos metálicos, estructuras de hierro, rejas para ventanas, puertas entre otros. Él aprendió el oficio de su padre que por ser una persona con experiencia en el sector ejecuta la labor de jefe de producción del taller, mientras Fredy se dedica a la administración del negocio. Trabaja diariamente en el horario de 7:00 a.m. a 6:00 p.m. y sus clientes son en su mayoría vecinos y recomendados del sector de la construcción. Actualmente está solicitando su primer credikiva a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, recursos que proyecta invertir en la compra de un taladro y materiales como hierro, platinas y  electrodos; su proyecto es  fortalecer los equipos de trabajo y el capital del negocio pues  considera que la mitad de los edificios actuales necesitan trabajos de rehabilitación y otros condicionantes para reforma de las edificaciones, que se constituyen en su mercado potencial. Su sueño es ampliar la cobertura de su negocio e incrementar sus ingresos para obtener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Fredy is a 37 year old entrepreneur. He has a soldering shop that is located in the Soledad municipality. He works there together with his father. He works primarily with iron and he does ironwork, metal fences, iron structures, bars for windows, and doors, among others. He learned this trade from his father, who because of his experience in the field is the production boss of the shop. Fredy takes care of the administration of the business.

He works every day on a schedule from 7:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. Most of his customers are neighbors and people referred from the construction field.

He is currently requesting his first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He plans to use the resources to buy a drill and materials like iron, plates, and electrodes.

His project is to strengthen his work equipment and his business capital. He feels that half of the current buildings need rehabilitation work and other conditioning in order to upgrade the buildings. These are his potential market.

His dream is to expand the coverage of his business and to increase his earnings in order to get a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a drill and materials like iron, plates, and electrodes.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en: Kenneth is a 34-year-old married man from Bien Unido. He has two children, one aged two and a one-month-old baby son. Kenneth owns a small sari-sari store that is attached to his home. He sells toiletries, matches, detergent, shampoo and snacks. He is asking for a loan to buy sachets of Milo, milk, sugar, toothpaste, hair conditioner, canned food and biscuits. He hopes that, with his additional capital, he can make his store look full and more attractive. In the future, he plans to send his children to school.

loans.use: to buy sachets of Milo (chocolate malt powder), milk, sugar, toothpaste, hair conditioner, canned food and biscuits.

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa has been involved in the clothing sales business for three years. She is a divorced woman living with her son in Vanadzor town.

Larisa organizes sales from her house, receiving different orders from her clients and bringing the stock of clothing from Yerevan town.

To be able to purchase winter clothing and meet her clients' demand, Larisa applied for this loan. She will be very thankful if lenders help her with the development of her business.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of winter clothing to sell to customers and meet the demand.

loans.name: Mesia

texts.en:
Mesia is in her early 30s and is single with no children. She has been running a grocery store for four years now. She works from 9am to mid-night daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Mesia's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase on the drinks stock, renovated on her new grocery shop and has paid back her loan successfully. She used the profit to reinvest in business, to repay loan and covered household expenses.

She will use this loan to buy the best selling drinks in her grocery store. She dreams of buy the best selling drinks in her grocery store and to start selling chips chicken, chips egg, chips meat balls. etc. She dreams of buying a plot of land.

Mesia will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the best selling drinks in her grocery store and to start selling chips, chicken, chips egg, chips meat balls. etc

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena is a 36-year-old woman who lives in the city of Baybay, Leyte. She is married and has three children who are the center of her life. That is why; she does her own business to help her husband uplift their financial stability. She is doing mat weaving while her husband works hard on their farm. Rowena is asking a loan to buy “buri” (the largest palm in the Philippines) leaves, which will be used in making mat. She will also buy dye to give colors to the mat. In the future, Rowena wants to improve her business as well as their economic situation to give better lives to their children.

loans.use: to buy "buri" leaves and dye

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela lives a simple life with her family in the town of Concepcion in Iloilo, Philippines. She is a 45-year-old woman and mother of her two children; they are 21 and 15 years of age.

Carmela and her husband earn a living through fishing. They have been doing this for 22 years, ever since they started their married life. They also work together to provide the needs of their family. Thus, Carmela is asking for a bigger loan amount to buy a new engine for her fishing boat to enhance their catch.

Additionally, Carmela is a woman who dreams of her family having a comfortable means of living.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Kunduskhan

texts.ru: Кундусхан, 56 лет, вдова, мать 2 сыновей. У нее средне-специальное образование, работает уборщицей в нотариусе. также с 1999 года она начала заниматься животноводством и полеводством, этому делу она верна и по сегодняшний день. Благодаря упорному труду Кундусхан, на сегодня у нее в хозяйстве есть 3 коровы. На 1,80 Га земли выращивает ячмень для реализации. Также продает экологически-чистое молоко. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет до 13,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кундусхан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 дойных коров для увеличения поголовья скота и объемов реализации экологически чистого молока. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, также на приобретение корма и сена для скота.чтобы иметь возможность приобрести земельный надел для полеводства.
texts.en: Kunduskhan is 56, widowed, and a mother of two sons. She has a vocational education and works as a cleaner at a notary public. She has also been farming and raising livestock since 1999. Thanks to Kunduskhan's hard work, she currently has three cows. She plants barley to sell on a 1.8 hectare plot of land and also sells organic milk. She earns up to 13,000 som (KGS) per month. Kunduskhan applied for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to buy two dairy cows to increase her herd and her sales volume of organic milk. She plans to use the earnings from the loan to invest in developing her business, to purchase feed and hay for her livestock, and to acquire land for planting crops.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows to increase her organic milk sales.

loans.name: Mình

texts.en:
Mrs Mình is 47 years old and she is married.
She has been working in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years.
Mình lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. And the income from this business is not high enough to do what she really needs to comfort her life.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet and bathroom.
This is Mình first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan could make her little dream come true.
In the future, Mình hopes for her business to do well, to buy land of her own and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: To purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet and bathroom

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen is a hard working woman residing in the rural town of Dauis, Bohol. She is 36-year-old married woman with four children. Her oldest child is 12 while the youngest is 4.
She earns a living by selling balut is a developing duck embryo (fertilized duck egg) that is boiled and eaten in the shell. It originated and is commonly sold as street food in the Philippines.

For the past 8 years, she has been selling balut to the locals in her place. She would like to improve her earnings to become stable.
She has requested a loan to buy more supplies of balut, vinegar and cellophane. She could now start to maximize the resources and augment her income soon.

She dreams of having a small business that could be reliable to support her family and also to continue finance the schooling of her children for brighter future.

loans.use: to buy more supply of balut, vinegar and cellophane.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto is an active member of Paglaum MPC for five years. He is 67 years old, a widower with 3 adult age children and is known in Pagadian City for his farming activities. He had availed various services from the cooperative including loan products in support to hisd farming business.

Now that he needs an amount to pay for a medical check up and purchase of maintenance medicines that he asks for his 6th loan from the coop.

loans.use: to pay for medical check up and purchase of maintenance medicines

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
44-year-old Teodora runs a sari-sari(variety) store.  She sold commodities like  seasonings, canned goods, soft drink, shampoo, coffee,eggs, cooking oil, rice, feed pig and powdered soap. 
She resides in Dauis, Bohol. She is married and has five children ages  12-19 years old respectively.

She operates a sari-sari(variety) store for five years now. She caters mostly neighbors and local settlers in her place.  

Teodora decided to avail the loan to buy supplies such as rice, feeds and soft drinks. These  would help her boost and improve the content of her store.  It enables her to provide her family needs and  continue expand her livelihood become more sustainable in the future.

She is very grateful to Kiva for your support.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as rice, feeds and soft drinks

loans.name: Herine

texts.en: Herine is 45 years old. She is married with two children. She has had a bead work business for the last 10 years. She will be using the loan to purchase beads and hopes this will help her expand the business. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to educate her children."

loans.use: to purchase beads to help her expand the business

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 45 years old, married with four children.

Juliet works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Juliet has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Juliet aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Lolita works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Lolita is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 46 years old, married with six children.

Lucy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, soft-drinks, beers, sanitary pads, etc. to sell.

Lucy has borrowed and paid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from buying and selling herbal oil.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Lucy aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, soft-drinks, beers, sanitary pads, etc. to sell

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar es un microempresario que ha dedicado 30 de sus 66 años de edad a la actividad de elaboración y comercialización de calzado para damas caballeros y niños, los cuales distribuye a través de almacenes de calzado. Después de laborar como empleado en varias empresas, decidió emprender su propio negocio aprovechando los conocimientos de su pasada vida laboral, así como las fortalezas personales que había logrado desarrollar. Su constancia y  perseverancia fue un factor determinante para mantener una actitud positiva frente a las dificultades normales de todo negocio, que le permitió sacar adelante a sus hijos y hoy en día le animan a continuar en actividad a pesar de su edad. Oscar requiere un capital adicional para actualizar su inventario de plantillas, suelas y demás materiales que requiere para atender la demanda de la temporada de fin de año, proyecto que planea financiar con los recursos de su primer credikiva que está tramitando a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Su visión es mantener su negocio vigente y acorde a las necesidades del mercado.
texts.en:
Oscar is a small businessman who has devoted 30 of his 66 years of age to the business activity of making and selling shoes for women, men, and children. He distributes the shoes through the shoe warehouses. After working as an employee for various businesses, he decided to undertake his own business. He did this by taking advantage of his knowledge from his past work life and the personal strengths that he had managed to develop. His determination and perseverance were a determining factor in order to keep a positive attitude when facing the normal difficulties of all businesses. This allowed him to get his children ahead, and now motivates him to continue with his business activity in spite of his age.

Oscar needs additional capital to update his inventory of insoles, soles, and other materials needed to meet the demand of the end of the year season. He plans to finance the project with the resources from his first Kiva loan, which is processed through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.

His vision is to keep his business current and in accordance with the needs of the market.

loans.use: to buy insoles, soles, and other materials that he needs to meet the end of the year seasonal demand.

loans.name: Rene Ovidio

texts.es:
Rene es casado, vive con su esposa, sus actividades económicas son ofrecer el servicio de sastre (desde hace aproximadamente 5 años) y elaborar flores para vender (desde hace 15 años), junto a su esposa administra el negocio.
Comprará telas, hilos, broches, aplicaciones, agujas, etc., así como también papelería, estos materiales le facilitaran elaborar prendas de vestir y flores, el objetivo es tener un negocio mucho más competente.
Las aspiraciones que Rene tiene son atender mejor a sus clientes y lograr tener estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Rene is married and lives with his wife. His business activities are in offering tailoring services (since about five years ago) and arranging flowers for sale (since 15 years ago). He runs the business together with his wife.

He will buy fabric, thread, pins, appliances, needles, etc. as well as stationery.  These materials will help him to create items of clothing and arrange flowers, with the aim of having a much more competent business.

Rene hopes to provide his customers with better services and to achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, pins, appliances, needles, etc. as well as stationery, to help him create items of clothing and arrange flowers

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
Srey, aged 36, is married and has three dependent sons, two of whom are in school while the remaining one is under the age of school. Residing in Tbaung Khmum province, she and her husband are growing cassava for main source of income. Moreover, Srey sells some grocery items in her community to get additional income.

This will be the third time for her with VisionFund, which she has paid back past loans completely. She has been improving living condition of her family, buying more grocery items to resell and to buy school supplies for her children too. As the leader of two-member group, she will use her loan to support her cassava farming through buying organic fertilizer, organic pesticide and pay for labor fees. For some loan portion left, she will use it to buy more grocery items to replenish the store.

She hopes she can earn more income to buy two-hectare area of farmland, to build a new house and to keep sending her sons to school.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to boost crop yields to fulfill her dreams of buying two-hectare area of farmland, building a new house and keeping sending her sons to school. .

loans.name: Shabnam

texts.en:
Shabnam was born in 1987 year. She is the married parent of 2 children. She lives with her family in the South part of Tajikistan. She tries to offer her children good living conditions.

She is a seamstress. Shabnam sews a variety of women's clothing. They say she has ‘golden hands’. Shabnam has been busy with this business for more than 7 years and she has a great experience in this field.

She is going to buy a new sewing machine and in this way to expand her business. She is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy her new sewing machine. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for expanding her business.

loans.name: Abadahemuka Group

texts.en:
Gaudence is a 45-year-old married mother of six children. She works hard to support her family and provide them with a better life. She is the first person on the left side in the first row.

For the past three years, Gaudence has sold beans, potatoes and sweet potatoes. Every morning Gaudence opens her shop at 7 am and works tirelessly until her daily supply is sold.

Gaudence is requesting her third loan from Vision Finance Company. She has used the previous loans from VFC to increase her inventory.

With this loan, Gaudence hopes to expand by purchasing a large quantities of beans, potatoes and sweet potatoes to sell.

With the profits earned from this loan, Gaudence hopes to pay for the school fees for her children, as well as provide her family with clothes and household items. She also wants to build her own house.

In the long-term, she hopes to expand her business to other areas of the city, as well as provide other products to her clients.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing beans, potatoes and sweet potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 58 years old and from Trinidad, Bohol. She has two adult children. She spends her time looking after her store to earn an income.

She is asking for a loan to buy canned sardines, beef loaf, shampoo, bath soap, milk, coffee, sugar, matches, biscuits, soft drinks, detergent and liquor.

With a full store, she can attract more customers and earn more. Her income will be used to buy a healthy diet, reinvestment in the same business, and savings for future use.

loans.use: to buy canned sardines,  beef loaf, shampoo, bath soap, milk, coffee, sugar,  matches,  biscuits and liquor.

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
Lani is a 47-year-old woman who lives in Concepcion, Iloilo. She is married and has three children, ages 22, 20 and 12 years old. Her husband is a fisherman while Lani is running a sari-sari store business.

She is asking for a bigger loan to buy additional commodities to increase her sales. She will buy drinks, flour, chips, candies, biscuits, spices, toiletries, noodles, canned goods, salt, sugar, powdered chocolate drink and juice. She will also buy a new fishing net for her husband to enhance their catch.

Lani is a woman who dreams of a good life for her family. She wants to have enough money to send her children to school and for them to became professionals.

loans.use: to buy drinks, flour, chips, candies, biscuits, spices, toiletries, noodles, canned goods, salt, sugar, powdered chocolate drink and juice and a new fishing net.

loans.name: Nzoki

texts.en:
Nzoki is a married woman. She has eight children. She describes herself to be ambitious.

She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a busy place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of materials.

She will use the Kes 9,000 loan to buy a solar lighting system for home use.

Her business goal is to be a huge distributor of clothes to supermarkets within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a solar lighting system

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She has a rice retailing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Elsie dreams that one day, She will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Rubik

texts.en:
Rubik is 68 years old and he lives with her nice and large family in Kapan city of Syunik region. Rubik now works at the city’s electrical networks station as an operator. Rubik is married and he a son and two daughters. His son is divorced and with his two children he lives with his parents. Rubik’s elder daughter is married and his smallest daughter is still a student at the Medical University.

Having great expenses in his big family her daughter’s tuition fee is really great hardship for Rubik, but it is very important question to solve quickly as there is deadline for tuition fee repayment. She will become a dentist. This loan of 350.000 Armenian drams Rubik asks as he must pay for her daughter’s tuition fee for the first semester.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s tuition fee for the first semester. She is studying to become a dentist.

loans.name: Karen Margarita

texts.es: Karen es una joven emprendedora de 21 años, separada y madre de una niña de 1 año; ella  proviene de una familia de comerciantes, con los que desde muy niña trabajó distribuyendo los productos y apoyándolos en el cobro de la cartera; desde hace dos años decidió independizarse y con algunos ahorros emprendió su propio negocio de venta de ropa, calzado, artículos para el hogar, cosméticos,  entre otros, los cuales comercializa a través de catálogos que promociona mediante visita a sus clientes que en su mayoría son vecinos, amigos y familiares. Actualmente tramita su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, recursos que proyecta invertir en la compra de Jeans, suéteres, bermudas, blusas, camisas con el fin de incrementar su oferta aprovechando la temporada de fin de año. Su visión es aumentar su número de clientes, fortalecer su negocio y tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Karen is a 21 year-old entrepreneur. She is separated and a mother of a 1 year old. she comes from a family of traders. Since she was very young, she worked on product distribution and helped with the payment collection. Two years ago, she decided to become independent and, with some savings, started her own business selling clothes, shoes, household items, cosmetics among others. She sells them through catalogs by visiting her customers who are mostly neighbors, family and friends.

This is her first loan from Kiva through Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She plans to invest in purchase of jeans, sweaters, shorts, blouses and shirts. This will allow her to expand her products in time to take advantage of the year-end season. Her vision is to increase the number of customers, strengthen her business and own a home.

loans.use: to buy jeans, sweaters, shorts, blouses and shirts.

loans.name: Jose Fernando

texts.es:
José utiliza los créditos para realizar sus labores agrícolas, hace la solicitud de un nuevo crédito para comprar abono, herbicidas e insecticidas, con estos materiales pretende acondicionar el terreno para sembrar granos básicos.
Está satisfecho por buenos resultados que ha tenido de haber invertido el préstamo anterior en su negocio, José cuenta con más clientes, las condiciones económicas han mejorado, el grupo familiar se mantiene y hasta la fecha no ha tenido dificultades para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
José uses these loans for his agricultural work. He is requesting a new loan to purchase fertiliser, herbicides and insecticides, with which he plans to prepare the land for sowing staple grains.

He is satisfied with the good results he has seen from investing the previous loan in his business. José has more clients, his financial conditions have improved, his family group is still together and so far he has had no difficulties with continuing to work.

loans.use: to purchase fertiliser, herbicides and insecticides, with which he plans to prepare the land for sowing staple grains.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesús, vive con su esposa y seis hijos, son una familia emprendedora y luchadora, toda la familia depende de don Jesús, su negocio es dar el servicio de albañil y trabajar en el campo cultivando granos básicos, oficios que aprendió de muy joven con la ayuda de su padre.
El préstamo lo utilizara básicamente para comprar, abono con el que piensa dar un mejor trato al cultivo de maíz, con ello espera tener una cosecha mucho más abundante para el consumo familiar y para comercializar, busca tener nuevos ingresos.
El propósito de Jesús es darles a sus hijos un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Jesús lives with his wife and six children. They are a hard-working and brave family who all depend on Jesús. He works providing bricklaying services and working in the fields growing staple grains, and he learned these jobs from a young age when helping his father.

He will basically use the loan to buy fertiliser, with which he intends to improve the growth of his corn. He hopes this will give him a much larger harvest to feed his family with and to sell and is looking for new sources of income.

Jesús is aiming to provide his children with a better future.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser, with which he intends to improve the growth of his corn

loans.name: Sreynoch

texts.en:
Sreynoch, a young mother blessed with one kid living in Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province, is 21 years old. Her main income which she can earn to support on her family living is from rice cropping. Beside this, she can get extra income via grocery items selling, fishes and chickens-raising. She has involved her business for 3 years and she can save from her income about 5 USD per day. Her rice did not grow well while her chickens also got ill.

For Sreynoch, this is her first loan with VisionFund. She will manage her loan portion to purchase more grocery items for resale and she will use another part of her loan to buy fishes and chickens to support her raising business. She hopes that she can earn more income from her family’s business to upgrade her living condition and keeps her child to school on time.

loans.use: to buy the grocery items to support on her selling business and to buy more chickens and fishes for her business in order to get more income.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Anar

texts.ru: Анар, 61 год, вдова. Она на пенсии, в качестве дохода для своей семьи она занимается пряжей шерстяных ниток. Приобретает овечью шерсть у односельчан и на самодельном электрическом станке пряжет шерстяные нити на продажу. Сейчас есть 500 кг. шерсти. Продукция пользуется большим спросом, нити покупают для вязания теплых шерстяных носок. Ежемесячный совокупный доход Анар около 15,000 сом (KGS). Анар старается вкладывать свободные средства в свой бизнес, но в доме совсем прохудился пол. Поэтому она и обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку досок для замены пола в доме. Свои доходы Анар планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса и улучшение жилищных условий.
texts.en: Anar is a 61-year-old widow. She is retired and makes wool yarn. She acquires sheep's wool from villagers and uses an electric machine to make woolen yarn to sell. She currently has 500 kilograms of wool. Her products are in high demand by those who want to knit warm woolen socks. Anar's monthly income is around 15,000 som (KGS) per month. Anar tries to invest surplus funds in her business, but the floor in her house is completely worn out. This is why she applied for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to replace the floor boards in her house. Anar plans to use her income to continue investing in her business and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy boards and replace the floor in her house

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is 47 years old, from Kutaisi city. She lives with her pensioner father and husband, and son who is temporarily unemployed. Irina is the only employed person in the family. Specifically, she works as a sales lady at the local store and gets approximately 250 GEL. The family finds it hard to tackle with the financial difficulties and make the living wage.

Because of the above mentioned situation, Irina decided somehow to increase the income of her family and start a parallel business activity. After several unsuccessful attempts, Irina applied for credit from MFO Credo. Her request was approved in the framework of the Start-Up program, which is joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses.

Irina plans to purchase a stock of clothing and start a trading business in her community. She will sell the products in her free time and will get the additional income that will help her to to meet all family-expenses more effectively.

She is a very enthusiastic and hard working person with a great desire to ensure her family members a good style of life. This credit will be a great support for the family.

Irina is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving her a chance to generate additional income.

loans.use: to start a trading business with clothing.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a 41-year-old married mother of eight, who has been working selling used shoes to help her husband in covering their big family's living expenses since 2000. 
She is a hard worker, well known in her region for the special prices she sets, to sell her merchandise quickly and meet customers' needs.

Khadija's income combined with her husband's isn't enough to cover their family's needs and develop her business at the same time. 
Although  her business development was a result of previously acquired Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua loans, where today she is benefiting from her 14th loan cycle, which she invests in buying big quantities of used shoes and clothes, especially when parents are preparing their children for school needs. 

Khadija's currently requested loan will be invested in covering her children increasing school tuition fees.
She will make  hard to make sure that her work will keep on developing and meeting customers' expectations.

loans.use: To pay for her children increasing requested school tuition fees

loans.name: Maecel

texts.en:
Maecel earns a living through her farming and hog raising business. She is from Trinidad, Bohol. Maecel has been in these business for several years now.

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and feed. For Maecel, her business needs to be maximized since it takes months before she can see her profit.

Her loan will serve as an additional capital so she can take care of her farm and pigs, thus anticipating a good return on her investment in four months time.

Her income will be for the school fees of her three children, ages 5, 7 and 8.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and feed

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma sign up for membership with Paglaum MPC and access financial service to capitalized her hog raising business. She successfully pay her loans and rolled her proceeds and buy new piglets to raise. She finds this business very promising and she works hard for it. She asks for a loan from the cooperative to purchase bags of animal feeds and vitamins.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feeds and vitamins

loans.name: Roxanne

texts.en:
Roxanne wants to extend her sincerest appreciation to Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for the approval of her previous loan. She also wants to thank all of the lenders who are continually participating in the Kiva program, since the amount they provided really became a medium for the business to have an increase in sales. 

Roxanne is earning more now and still aiming to have a bigger store someday. She applied for another loan of Php 10,000 as which she will use to pay for additional stocks of grocery items, sacks of rice, bottled drinks, condiments and snack needed to expand her store. She believes that this will be the start to have her prayers answered. She’s looking forward for the approval of the loan as she dreams to save money for her children’s educational expenses.

Roxanne believes that if you want success to come in, you need God to be your greatest foundation. She is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony , share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and  hear God’s word that  was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for her variety store business.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida has been in the tailoring business for five years now.  Each month, she’s earning an approximate amount of Php 18,000 considering the market demand. Not all of the profits earned on the business are being used to buy tailoring materials. However, most were spent for the medicine of her husband. That’s why she exerts extra effort to earn more each day, since their tailoring business is just their source of income. 

The previous loan was used to purchase necessary materials for her tailoring business. The amount made a great impact since then, she’s able to make any designs of clothing as she has the capability to buy materials that are essential.  Compared before that she only has limited amount, means the output will also be limited. She considered Center for Community Transformation (CCT) as God’s medium of blessing.

On the past six months, Nida considered the business growing (this means the increase of demand is present). With this, she decided to apply for another loan this year of Php 20,000 so that she’ll have stocks of different fabrics and other sewing materials necessary for the business. She’s hoping that CCT will grant her request of another loan so that she’ll not anymore worry where to get enough amount to buy medicine for her husband and to sustain for other expenses.

Nida is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony, share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and  hear God’s word that  was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for tailoring like threads, silks, fabrics and other related materials

loans.name: Nyabwwana

texts.en:
Nyabwwana is a married mother of four children, one of whom attends school. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two and half years, she has operated an open air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Nazan

texts.en:
Nazan is married and has one child. For long years she has been selling cosmetics and cleaning products through a network system as well as giving training to women about the system and encouraging them to work on this system. She used loan for three times and bought products in bulk, sold them and gained money and expanded her business. She aims to promote in this network system and also enable other women to promote it.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Nazan hanım evli bir çocuk annesi. Uzun yıllardır netwörk sistemi ile uğraşmakta netwörk sisteminde kozmetik ve temizlik ürünleri pazarlamakta, ayrıca eğitimler vererek kendisi gibi kadınlarında bu sistemde çalışmalarına öncülük etmekte. Üç kez mikro kredi kullandı aldığı mikro kredi ile ürün aldı sattı para kazandı ve işlerini geliştirdi. Hedefi netwöek sisteminde kendisi yükselirken diğer kadınlarında yükselmesini sağlamak .

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products for re-sale.

loans.name: Vesna

texts.en:
Vesna is a mother of two sons and is involved in agricultural work based on her family tradition. While her husband works for an electrical company, he has a low salary and Vesna is very happy that she is able to contribute to the family budget. She really enjoys her work and loves working on her land.

At this time, Vesna is requesting a loan to be able to purchase seeds for planting wheat and artificial guano, as well as to pay someone to work on her land.

In the future, she hopes that she will own a machine to be able to work on her land herself instead of paying someone. She promises to pay on time and appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for planting wheat and artificial guano, as well as to pay someone to work on her land.

loans.name: Sladjan

texts.en:
Sladjan is divorced and lives only with his elderly mother in one of the minority communities of Kosovo.

He works for an electrical company, and based on family tradition, is also involved in agricultural work. He has land where he plants wheat to use and to sell, and he also keeps pigs. The agricultural work gives him a lot of pleasure and reduces his depression and boredom.

For the first time he is requesting a loan in order to purchase seed for planting wheat and artificial guano. He is very grateful to all of the Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase seed for planting wheat and artificial guano

loans.name: Tatli

texts.en:
Tatli is very grateful to the lenders for the previous loan to purchase new working tools for her tractor. She is still earning a living from the agricultural business and has been satisfied with the income. She is very happy and enjoys her work.

Now, for the second time, she is requesting a loan for the same business. She would like to be able to purchase seed and artificial guano for planting wheat.

She is very happy with the support from Kiva Lenders and wants to thank them again for the continued support of her agricultural work.

loans.use: to purchase seed and artificial guano for planting wheat.

loans.name: Florim

texts.en:
Florim is a single 28-year-old male who is living on his own. He works as an English teacher and is very ambitious. For the last year he has been able to run his own private English courses. The place that he hold his courses is need of renovation for him to be able to expand and gain more space for his growing number of students.

He is requesting a loan to be able to pay for the expansion and increase the space he has.

Florim hopes that in the near future he will be able to continue to expand his business and add even additional foreign languages.

He is very satisfied with the first year of business and hopes it will continue in the future. He is very grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to renovate his business place.

loans.name: Hothia's Group

texts.fr:
Créé le 22 Mai 2009, ce groupe est composé de femmes très actives. Il existe une bonne entente entre elles. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Hothia (debout à l’extrême droite avec la main levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 30ans et mère de 02 enfants. Elle s’active dans la vente d’huile de palme, de savon et d’autres condiments qu’elle achète dans les marchés hebdomadaires pour le revendre dans son village. 

Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 01 bouteille de 20 litre d’huile de palme à 1000f le litre et d’autres condiments d’un montant de 25000f et du savon à  5000f pour le revendre en détails.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle compte participer à la dépense quotidienne et aux soins médicaux de sa famille.
texts.en:
Started on May 22, 2009, this group is made up of very active women. They have a good relationship amongst themselves. They are all primarily small businesswomen.

Hothia (standing at the far right with her hand raised) is the star borrower of the group. She is a 30-year-old, married woman who has two children. She sells palm oil, soap, and other condiments that she buys at the weekly markets and then resells in her village.

With this new loan, she intends to buy one 20-liter bottle of palm oil (at 1,000 francs a liter) and other condiments (for a total of 25,000 francs) and soap (for a total of 5,000 francs) to resell at retail.

With her profits, she would like to help with the family's daily and medical care expenses.

loans.use: to buy one 20-liter bottle of palm oil at 1,000 francs per liter and 25,000 francs worth of other condiments and 5,000 francs worth of soap to sell at retail.

loans.name: Urima

texts.en: Urima is a 53 years old married woman with 4 children. She makes and sells pancakes and chips in her community to earn a living. She has 3 years of experience with this business. Urima needs a loan to buy a bag of flour, bag of sugar, vegetable oil, oven and a baking soda. She plans to use her profits to expand her business and to save for unexpected emergencies. Urima has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy a bag of flour, bag of sugar, vegetable oil, oven and a baking soda

loans.name: Kivule Loveness Group

texts.en:
Eliezel is in his mid-30s and is married with one child who is still in school. He has been running a restaurant business for four years now. He works from 6 am to 4 pm daily and is able make good monthly profit.

This will be Eliezel's 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase the restaurant stock and has paid back all his loans successfully. He used the profit to pay school fees, bought a plot of land, bought a motorcycle, repaid the loans, and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to buy more of the best-selling items in his restaurant to meet his customers' requirements. He dreams of being an international businessman.

Eliezel will share this loan with his loan group Kivule Loveness which consists of five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more of the best-selling items in his restaurant to meet his customers' requirements.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is deeply grateful to Kiva and its lenders for their kind heart of lending her funds several times in the past which really helped sustain and grow her store. It has  encouraged her to be more diligent in growing her business and is forever thankful for your help. 

Once again she trusts that you could lend her funds in the amount of Php 40000 to refill her store with more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles which she sells at retail. Her store means a lot to her since it has been her source of income for the past five years and has covered her family's basic needs and in sending her children to school. She is hopeful for your positive response.

Just like any loving mother her precious dream is to see her children happy and successful. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies . 

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Simforiana

texts.en:
Simforiana lives in the town of San Miguel, Bohol with her family. She is 48 years old, married and has six children who are aged between 8 and 26 years.

Simforiana and her husband are both farmers. They own land that they cultivate to grow rice for consumption and selling. She also raises cattle for additional income.

Simforiana works hard to take care of her children and help her husband manage their rice farm and livestock. She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer and pesticides. These are important to prevent rice tungro, a rice disease which is caused by two viruses and transmitted by leafhoppers.

Simforiana dreams of seeing her children graduate from school and having a good life with their professions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
She is Jocelyn, 31 years old, from the province of Dasmarinas, Cavite Philippines. Happily married to Pepito, a contractual employee and they have three children. It is a challenge and a struggle living in a Third World country but the couple strives hard to make a living to fund their children's schooling since they know that a good education is their path and hope to improve their children's lives.

Since her husband's job is contractual basis, Jocelyn thought of putting up a small general store five years ago to make sure they have other source of income to provide for their everyday needs. She trusts out of your good heart you could lend her funds in the amount of Php 17000 to expand her small store with essential food items such as bread, biscuits, canned good, instant noodles, eggs, oil and toiletries. She is thanking God and you in advance for your valued help. 

Jocelyn's precious dream is to see all her children earn a College Degree to allow them opportunities for a better life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Jose Eric

texts.es:
José, vive actualmente con su esposa e hijos, desde hace cuatro años tiene como actividad económica la crianza y venta de pollos, en su comunidad es reconocido por dar un buen servicio y por luchar para salir adelante.
Con la ayuda del capital podrá invertir en concentrado para la alimentación de los pollos, pretende aumentar la producción de pollos sanos y gordos, además podrá cubrir las demandas de sus clientes y generar mayores ingresos.
Los sueños que él tiene son cubrir todas las necesidades de su hogar y fortalece su negocio para mantenerlo con vida.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and children. For four years, he has been raising and selling chickens. He is recognized for his good service and effort to get ahead.

The loan will enable José invest in concentrated feed for chickens. It increases the production of healthy and heavy chickens. Furthermore, he will be able to meet the customer demands and generate higher income.

José’s dreams are to cover all the household needs and strengthen his business to keep it going.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed for chickens in order to increase the production of healthy and heavy chickens.

loans.name: Siliulumoega

texts.en: Siliulumoega is 44 years old and married with 4 children. She runs a small business selling vegetables in her community and has been doing this for 4 years. Siliulumoega has requested a loan to buy seeds, spade, bush knives, rakes, a bag of fertilizer, wheelbarrow and a weed sprayer . She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Siliulumoega will save more for her children's education and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy seeds, spade, bush knives, rakes, a bag of fertilizer, wheelbarrow and a weedsprayer

loans.name: Tunajiamini Group

texts.en:
Amina who is in her mid 30's is single with two kids, who are still in school. She has been running two projects, selling clothes and a fish seller for eighteen years now. She works from 08am to 10pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Amina's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase on clothes stock and buying the last fashion, increased on the fish stock and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. She used the profit to pay school fees for her two kids, bought a plot of land, loan repayments and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to increase on the fish stock, to buy cooking oil, charcoal for cooking and to buy the latest style fashions in her clothes shop to meet her customers' requirement. She dreams of building her own house and to educate her children.

Amina will share this loan with her loan group Tunajiamini which consists of ten members who will hold each accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase on the fish stock, to buy cooking oil, charcoal for cooking and to buy the latest style fashion in her clothes shop to meet her customers' requirement.

loans.name: Talaesea

texts.en:
Talaesea is a 66-year-old, married woman with five children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy bags of flour, a bag of sugar, vegetable oil, an oven and a pot.

In the future, Talaesea hopes to expand her business and to support her family financially. She joined SPBD in September this year 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, a bag of sugar, vegetable oil, an oven and a pot.

loans.name: Cenia Ester

texts.es: Cenia es una emprendedora de 43 años que reside en un sector con cercanía al mar en el municipio de Barranquilla, ella es madre de dos niños de 12 y 10 años de edad y una adolecente de 16 años, en la actualidad está dedicada a las ventas de refrescos; jugos naturales, gaseosa y agua, idea de negocio que desarrolló hace 10 años ante la necesidad de contribuir con la economía de su hogar, pero al mismo tiempo desempeñar los papeles de esposa, madre y ama de casa. Ella trabaja en el horario de 8:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m. y su proyecto consiste en adecuar un local comercial donde brindar un mejor servicio a su clientela conformada por vecinos y conductores de los medios de transporte masivos, para lo cual está solicitando su primer credikiva a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, recursos que invertirá en la compra de los materiales de construcción como cemento, varillas, arena, láminas de eternit que requiere para este proyecto, con el que espera diversificar su oferta y obtener mayores utilidades.
texts.en:
Cenia is a 43 year old entrepreneur who lives in an area near the sea in the city of Barranquilla. She is the mother of two children who are 12 and 10 years of age and a 16 year old teenager.

Currently she works selling beverages: fruit juices, sodas, and water. This business idea was developed ten years ago with the need to contribute to the household expenses, while at the same time carrying out the role of wife, mother, and homemaker. She works from 8:00am until 5:00pm and her project is in a suitable commercial location where she provides a better service to her customers made up of neighbors and mass transit drivers.

She is asking for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will invest in the purchase of construction materials such as cement, rods, sand, and Eternit sheeting which she needs for this project with which she hopes to diversity her sale products and obtain higher profits.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement, rods, sand, and Eternit sheeting.

loans.name: Fernando Antonio

texts.es: Fernando es un trabajador independiente de 29 años que por su situación económica y ante la falta de oportunidades de empleo decidió apostarle al emprendimiento aprovechando los conocimientos adquiridos en su experiencia laboral anterior y la necesidad de este tipo de negocio en el sector, un café internet. Él trabaja en el horario de 6:00 a.m. a 8:00 p.m. ofreciendo  los servicios de internet, fotocopias, transcripciones y llamadas telefónicas a los habitantes del sector donde reside. Actualmente tramita su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, financiamiento que proyecta invertir en la compra de un nuevo computador con el fin de ampliar la cobertura de su servicio. Fernando visualiza su negocio en un local acondicionado, con muchos computadores y con una oferta de diversificada de servicios.
texts.en:
Fernando is a 29 year old freelancer. The economic situation and the lack of job opportunities led him to venture into an internet café, leveraging the knowledge gained in his previous work experience and the need for this type of business in the sector. He works from 6:00 am to 8:00 pm offering internet services, photocopies, transcripts and phone calls to the residents of the area where he lives.

This is his first loan with Kiva through Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. This will help Fernando invest in the purchase of a new computer in order to expand his service. Fernando envisions his business with many computers and diverse services.

loans.use: to buy a new computer in order to expand his service.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 34 years old and married with two children. With two children in school, Elisa works very hard to provide for them.

Elisa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Elisa has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Elisa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Tauaituli

texts.en:
Tauaituli is a 62-year-old woman, who is married with two children. She runs a business sewing and selling clothes in her community. She has three years of experience with this business.

Tauaituli has requested a loan to buy material, threads, a sewing machine, scissors, etc. She plans to use her profits to expand her business and to support her family financially. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy material, threads, a sewing machine, scissors, etc.

loans.name: Tagi

texts.en:
Tagi is a 24-year-old woman, who is single with two children. She runs a business sewing and selling clothes in her community. She has two years of experience with this business.

Tagi has requested a loan to buy a sewing machine, materials, scissors, threads, etc. She plans to use her profits to support her family financially and to save for unexpected emergencies. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, materials, scissors, threads, etc.

loans.name: Meletino

texts.en:
Meletino is 25 years old and married with 2 children. She has a small plantation where she grows cabbages, cucumbers, and tomatoes. She sells her produce in her community to earn a living.

She needs a loan to buy vegetable seeds, a bag of fertilizer, a spade, bush knives, a wheelbarrow and a rake.

In the future, Meletino hopes to expand her business and to save more for her children's education.

She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, a bag of fertilizer, a spade, bush knives, a wheelbarrow and a rake.

loans.name: Hawa's Group

texts.fr:
Inauguré le 29 décembre 2014 ce banc villageois est composé de femmes du groupement du village qui ont adhéré dans le programme afin de rendre les activités dans le petit commerce plus rentables, elles s’activent également dans l’agriculture sous pluie. Une bonne ambiance anime les rencontres du groupe. 

Madame Hawa, âgée de 45 ans (assise à l’extrême droite et levant la main droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle s’active dans la vente de produits alimentaires (mangue arachide et fait la transformation de produits alimentaires "made")

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter ses différents produits alimentaires d’un montant de 65000f payer un transport de 4500f pour le revendre en détails dans son village.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Created on December 29, 2014, this 'banc villageois' is made up of a group of women from the village who have adhered to the program in order to make their small businesses more successful. They are also farmers during the rainy season. They have a good, animated relationship during their group meetings.

Forty-five-year-old Hawa (sitting at the far right with her right hand raised) is the star borrower of the group. She is married and the mother of five children. She sells food (mangos, peanuts and cooks them into handmade groceries.)

With this new loan, she intends to purchase various groceries for a total of 65,000 francs and to pay 4,500 francs for transportation to resell the food at retail in her village.

With the profits, she hopes to improve her family's living conditions and strengthen her business.

loans.use: to buy various groceries for a total of 65,000 francs and pay 4,500 francs for transportation to resell the food at retail in her village.

loans.name: Lotu

texts.en:
Lotu is 55 years old and married with six children. She owns and operates a business venture, sewing and selling clothes in her community. She has four years of experience in this line of business.

Lotu needs a loan to buy an electric sewing machine, materials, threads, scissors, etc. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business and to save for unexpected emergencies. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy an electric sewing machine, materials, threads, scissors, etc.

loans.name: Itagia

texts.en: Itagia is a 24 years old married woman with 1 child. She makes and sells pop corn and ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has 2 years of experience with this business.Itagia needs a loan to buy oil,corn seeds,plastic bags,fry pan etc. She plans to use her profits to expand her business and to save for her children's education. Itagia has been a member of SPBD since September this year 2015.

loans.use: to buy oil, corn seeds, plastic bags, fry pan etc.

loans.name: Kartiack Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le deux juin 2010. Ce groupe est constitué de vingt membres qui s'activent dans le commerce et elles remboursement toujours leurs prêts avec succès. Madame Maimouna qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de quarante huit ans et mère de cinq enfants dont trois garçons. Elle s'active dans la vente de poissons et de légumes depuis plus de dix années. Elle va acheter des poissons et des légumes en grande quantité avec le prêt sollicité. Les bénéfices vont servir à aider à la prise en charge de la famille et à épargner.
texts.en:
This 'banc villageois' was created on June 2, 2010. The group is made up of 20 members who are businesswomen and always successfully pay back their loans.

Maimouna, who is on the right side of the photo with her hand raised, is the group's representative. She is a married, 48-year-old woman. She has five children, three of whom are boys. She has been selling fish and vegetables for over 10 years.

With this loan, she will buy large quantities of fish and vegetables. The profits will help her with her family's expenses and with savings.

loans.use: to buy fish and vegetables.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia proved once more her diligence, as she has faithfully repaid the loan she took with CCT six months ago. The loan was used to pay the maintenance cost of her jeepney unit. It also helped improve their daily profit from the business.

Leticia is requesting another 45,000 PHP loan assistance. She will be using the loan for the beautification and maintenance of her room for rent. She aims to fully utilize her resources, and the resulting increase in profits will definitely help her to sustain the family's daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Leticia dreams of expanding more her businesses and hopes that her children will become professionals in the future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners gathering each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay the maintenance cost for her rental room.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married mother of thee children, two of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that neither  has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past one years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 25,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Apolinario

texts.es:
Apolinario, está solicitando un nuevo crédito porque son una herramienta para mantener su negocio y por el buen servicio que recibe en la institución, podrá comprar insumos agrícolas para limpiar el terreno de la maleza y cuidar su cultivo de maíz, espera tener una cosecha abundante.
Expresa que el resultado de la inversión anterior ha sido satisfactorio, pues mantiene su negocio, y sus ingresos familiares son estables.
texts.en:
Apolinario is requesting a new loan because it is a tool to maintain his business and he has received good service from the institution.  

He will be able to buy agricultural supplies to clear the land of weeds and to care for his corn crop.  He hopes to have an abundant harvest.   He reports that the results of his last investment were satisfactory, as his business and his family income are stable.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to clear the land of weeds and care for his corn crop.

loans.name: Nazbubu

texts.ru: Назбубу, 28 лет, замужем, 3 сыновей. У нее высшее образование, занимается сельским хозяйством. У Назбубу есть 6 коров, через день она продает экологически-чистое молоко. Есть кошара для содержания скота, грузовик для его перевозки. Ежемесячная прибыль - около 14,000 сом (KGS). Назбубу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы и корма на зиму для скота. Свои доходы она и дальше планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Nazbubu is 28 and married with three sons. She has a higher education and works in agriculture. She has six cows and sells organic milk every other day. She has a space to keep her cattle and a truck to transport them. Her monthly income is about 14,000 KGS per month.

Nazbubu has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase a cow and livestock feed for the winter. She plans to put her profits toward further developing her business.

loans.use: to buy a cow and livestock feed in order to invest in her business

loans.name: Buvaisha

texts.ru: Бувайша, 53 года, замужем. Бувайша в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду, на сегодняшний день у нее есть 4 коровы, 30 коз. Ежемесячный доход составляет от 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бувайша обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса и приобретение мебели для дома.
texts.en: Buvaisha is 53 and married and works in animal husbandry as the primary source of income for her family, something she started 20 years ago. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has four cows and 30 goats with a monthly income of at least 10,000 KGS. With the goal of further developing her business, Buvaisha has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase livestock to increase her head count. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business and toward buying furniture for her home.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Lindita

texts.en:
This is Lindita, a 43-year-old married mother of two living in the city of Elbasan. She has been photographed stitching clothes.

For the past five years, she's been running her own tailoring shop. Until now, she has not used a cash register in the shop and the reason for this loan is to buy one.

Kindly note that until recently very small businesses like hers never needed a cash register because they claimed taxes based on the type of activity and the size of it. The government recently changed the tax rules which was not welcomed by small businesses which made less than $200/month, an income that stands below the living standards in the country.

While Lindita does her own thing, her husband does agriculture. They have 200 olive trees from which they harvest roughly 10,000 kg of olives a year at a price of $.8/kg.

loans.use: to buy a cash register for the tailoring shop she's been operating out of her father's premises these past five years.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 24-year-old, newly wed guy and soon-to-be a father, who wants this loan to make some basic repairs to the family home where he lives with his parents. " We needed to do some basic, yet important repairs, to our house before our child is here. The way that the house is now, is very cold inside and not easy to raise a kid," said Robert to the branch assistant who took his interview for Kiva.

To earn an income they operate, (mostly mom) a little store where they sell thrifty clothes and other thrifty items. Also, Robert and his father work for a total pay of $350 per month. They also own very small land where they plant just for their needs, and in addition to this, again for their needs, they've a goat and very few chickens.

loans.use: to make some very basic, yet important repairs, before his first child is born, very soon.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane says, "I am very eager to get a biogas system. My monthly spending on conventional fuel takes a significant portion of my income. Now, with this biogas loan from Takamoto Biogas, I can channel the money spent on fuel to acquiring even more cows."

She currently has seven cows, but looks forward to the day she will have a larger dairy farm to support her family and grow her business.

Please help Jane to get a biodigester.

loans.use: to buy a biodigester to have clean, reliable fuel for cooking.

loans.name: Pellum

texts.en:
This is Pellum, a 29-year-old, university educated man who enjoys doing agriculture/livestock work. "I love nature and I love animals and of course, I love living in the village," said Pellum, petting his animals during his interview.

He needs this loan to buy some flocks and also pay a lump sum for some rental agricultural land.

Pellum is not married, but soon he will be, according to him. Currently, he lives with his elderly parents and his married brother and his family, as the majority of people do in Albania; some continue this because it is a tradition, some do it because of financial reasons, or some simply because they enjoy the living together because grandparents help with the children. Most of the time, this living arrangement works well for both parties.

Pellum mainly plants feed for the animals and seasonal veggies for the family, and has some grapevines and orchards. He's got cows and a saw, and he sells male calves, raw milk and piglets.

loans.use: to buy flocks (sheep) and pay for some rental agricultural land.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
She is married with six children. She lives in a three bedroom house in Bamenda North West Region, Cameroon.
