She has faced many challenges in life, which are the death of her father and mother, and sickness in addition to her children dropping out of school. These have made life so difficult for her.

She was motivated to become a member of GHAPE by her friends and relatives who have been GHAPE members since 2003. She has successfully borrowed and repaid three loans.

With this new loan she is going to buy firewood, pay for splitting, buy more foodstuffs to sell, and rebuild her shed. She knows her business is going to succeed because she has been doing it for a long time, she has many customers and she sells at moderate prices. With this business activity, the community will benefit from moderate prices, and they will not need to go long distances to buy from the market.

The profit from this loan will help her to pay for her children's school fees, provide some basic food for the family and pay for her family’s medications. She will also use some of the profit to buy a plot to build a house for her family. She prefers GHAPE loans because of the low interest rate and convenient terms of repayment.

loans.use: to buy firewood, pay for splitting, buy foodstuffs and rebuild her shed.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es: Teofilo de44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el se dedica a la venta de llantas posee 30 años de experiencia en el negocio el cual esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por su buen trabajo, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar,  el cliente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de llantas rines, etc. todo por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo e ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Teofilo is 44 years old. He lives in his own house with his life partner. He works selling tires and has 30 years of experience in the business, which is located at his residence. He has many customers for his good work. With the earnings he gets, he is able to settle some household expenses.

The client is requesting a loan to buy tires, rims, etc., all wholesale now that that is his only source of work and income.

loans.use: to buy tires, rims, etc., wholesale.

loans.name: Hermelita

texts.en: Hermelita is a 51-year-old woman. She is married and has five adult children and one school aged child. She earns a living through raising pigs, while her husband is a farmer. They work hard together to enhance their livelihood and to be able to provide the needs of their family. Hermelita has been raising pigs for 20 years. Within that year, the business challenge that she always facing is how to sustain feed for her pigs. And that is the reason why she is asking for loan. She needs a fund that will help her buy feed for her pigs to have a healthy growth and became profitable. In the future, she wants to improve her business just like reconstructing the shed of her pigs.

loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Reina De Corazones Group

texts.es:
ROMINA es una mujer de 27 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 3 y 10 años, y su negocio es la venta de cosméticos por catálogo. 
Ella es buena madre, delicada y muy original. Su negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante en el barrio ‘plan 3000’, área marginada de la ciudad, formando un lugar de manufactura y producción en todas las áreas. 
Romina es morena de cabello castaño y abaja estatura, su lengua materna es el guarani y habla español (la primera de la derecha, viste polo rosa). Su vida la comparte con sus hijos, uno ya asiste a la escuela y el otro aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. La necesidad de superación la llevó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de comida, venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de cuñapes, venta de refrescos, peluquería, confeccion de ropa, venta de huevo y servicio de té. Su negocio es la venta ambulante de cosméticos por catálogo de buenas marcas como; Avon, Mary Kay, Jafra y otros…, actividad que realiza ambulando durante toda la semana en diferentes ferias y comercios de la ciudad, “vendo; aretes, lápiz labial, cremas anti edad, tratamientos faciales, perfumes, mascara para pestañas, y otros...” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes fijos, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para comprar cosméticos por mayor. Su sueño es estabilizar su negocio como distribuidora de cosméticos, ella desea comprar un stock de cosméticos de temporada por mayor, para ofertar a sus clientes por fin de año. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que desarrolla esta actividad. Es por esos motivos que Romina solicita un préstamo para comprar un stock de cosméticos de temporada por mayor y ofertar a fin de año.
texts.en:
Romina is a 27-year-old woman who is single, has two children, ages 3 and 10, and her business is selling cosmetics through catalogs. She is a good mother, gentile and very original. She carries out her business as a traveling vendor in the neighborhood "Plan 3000." This is a marginalized part of the city which is becoming a place for manufacturing and production.

Romina is short, dark-skinned, and has brown hair. Her native tongue is guarani and she speaks Spanish. (She is the first person on the right, wearing the pink jacket). She lives with her children, one who is now in school and the other who is not yet of school-age. They live in a rented room built of brick and have basic amenities. The need to overcome is what led her to become part of the communal bank with others who have businesses such as: selling food, selling second-hand clothing, selling cuñapes (yucca and cheese bread), selling soft drinks, a hair salon, clothes making, selling eggs and a tea service.

Her business is the sale of cosmetics through catalogs which she carries out as a traveling vendor. She sells good brands such as Avon, Mary Kay, Jafra and others. She carries out her business traveling all week to different markets and stores in the city. "I sell earrings, lipstick, anti-aging creams, facial treatments, perfumes, mascara, and others," she remarks. The advantage of her business is that she has regular customers but, the disadvantage is that she does not have the money to buy cosmetics in bulk. Her dreams is to stabilize her business as a cosmetics distributor. Her hope is to buy a supply of the season's cosmetics in bulk to offer to her clients at the end of the year.

This is the first loan cycle she has received from the institution in the two years that she has had this business. It is for these reasons that Romina is asking for a loan to buy a supply of the season's cosmetics in bulk to offer to her clients at the end of the year.

loans.use: to buy a supply of the season's cosmetics products in bulk to offer at the end of the year.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chips, candies, biscuits, seasoning, condiments, canned food, bath soap,  detergent and feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a widow with 5 children. She describes herself to be humble. She operates a retail business where she sells plates, cups,flasks, spoons and other utensils. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of cups, plates, spoons and other utensils. Her business goal is to have at least 2 branches within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable business and educate her children. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and save for future use.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cups, plates, spoons and other utensils.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a 39-year-old, married woman from Alcantara, Cebu. She has three children, ages 5, 16 and 17. Lorna runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells items such as sugar, coffee, condiments, noodles, toiletries and canned goods. Her husband sells dried fish and she hopes to help him by making business expansions.

She has requested a loan to buy sachet items of milo, milk, sugar, toothpaste, hair conditioner, canned food and biscuits. In the future, Lorna would like to expand her business to support her family, and to save so she can pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy sachet items of milo, milk, sugar, toothpaste, hair conditioner, canned food and biscuits.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is 29 years old. She is married with two children, ages 1 and 2. For two years now she has run a sari-sari store business and sells different items to the people in her locality.

She is asking for a loan to buy additional items to sell in her store such as snack food, coffee and beverages, toiletries, detergent and canned food. In the future, Meriam dreams of making her business a success and to save money so she can venture into other business opportunities.

loans.use: to buy such items as snack food, coffee and beverages, toiletries, detergent and canned food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy biscuits, chocolate bars, candies, vinegar, chips, shampoo and bath soap.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 49 years old and she has a 17-year-old son. She and her family live in Alcantara, Cebu. 

Norma is engaged in selling purified water and furniture. Purified water is a common way for people to buy affordable clean water to drink. 

She is asking a loan to buy more five-gallon containers that she can sell in her neighborhood. She will also use it to buy materials for her furniture business, like hard wood and sand paper.

It is her dream to be a successful businesswoman in her community.

loans.use: to buy more five-gallon containers for water and hard wood and sand paper for furniture.

loans.name: Bondo

texts.en:
Bondo, who is 35 years old motivated man, from Kutaisi city, lives with his parents and wife. Bondo has his own private activity of computer repair technician and gets some income. His wife and mother are doctors and father works at the water supply company.

Bondo has a great desire to increase his role to the family's well-being and make another source of income. He needs financial support to purchase a refrigerator for selling soft drinks, also to trade sweets and fast food products. Bondo has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

The loan will greatly assist Bondo and he will be able to improve his economic situation and give his family a better style of life. He awaits your support and kindness.

loans.use: to start trading with sweets, soft drinks and fast food products.

loans.name: Karamatkan

texts.ru: Караматкан, 44 года, замужем, мать 2 детей. У нее высшее образование,за протяжении многих лет занимается сельским хозяйством, стартовав с 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду, Караматкан на сегодняшний день имеет 2 коровы и 10 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Караматкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для разведения. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Karamatkan is 44 and married with two children. She has a higher education and has been working in agriculture for many years, a business she started with 10,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has two cows and 10 sheep.

With the goal of further developing her business, Karamatkan has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase livestock for breeding. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Turgunai

texts.ru: Тургунай, 26 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Тургунай- среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, Тургунай занимается животноводством, стартовав 8 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Тургунай, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 5 коров, 20 овец, лошадь. Ежемесячный доход составляет 30,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Тургунай обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Тургунай планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Turgunai is 26 and married and raising two children. She has a high school education and works in animal husbandry as the primary source of income for her family, which she started eight years ago. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has five cows, 20 sheep and a horse on her farm, with a monthly income of 30,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her business, Turgunai has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 KGS to purchase livestock to increase her head count. She plans to put profits from the loan into further increasing her quantity of livestock.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Uulbu

texts.ru: Уулбу, 58 лет, вдова, мать 3 детей. Уулбу в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается сельским хозяйством. Стартовав в 1980 году, на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Уулбу есть 2 коровы, 20 овец. На участке мерою 3,0 Га Уулбу выращивает хлопок для реализации. Ежемесячная прибыль- около 7,000 сомов (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь и содержание семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита позволят улучшить благосостояние семьи Уулбу, разивать ее бизнес и накопить на реконструкцию дома.
texts.en:
Uulbu is 58 and a widow with three children. She works in agriculture as the primary source of income for her family. She started the farm in 1980 and currently has two cows and 20 sheep as well as 3 hectares of land where she grows cotton for sale. Her monthly income is about 7,000 KGS, which isn't enough to provide for her family and cover living costs.

With the goal of further developing her business, Uulbu has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 KGS to purchase a cow to increase her head count. Profits from the loan will allow her to improve her family's well-being, to develop her business and to save toward home renovations.

loans.use: to buy a cow in order to increase her income

loans.name: Hoeun's Group

texts.en:
A villager from Battambang province, Hoeurn is 53-year-old and a married mother with four children. To earn income to support on her family’s living; she has grown rice and raises pigs for ten years. Moreover, she can get more income via grocery items selling. Her pigs were sick and this is her main challenge in her raising business.

This is her first time with VisionFund and she leads a group of three members to seek for this loan. As the leader of group, she will spend her loan portion to buy pig feed to support her raising business in order to get more income for her family. She wishes that her business will run smoother than last year and earns her with more income to upgrade her living standard in the future.

loans.use: to buy more pig feed to support her pig raising business to get more income to support her family's living.

loans.name: Yunusa

texts.en:
Yunusa is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Yunusa is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, he would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, he will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a later date in the season when his can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, he now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members, and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy buri leaves and dye to color her mats

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Separated from her husband, she lives with her six children in a three bedroom house in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. She has been through difficult moments, some of which are the death of her father and mother, divorce and the loss of her farm through fire.

With this new loan requested, she will buy fruits such as oranges, pawpaw watermelons, vegetables and she will use some of it to rebuild her shed. She is optimistic that the business will succeed because she has been doing it for a long time. She has a good business site, and she treats her customers well. With this business activity, the community will benefit from quality products, moderate prices, and she will contribute to its development by paying her taxes.

With the profit made from this loan she will expand her business site, pay for her children's school fees and save some in order to provide medication for her family.

She prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and also the members are trained in marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed. Members also share their experiences and ideas.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables, and rebuild her shed in the market.

loans.name: Bashorat

texts.en:
Bashorat is a hardworking Tajik woman. She was born in 1966 year, is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a builder. Bashorat is a business lady. She has begun own business 17 years ago because she needed the money. Bashorat buys candies and chocolates in a bulk and retails in a local market. She always tries to offer wide range of goods for her buyers.

She is going to increase working capital and in this way to earn more money. From the profit she plans to help orphan children of her district. She is asking for a loan of 2000 Somoni to buy candies for increasing working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy candies for increased working capital and also to help orphaned children in her neighbourhood.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Aside from selling gallons of mineral water, Carmelita is also managing a massage service and likewise sells herbal products as their additional source of income. She’s grateful as Center for Community Transformation (CCT) was able to approve the prior loan of Php 15,000. It was an added capital that made her buy gallons of mineral water and it made a great impact on the business since it resulted to an increasing revenue.

Carmelita aims to expand the business and attract new patrons. She wants to invest for her own lot since it’s very expensive to pay for a monthly rental. She decided to apply for another loan of Php 20,000 this year. She will use the amount as a revolving fund for her to buy gallons of mineral water and to have stocks of herbal products to sell to her regular customers. 

Carmelita regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of mineral water and herbal products to expand her inventory.

loans.name: Faisi

texts.en:
Faisi lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda, and has two children, one of whom is in school. As a widow, she works hard to ensure that she provides for her children and dependents.

Her business is buying and selling cocoa plus matooke to be able to raise the school fees for her children. She also farms to supplement her income.

She previously got a 500,000 UGX loan through Kiva's field partner HOFOKAM to buy more matooke to sell. She has plans to open a shop to increase her earnings. She is again asking for a loan, this time for UGX 1,000,000 to buy cocoa for resale to cocoa companies.

loans.use: to buy cocoa for resale to cocoa companies.

loans.name: Sirajo

texts.en:
Sirajo is a maize farmer from Bamiyayi village.  As a Babban Gona member, he is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer's. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Sirajo had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, just to meet his immediate cash needs. Sirajo will use this loan to store the maize he harvests.  That will enable him to delay its sale until later in the season, when he can obtain the best price for his maize, at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price. 

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Sirajo no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectacre, Sirajo hopes to realize better yields.  He plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane, 33, is mother of twin boys, with the age 11-years old. 
Gayane's husband is a migrant worker in neighbouring country, who left the country with the hope of finding a job and sustaining his family. 
To tackle financial hardships, Gayane works in village bakery and also runs her own farm. She keeps livestock of cows, calves, 27 sheep and hens and also cultivate wheat, potato, cabbage and garlic. Gayane's primary income comes from selling the harvest and dairy products at the local market. 
The main challenge for her farming business is fluctuating market prices for farm produce as cause for concern. 
Gayane asks this loan to purchase forage for feeding the livestock in the winter and be prepared for the cold season. She hopes to receive lenders' support and sustain her farm in the winter.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock in the winter and be prepared for the cold season

loans.name: Nelda Nohemy

texts.es: Nelda,  tiene 38 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo y vive en el municipio de Ocotepeque cerca de Gracias Lempira junto con sus padres. Desde hace mas de 10 años ella de dedica al negocio propio para obtener ingresos, vende ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, juguetes, y bisutería fina. Para seguir trabajando ha solicitado un prestamo por la cantidad de 15,000.00 Lempiras, para invertir en la compra de productos de la temporada de época de independencia patria como ser camisas, calzado escolar, calcetas, calcetines, faldas, camisetas y bisutería para vender.  Con esto planea incrementar sus ventas, crecer como microempresaria y aportar a la estabilidad económica de su familia.
texts.en:
38-year old Nelda is a single mother of a son. She lives with her parents in the municipality of Ocotepeque near Gracias Lempira. For more than ten years she has earned her living from her own business selling clothing for men, women and children, toys and and fine jewellery.

So she can continue with her work, Nelda has asked for a loan of 15,000 lempiras to buy seasonal items for Independence Day such as shirts, school footwear, socks, skirts, t-shirts, and jewellery. With these purchases she expects to increase sales and grow as small businesswoman so she can bring economic stability to her family.

loans.use: shirts, school footwear, socks, skirts, t-shirts, and jewellery

loans.name: Lawan

texts.en:
Lawan is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Lawan is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. Traditionally, Lawan would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Lawan will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a later date in the season, when his can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Lawan now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members, and would like to use this additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Lucas

texts.en:
He is married with seven children and lives in a five bedroom apartment in Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. He has faced many challenges in life such as accidents and the deaths of his parents who were very supportive to him and the family at large.

He has taken and successfully repaid seven loans and says that with this new loan requested, he will buy firewood, pay for its transportation and splitting.

He has a positive view of his business succeeding because he has been doing it for a long time, he has a good business site and wood is in high demand. With this activity, the community members will not need to go long distances to buy wood which will always be available for cooking.

With the profit from this loan, he will improve his family's standard of living by providing them with three meals, pay for his family's medication, pay for his children’s education and provide them with other basic necessities. He will return some of the profits to the business and do repairs to his house.

He prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals.

loans.use: to buy firewood and pay for its transportation and splitting.

loans.name: Umaru

texts.en:
Umaru is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Umaru has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer's. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Umaru had to sell his maize at harvest, when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, just to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Umaru can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Umaru will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate much higher earnings per hectare. 

Umaru is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family.  He looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a university education.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.fr:
Inauguré le 13 décembre 2011, ce banc villageois est composé de femmes du groupement du village qui ont adhéré dans le programme afin de rendre leur petit commerce plus rentable. Une bonne ambiance anime les rencontres du groupe. 

Madame Mary, âgée de 49 ans (debout à l’extrême droite avec la main droite levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 01 enfant et  s’active dans la vente de produits alimentaires.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 01 sac de sucre à 22500f 01 sac de riz à 13500f 02 bouteilles de 20 litre d’huile raffinée à 14000f la bouteille et d’autres condiments d’un montant de 30000f et payer un transport de 8000f pour le revendre en détails.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte aider son mari dans la dépense quotidienne et renforcer ses activités et s’occuper de ses petits enfants (soins médicaux habillements etc…)
texts.en:
Created on December 13, 2011, this 'banc villageois' is made up of women from the village who have adhered to the program in order to make their small businesses more successful. They have animated, supportive group meetings.

Forty-nine-year-old Mary (standing on the far right side with her right hand raised), is the star borrower of the group. She is married and has one child. She sells groceries.

With this new loan, she intends to buy one bag of sugar (at 22,500 francs), one bag of rice (at 13,500 francs), two 20-liter bottles of refined oil (at 14,000 francs per bottle) and other condiments (for a total of 30,000 francs) and to pay for transportation (for 8,000 francs). She will resell the food at retail.

With the profits, she would like to help her husband with daily expenses and increase her business, as well as take care of her small children (medical care, clothing, etc. ...)

loans.use: to buy one bag of sugar (at 22,500 francs), one bag of rice (at 13,500 francs), two 20-liter bottles of refined oil (at 14,000 francs per bottle) and other condiments (for a total of 30,000 francs).

loans.name: Idris

texts.en:
Idris is a maize farmer from Yalwan Pegi village. As a Babban Gona member, Idris is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer's. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Idris had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, just to meet his immediate cash needs. Idris will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay it’s sale until later in the season, when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price. 

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Idris no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectacre, Idris hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get university education.

loans.use: To store his maize, eliminating pressure to sell it for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Garba

texts.en:
Garba is a maize farmer from Yalwan Pegi village. As a Babban Gona member, Garba is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Garba would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. Garba will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay its sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price. Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Garba no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Garba hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Usman

texts.en:
Usman is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Usman has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8MT/Ha, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Usman would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Usman can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Usman will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Usman is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Beatrice Bih

texts.en:
She is married with five children. They all live in a two bedroom house in the North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced many difficulties in life some of which are the death of her father and brother and the loss of some of her business money.

She was motivated by her friends to join GHAPE; she has been a member for some time now and has taken and repaid three loans.

With this new loan requested, she will buy foodstuffs and hide of a cow to sell in the market. She holds a positive view of this business succeeding because she has been in it for a long time. With this business activity, the community will benefit from her activity in that she will provide food for the population.

With the profit made from this loan, she is planning to expand her business, pay her children’s school fees and improve the family's standard of living She will also save some in order to undertake a bigger investment.

She prefers a GHAPE loan because of the low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and also the members are trained in marketing and management skills.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs and hide of a cow to sell in the market.

loans.name: Maria Liduvina

texts.es:
María Liduvina, con 58 años de edad, de estado civil casada, vive junto a su esposo e hijos, en casa propia, en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú, en una zona urbana.María Liduvina cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

María Liduvina se dedica a la actividad de crianza y venta de animales como cerdos, pavos, patos, gallinas y cuyes,desde hace más de 10 años de antigüedad en el negocio, en su propio domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de lechones,patos y alimento para la crianza de los mismos, de esta manera hacer crecer más su negocio, obtener más ingresos y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.

María Liduvina a tenido 4 préstamos con nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa, el último fue de S/.2,000.00 y lo a pagado puntualmente. Su negocio a crecido poco a poco, así a podido remodelar su casa desde que se hizo socio de nuestra institución.
texts.en:
María Liduvina is 58 years old, married and lives with her husband and children in her own home. It is located in an urban area in the district of Cayaltí, Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque region of Perú. María Liduvina has very good personal and work references from the residents of the area. The people that live in the area typically make a living from agriculture, small business and livestock.


María Liduvina makes a living by rearing and selling animals like pigs, turkeys, ducks, chickens and guinea pigs. She runs her business from home and has been trading for the last ten years. She is asking for a loan to buy piglets, ducks and food to rear them . This will allow her to expand her business , increase her income and be in a position to improve her quality of life.


María Liduvina has already had 4 loans with Edpyme Alternativa, the most recent was for $2,000.00 which she paid on time. Since she became a member of our organisation her business has slowly grown which has allowed her to make improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy piglets, ducks and food to rear them.

loans.name: Valentin

texts.es:
Valentín con 54 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su cónyuge e hijos, en casa propia de material rústico, en el distrito de Pomahuaca,provincia de Jaén, departamento de Cajamarca, país Perú. Valentin tiene 10 años radicando en la zona,cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los habitantes de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de café, maíz, arroz y al comercio de frutas.

Valentin se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de arroz, ubicado en Caserio Patacon - Pomahuaca, con una experiencia en el rubro de 6 años. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto.

Valentin es socio recurrente, a manejado créditos con nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa de los cuales los cuatro últimos son de S/. 2000 de los cuales a pagado muy bien. Firma con cónyuge.
texts.en:
54-year old Valentín lives with his partner and children in his own house made of simple materials in the district of Pomahuaca in the province of Jaén, department of Cajamarca in Peru. He has lived in the area for ten years and has many good references, both personal and work, from local people who mostly work in agriculture specialising in growing coffee, maize, rice and fruit.

Valentín earns his living growing rice in the village of Patacon, Pomahuaca, and has six years of experience doing this kind of work. The loan he is seeking will be used to buy supplies such as pesticides and fertiliser for his fields as well as to hire labourers to help with the harvest. These purchases will help him to improve his coffee crop in many ways and increase the harvest. He will have better production and a better quality product so he will have no problems selling the beans.

Valentín is a repeat client and has received loans (the last four for S/.2000) from our institution Edpyme Alternativa. He has made his repayments properly.

loans.use: buy supplies such as pesticides and fertiliser for his fields as well as to hire labourers to help with the harvest

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a maize farmer from Kaza village. As a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 MT/Ha, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs.

Ibrahim will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay its sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price. Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Ibrahim no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Ibrahim hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to diversify his farm and grow other crops.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en:
Samaila is maize farmer from Yalwan Pegi village. As a member of Babban Gona, Samaila is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the oppotrtunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. Before joining Babban Gona, Samaila would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest to meet his immediate cash needs.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Samaila can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Samaila is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to ensure that all his children get university education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Ngunjoh Susana

texts.en:
She is a widow with five children. She lives in a four bedroom house in Bamenda North West Region, Cameroon. She has faced many challenges in life, which are the death of her husband, father, and the death of two children. These have made life very difficult for her.

She was motivated to become a member of GHAPE by her friends and relatives who have been GHAPE members since 2003. She has successfully taken and repaid one loan.

With this new loan she is going to buy bags to sell. She knows her business is going to succeed because she has been doing it for a long time. People need bags for transportation of goods and they also need to transport things from the farm. With this business activity, the community will benefit from moderate prices, and they will always have bags available to carry things.

The profit from this loan will help her to pay for her children's school fees, provide some basic food for the family and pay for her family’s medication. She will use some of the profit to buy a plot to build a house for her family.

She prefers GHAPE loans because of the low interest rates and convenient terms of repayment.

loans.use: to buy bags to sell.

loans.name: Kartiack Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois dont fait parti ce groupe a été inauguré en juin 2010. Il est constitué de vingt femmes qui exercent le commerce comme activité et elles remboursent leurs prêts sans difficultés. Madame Maimouna qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de trente sept ans et mère de six enfants dont trois garçons. Elle s'active dans la vente de crème glace et de légumes depuis plusieurs années. Elle va acheter en grande quantité de la matière première pour crème glace et des légumes. Les bénéfices vont servir à aider son mari à la prise en charge de la famille et à subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en:
The 'banc villageois' of which this group is a part was created in June 2010. It is made up of 20 businesswomen who repay their loans without problem.

Maimouna, who is on the right side of the photo with her hand raised, is the group's representative. She is a 37-year-old, married woman. She has six children, three of whom are boys. She has been selling ice cream and vegetables for many years.

She will buy a large amount of ingredients for making ice cream and vegetables. The profits will allow her to help her husband with family expenses and to meet her needs.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for ice cream and vegetables.

loans.name: Nazly Judith

texts.es: Nazly de 31 años es habitante de un barrio ubicado en el municipio de Malambo y además de su rol de ama de casa, y madre de un niño de 7 años y dos adolescentes de 14 y 15 años, se dedica al comercio de calzado, negocio que le recomendó su suegra y que ejecuta desde hace 6 años mediante visitas a su clientela conformada por vecinos, familiares y amigos y que le permite contribuir con los gastos del hogar y con ello ha logrado brindarle a sus hijos mayores comodidades y bienestar. Actualmente está tramitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, recursos que proyecta invertir en la compra de un buen surtido de calzado para ofrecer en la temporada de fin de año. Nazly sueña con seguir ampliando la cobertura de su negocio, para fortalecerlo y obtener mayores utilidades que en el futuro le permitan los recursos necesarios para adquirir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Nazly is 31 years old and lives in a neighborhood in the municipality of Malambo.  Apart from her job as a housewife and mother to a 7 year old and two teenagers, ages 14 and 15, she dedicates her time to a footwear business.  Her mother-in-law suggested the business, which she has now managed for 6 months though visits to her clientele, which is comprised of neighbors, family members, friends.  It has permitted her to contribute to the household costs and she has been able to give her children more comforts and well-being.  

She is currently processing her first Kiva loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She anticipates investing in buying a good stock of footwear to offer during the year-end season.  

Nazly dreams of continuing to expand the reach of her business to strengthen it and to obtain greater earnings which, in the future will give her the necessary resources to have her own home.

loans.use: to invest in buying a good stock of footwear.

loans.name: Melanio

texts.es: Melanio, tiene 42 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja y reside en una de las aldeas del municipio de Tocoa, Colon.  El siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura y con el fin de aumentar los ingresos para su familia hace 3 años ha decidido con su esposa establecer una pulpería donde vende productos de abarrotería en general, refrescos, churros, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, huevos, sal, manteca, productos enlatados, condimentos, productos de limpieza, y otros abarrotes. El está solicitando 10,000.00 Lempiras para invertir en surtir su negocio con más productos como harina, manteca, jabón, refrescos, pan, golosinas y granos básicos para poder aumentar sus ventas. Sus planes a futuro son hacer crecer su negocio y con los ingresos cultivar maíz a fin de brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
42-year old Melanio lives with his partner in one of the communities in the municipality of Tocoa, Colon. He has always worked in agriculture. Three years ago he decided, along with his wife, to open a corner store in order to increase income for his family. He sells groceries such as soft drinks, doughnuts, rice, beans, sugar, eggs, salt, butter, canned good, condiments, cleaning products etc.

Melanio is seeking a loan of 10,000 lempiras to buy additional stock such as flour, butter, soap, soft drinks, bread, candy, and basic grains in order to increase sales. His plan for the future is to grow his business and with the income grow maize so he can provide his family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: buy additional stock such as flour, butter, soap, soft drinks, bread, candy, and basic grains

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is a married woman. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Liza is 45 years old.

Liza has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. Liza requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

Liza has been in this business for five years. In the future, Liza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Gleris Naida

texts.es: Gleris es una madre soltera, con la responsabilidad de sostener y educar a sus dos hijas  de 8 y 9 años respectivamente; ante la falta de oportunidades de trabajo,  decidió emprender hace 7 años una venta de pasabocas, muy conocidos en la región Caribe como  "fritos" al ser freídos en aceite bien caliente. Ella elabora una gran variedad de frituras entre ellas se encuentran las Arepas; un alimento preparado a base de maíz y que se sirve de acompañante o sola, comúnmente se rellena de queso, carnes o pollo, Carimañolas; un alimento a base de yuca, relleno de queso costeño o de carne molida aliñada, Empanadas; elaboradas de masa de maíz amarillo o blanco rellenas con queso costeño, carne molida o pollo, El Patacón; un alimento elaborado 100% a base de plátano frito y Deditos; elaborados a base de harina de trigo y rellenos con bocadillo o queso. Son productos de consumo cotidiano, tanto en los hogares a la hora del desayuno o de la cena, como a manera de comida rápida, es por ello que Gleris apertura su negocio a las 5 a.m. y en el trascurso del día hasta las 10 p.m. para ofrecer un servicio oportuno y completo.  Actualmente está solicitando su primer credikiva a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo el cual planea invertir en la compra de insumos como harinas, aceites, carnes y aliños, al por mayor para obtener mejores precios y un mejor margen de utilidad, además de fortalecer su capital de trabajo para tener una mayor oferta y generar ingresos suficientes para brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gleris is a single mother with the responsibility of supporting and educating her two daughters, ages 8 and 9 respectively. Before the lack of work opportunities, seven years ago she started selling hors d'oeuvres, well known in the Caribbean region as "fritos" from being fried in hot oil.

She makes a great variety of fried foods, among them: arepas, a food prepared with a base of corn and served as a side or alone, commonly filled with cheese, meat, or chicken; carimañoles, a yuca-based food filled with Costeño cheese or with ground seasoned meat; empanadas, made from a yellow- or white-corn base and filled with Costeño cheese, ground meat, or chicken; el patacón, a food made with a base of 100% fried bananas; and deditos, made from a wheat flour base and filled with guava paste or cheese.

They are everyday food products, found as often in homes at the breakfast hour as the dinner one as a form of quick food. For this, Gleris operates her business starting at 5 a.m. and throughout the day until 10 p.m. to offer an opportune and complete service.

She is now requesting her first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo ["The Mario Santo Domingo Foundation"], which plans to invest in the purchase of supplies such as flours, oils, meats, and seasonings wholesale to get the best prices and a larger profit margin, on top of boosting her working capital to get a better offer and generate sufficient income to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: supplies such as flours, oils, meats, and seasoning wholesale.

loans.name: Ummar

texts.en:
Ummar is a maize farmer from Badamasi village. As a Babban Gona member, Ummar is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ummar would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. Ummar will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay its sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Ummar no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare, Ummar hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get university education.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare, Tukur hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to move into a better home with his family

loans.name: Irimiya

texts.en:
Irimiya is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Irimiya has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

With the help of this loan, Irimiya can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Irimiya will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare.

Irimiya is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Buenconsejo

texts.en:
Buenconsejo is 58 years old and widowed with six children. Buenconsejo works very hard to provide for them.

Buenconsejo runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, cannd goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Buenconsejo has been in this business for 1 year and sells a variety of items such as softdrinks, rice, coffee, toothpaste, soap, shampoo and other groceries. 

In the future, Buenconsejo would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, cannd goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Cerila

texts.en:
Cerila is 46 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Cerila works very hard to provide for them.

Cerila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

Cerila has been in this business for 26 years now and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Cerila would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Dahiru

texts.en:
Dahiru is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Dahiru has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, he would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. As a Babban Gona member, Dahiru will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare. He is thankful that he now has the opportunity to to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to diversify his farm and grow other crops.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Nyam

texts.en:
Mrs. Nyam, 25 years old, lives with her husband and parents in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She and her mother have been making and selling leather gloves since 2014. Her father has retired from work and gets state pension. Her husband is currently unemployed.

She is requesting a loan of 2000 USD to open a grocery store by stocking food stuffs, paying rental fee and decorating the rental place. By doing so her family's living standard will improve.

loans.use: to open a new grocery store.

loans.name: Sonia Claribel

texts.es: Sonia de 40 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hija, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa interior desde hace 5 años su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal y posee muchos clientes, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas ropa interior para damas y asi poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Sonia is 40 years old. She is a single mother who lives in her own house with her daughter. She has worked selling underwear for five years. Her business is located in the municipal market and she has many clients. With her profits she manages to pay some of her household's expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy more underwear for women and thus being able to improve her economic income.

loans.use: to buy more underwear for women.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen is glad that she was able to sustain her store through the previous loan granted by Kiva lenders. This has encouraged her to be more diligent in growing her business, and she has recently started a small drug store. She has hired a pharmacist to assist her.

This time, she needs funds in the amount of PHP 50,000 to pay for large quantities of medicines to sell and partly refill her mini-store with more quantities of grocery items such as rice, coffee, soda, and rice noodles, which she sells at retail. She is shown on her photo at her small general store. She puts her best effort and heart into running her businesses, for this is her source of funds to send her child to college and meet their everyday needs. She is thanking God and Kiva for your noble advocacy.

She prays for God for her business to prosper and to lead a peaceful and godly life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for various medicines and partly for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Riffat's Group

texts.en: Riffat is a 38-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children, and her husband is engaged in a scrap material recycling business. Her husband needs to buy scrap materials in bulk to recycle, but due to some financial constraints, he is not in a suitable position to make the bulk purchase. Therefore, Riffat has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to purchase the scrap material in bulk so that he can earn a good profit from his business. Riffat is very thankful to Kiva's lenders and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy recyclable materials in bulk for her husband's recycling business.

loans.name: Shiran

texts.en:
Shiran is a divorced mother of two children, one of whom is a special needs child. She ‎has worked in real estate for several years but during her divorce process, pulled back ‎and worked from home. Her real estate business has grown and her home office is not adequate to ‎serve clients and meet the business’s potential. Shiran rented a centrally located office ‎and her business already is beginning to grow.‎

She needed this loan to assist with costs for renovations and initial rent for her real estate business. She works on finding home and office rentals and property sales.‎

Shiran is working to ensure her future is secure and enable a strong education for her ‎children, specifically for her special needs child. She wants to provide for them while ‎growing her business.‎

loans.use: to assist with costs for renovations and initial rent.‎

loans.name: Amadu

texts.en:
Amadu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, he is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Amadu would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, he will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a later date in the season when his can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare, Amadu now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Tukur

texts.en:
Tukur is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Tukur would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, he can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, he will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare. Tukur is thankful that he now has the opportunity to to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Marie elena es una joven estudiante de medicina, ella solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativos, esta es su historia: Mi nombre es Maria  Elena  nací en la ciudad de tenares, actualmente erradicada en jima arriba la vega, donde eh vivido casi toda mi vida excepto a mis 13 años que falleció mi padre. y mi madre no tuvo más alternativa que mudarse a la ciudad de Santiago  donde realice mis últimos curso de bachiller. 

A mis 17 años a mi madre la nombraron como promotora de salud y tuvimos que abandonar la ciudad y regresar a jima arriba donde actualmente vivo, soy estudiante de medicina de la universidad católica tecnológica del Cibao  UCATECI. Y las materias que me gustan son la biología y anatomía. 
Solicito  esta ayuda para no tener que    cancelar mis estudios porque solo dependo de mi madre la cual su salario no alcanza para el sustento del hogar y pagar mis estudios de la   Universidad. 

Estoy esperanzada a que me van ayudar y podré cumplir mi sueño y meta de ser una gran doctora y trabajar en un centro clínico y desarrollar mis conocimientos, y poder ayudar  mis familiares  sobre todo a mi madre que ha dado todo por mí.
texts.en:
Marie Elena is a young medical student. She is asking for a loan to cover educational expenses. This is her story:

“My name is Maria Elena and I was born in the city of Tenares and lived most of my life in a currently destroyed area of Jima Arriba in La Vega where I lived until my father died when I was 13. My mother had no other alternative except to move to the city of Santiago where I took my last high school courses.

When I was 17 years old they appointed my mother as a health worker and we had to leave the city and return to Jima Arriba where I currently live. I am a medical student at the Universidad Católica Tecnológica del Cibao, UCATECI. My favorite subjects are biology and anatomy.

I am asking for help so I do not have to withdraw from my studies because I only depend on my mother whose salary is not enough to sustain the household and pay for my university studies.

I am hoping that you will help me and I can complete my dream and goal of becoming a doctor in order to work in a clinical center and develop my knowledge so I can help my relatives, above all my mother, who has given everything to me.”

loans.use: to cover higher education expenses.

loans.name: Juana Perez

texts.es: Juana de 56 años de edad es viuda y vive en casa propia con su hija quien trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, ella se dedica a la confección de ropa desde hace 21 años, su taller de costura lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, gracias a su trabajo es como ha podido salir adelante, ella está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas hilos, agujas, variedad de tela, botones, elásticos, etc. y así poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Juana is 56 years old. She is a widow and lives in her own home with her daughter who works and helps her financially.

She has been making clothing for 21 years. Her sewing workshop is located in her home. Thanks to her work she has been able to get ahead.

She is asking for a new loan to buy more thread, needles, and a variety of fabric, buttons, elastic, etc., and thus be able to continue with her work that generates good profits.

loans.use: to buy more thread, needles, and a variety of fabrics, buttons, elastic, etc.

loans.name: Maria Laura

texts.es: Maria de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, ella se dedica a la venta de perfumes y hamacas de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias, con lo que obtiene sus ventas logra salir adelante, ella esta solicitando nuevamente otro crédito para la compra de mas productos por mayor ya que le va muy bien en sus ventas y asi continuar con su trabajo y seguir teniendo mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Maria is 56 years old and lives in her own house with her daughter. She works selling perfumes and hammocks itinerantly in the various neighborhoods. With what she gets from her sales she manages to get ahead. She is requesting a new loan to buy more products wholesale as her sales are going well. Then she can continue with her work and continue having better economic income.

loans.use: to buy perfume and hammocks wholesale.

loans.name: Jose Manolo

texts.es: Jose de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el posee un taller de estructuras metalicas ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace 15 años, tiene muchos clientes por su buen trabajo y buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias es como ha podido salir adelante durante mucho tiempo, el clientes esta solicitando a INTEGRAL un credito para la compra de hierro, metal, herramienta etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Jose is 47 years old and lives in his own home with his partner. He has had a metal workshop located in his home for the past 15 years. He has a lot of customers thanks to his excellent work and reasonable prices. The money he has earned has enabled him to move forward for a long time.

Jose is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL in order to buy iron, metal, tools and other items to boost his earnings.

loans.use: to buy iron, metal, tools and other items.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is deeply encouraged by Kiva and its lenders for their kind hearts. She has received lending several times in the past, which has really helped sustain and grow her store. It has encouraged her to be more diligent in growing her business and she is forever grateful for your help.

Once again, she trusts that you will lend her funds in the amount of PHP 20,000 which she will use to refill her store with more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, and rice noodles which she sells at retail.

Her store means a lot to her since it has been her source of income which has sustained her family's basic needs and is supporting sending her children to school. She is hopeful for your positive response.

She prays for God to prosper her store to be able to save for her children's college education. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 40 years old and has two children. She is married and one of her children is in school.

Merlinda is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Merlinda requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Merlinda has been farming vegetables for 20 years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

In the future, Merlinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Belia

texts.es: Belia, tiene 42 años de edad, su estado civil es unión libre, tiene un hijo y vive en el municipio de El Progreso, Yoro. Desde hace 6 años se dedica a su propio negocio de elaboración y venta de tortillas de maíz, siendo sus clientes los mismos vecinos de la comunidad. Ella ha solicitado varios préstamos para mantener su negocio. Actualmente solicita otro préstamo por la cantidad de 20,000 lempiras, para comprar maíz y leña al por mayor, una estufa industrial y también va hacer unas mejoras a un apartamento de su casa. Con esta inversion considera que tendrá suficiente materia prima para su negocio y obtendrá mas ganancias. Su meta es seguir creciendo con el negocio y esto le permitirá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Belia is 42 years old and is in a domestic partnership.  She has a son and lives in the municipality of El Progresos, Yoro.   For six years she has made a living through the making and selling of corn tortillas.  Her clients are her neighbors in the community. 

She has requested several loans to maintain her business.  Currently she is requesting a loan of 20,000 empires to buy corn and firewood in bulk, and an industrial stove.  She is also going to make improvements to an apartment in her house. With this investment she will have sufficient raw material for her business and will earn more. Her goal is to keep growing the business, which will allow her to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale corn and firewood and an industrial stove, and to improve the apartment in her house.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en: Genoveva is applying for a loan of $ 1,000.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a shop selling second hand clothes, and she also sells in the market.Genoveva has been involved in business activities since in 2008, She started with her own working capital of $ 300.00. She is earning a good income from selling her second hand clothes because many people like to buy them, as they are cheap and unique compared to new clothes. So, she is still happy to do her business. She also has animals like cows, pigs, chickens and dogs.

loans.use: to buy additional clothes, shoes and other things.

loans.name: Karla Daniela

texts.es: Karla es una joven emprendedora de 20 años que heredó el negocio de droguería iniciado por su abuela y que ahora se encuentra a su cargo; los vecinos y transeúntes del barrio en donde funciona su negocio ubicado en el municipio de Soledad, se encuentran satisfechos con su servicio y tienen a la mano todo tipo de medicamentos de uso común, formulados y artículos de aseo personal en el horario de 8:00 a.m. a 10:00  p.m. todos los días de la semana.  Ella maneja proveedores de diferentes casas farmacéuticas a quienes cancela sus compras de contado y actualmente está tramitando su primer credikiva ante la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, financiamiento que planea invertir en un mayor inventario de medicamentos para fortalecer su oferta. Ella se visualiza en el futuro con otros puntos de venta que le generen mayores utilidades y que le permitan dar calidad de vida a sus padres.
texts.en:
Karla is a young, 20-year-old entrepreneur who now finds herself in charge of the drugstore business started by her grandfather, which she inherited. The residents and passers-by in the neighborhood where her business is located, in the municipality of Soledad, are satisfied with her service and have at hand all types of commonly-used medications, prescription drugs, and personal hygiene products from the hours of 8:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. every day of the week.

She manages different pharmaceutical providers to whom she pay her bills in cash. Presently, she is processing her first Kiva loan through la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo ["Mario Santo Domingo Foundation"], financing that she plans to invest in a better inventory of medications to boost her offerings. She is visualizing a future with other points of sale that will generate greater profits and that will allow her to give her parents a quality life.

loans.use: to invest in a better inventory of medications.

loans.name: Bryan

texts.es: Bryan es un joven de 26 años que sintió gran atracción por las motocicletas desde su adolescencia y tanto fue su pasión que empíricamente aprendió a realizar diseños de calcomanías para sus amigos. En el año 2009 decidió que amaba esta profesión y  que tenía gran vocación para el diseño, así que formalizó su negocio en el que ofrece una gran variedad de accesorios y calcomanías personalizadas que engalanan todo tipo de motocicletas que llegan hasta su local ubicado en el municipio de Soledad. Brayan está comprometido con su cónyuge y con esta actividad ofrece bienestar a su hogar y desea continuar creciendo para proyectarse a futuro con un negocio más próspero.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en cascos, chalecos e insumos; papel para polarizado que son de gran rotación en su negocio. Bryan es un emprendedor que desea brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y con esta inversión considera que su negocio será más competitivo.
texts.en:
Bryan is a young person, 26 years old, who has felt a great attraction to motorcycles since his adolescence. So great was his passion that he learned on his own to create sticker designs for his friends. In 2009 he decided that he loved this work and that he had a calling for design. So he formalized his business in which he offers a large variety of accessories and personalized stickers that adorn all kinds of motorcycles that come to his store located in the Soledad municipality.

Bryan is engaged to his partner and with this job he provides for the well-being of his home. He hopes to continue growing to project a future with a more prosperous business. Right now he is applying for his first Kiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation to invest in helmets, vests, and supplies including sticker paper, that are of high turnover in his business. Bryan is an entrepreneur who wishes to provide a better quality of life for his family, and with this investment he believes that his business will be more competitive.

loans.use: to invest in helmets, vests, and supplies including sticker paper.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es: Rolando de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijas, el se dedica al cultivo de maiz y frijol, tambien trabaja como albañil y electricista, se dedica a la actividad agricola desde hace 15 años e inicio con capital propio, vende sus prodcutos en los pueblos aledaños y posee muchos clientes y asi es como puede solventar cualquier gasto que se le presente en su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Rolando is 36 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and three daughters. He works cultivating corn and beans, and also works as a builder and electrician. He has worked in agriculture since he was 15 years old and started with his own capital. He sells his products in neighboring towns and has many customers. This is how he is able to settle any expense his household presents.

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest control, etc., and to improve the land shown in the photograph in order to continue his work and have a better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control, etc., and improve the land.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La señora vive en Ivirgarzama, es madre soltera tiene un hijo, la señora es de la provincia chapare del departamento de Cochabamba, uno de los lugares pobres de Bolivia, ella es de la comunidad de Laquiña como la mayoría de las personas buscando mayor oportunidad de vida, en la comunidad de la señora la producción bajo debido a los cambios patológicos, difícil de controlar, cada vez la producción escaseo, por lo que la señora decidió migrar al trópico, actualmente trabaja en el sector agrícola y se dedica a la producción de piña, de donde tiene en producción una hectárea de piña 18000 unidades lo que comercializa a los intermediarios que le vienen a comprar al lugar de su sindicato el préstamo que está solicitando es para pagar los gastos de su sobrino que se encuentra delicado de salud por un accidente de tránsito el sobrino fue internado en una clínica por un dolor extremo en la espalda y cabeza y los médicos le realizaron unos exámenes de laboratorios a fondo para saber por qué del dolor y su diagnóstico fue tan grave y debe ser intervenido además de servicios de fisioterapia lo más antes posible para reestablecerse y continuar con sus actividades de manera normal, por tal motivo decidió solicitar el préstamo.
texts.en:
The Señora lives in Ivirgarzama, is a single mother, and has one son. She is from the Chapare province in the Cochabamba department, one of Bolivia's poor places. She is from the community of Laquiña, like most people, looking for better opportunity in life. In her community production is low due to pathological changes, which are difficult to control, and each time the production is scarce. This is why she decided to move to the tropic, where today she works in the agricultural sector and makes a living selling pineapple. This is where she has in production a hectare of 18000 pineapples which she sells to the middlemen who come to buy them at her union's place.

The loan that she is requesting is to pay for the costs of her nephew who is in fragile health as the result of a traffic accident. He was committed to a clinic for extreme pain in his back and head, and the doctors carried out some thorough laboratory tests in order to find out why he had pain. His diagnosis was very serious and he must undergo physical therapy as soon as possible in order to recover and continue with his activities in a normal manner, which is why she decided to ask for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for the costs of an operation, clinic, and medicine for her nephew who suffered a traffic accident, which is why his entire family is very worried.

loans.name: Idelso

texts.es:
Idelso con 39 años de edad, de estado civil casado, vive junto a su cónyuge y sus dos hijos, en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, departamento de Cajamarca, país Perú. Idelso cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los habitantes de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría ala agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Idelso se dedica a la actividad del cultivo de café, cuenta con 08 años de experiencia en el negocio.Se solicita préstamo para invertir en el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café e incrementar sus rendimientos. De esta manera incrementará sus ganancias.
