Idelso es socio recurrente en nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa. Ha manejado dos créditos los cuáles lo a cancelado de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Idelso, 39 years old, is married and lives together with his partner and their two children in the Pucará district in the Jaén province in the Cajamarca department of Peru. Idelso has many good references, as many personal as professional from residents in the area. The people of this locality work mainly in agriculture, commerce, and ranching.

Idelso works farming coffee, having 8 years of experience in the business. He is seeking a loan to invest in the maintenance of his coffee crops and increase his yield. In this way he will increase his earnings.

Idelso is a recurrent member of the Edpyme Alternativa institution. He has managed two loans, which he paid off in a timely manner.

loans.use: to invest in the maintenance of his coffee crops and increase his yield.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro con 42 años de edad, de estado civil soltero,vive junto a su madre en el distrito de San Felipe, provincia de Jaén, departamento de Cajamarca, país Perú.Pedro cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los habitantes de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Pedro se dedica a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz,cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en el rubro. Adicionalmente se dedica al cultivo de pan llevar como son yuca, fréjol,etc, los cuáles son para su consumo.Solicita préstamo para invertir en el negocio y mantenimiento de su cultivo de maíz. De esta manera poder adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.

Pedro es socio recurrente en nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa, este es su cuarto crédito.
texts.en:
Pedro at 42 years of age is single. He lives together with his mother in the district of San Felipe, Jaén province, in the department of Cajamarca, Peru. Pedro has good references both personal as well as work from the inhabitants of the area. The people of this place work mainly in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock.

Pedro works in agriculture growing corn. He has more than 10 years experience in this field. He also grows basic foods like yucca, beans, etc. which are for his own consumption. He is requesting a loan to invest in his business and maintain his corn crop. In this way he can obtain an acceptable profit that will improve his quality of living.

Pedro is a repeat client of Edpyme Alternativa, this is his fourth loan.

loans.use: to invest in his business and maintain his corn crop.

loans.name: Scola

texts.en: Scola, a 27-year-old woman, lives in Iringa district. She is married and is the mother of one child. Scola volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, leading life skills sessions for students in the nearby secondary school. Scola has a tailoring and clothing business. She sells women's clothes. She managed to repay her first loan on time and she is requesting second Kiva loan to increase the stock of clothes in her business. Scola plans to use the profit she will earn to build a house and to pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: to increase the stock of clothes in her business

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es: Don Hernan de 63 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el se dedica a la crianza de ganado bovino y al cultivo de maiz, desde hace 25 años e inicio con capital propio, comercializa sus prodcutos en los pueblos aledaños, gracias a su trabajo es como el ha podido salir adelante con su familia, el cliente esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas ganado para poder seguir con la crianza y asi poder mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Hernan is 63 and lives in his own home with his wife and son. He has worked raising cattle and farming corn for the last 25 years. He began with his own money, selling his products in the neighboring villages. Thanks to his work he has been able to succeed with his family. He is seeking a loan to buy more cattle to be able to continue raising them and thereby be able to improve his income.

loans.use: to buy more cattle.

loans.name: Nely Suyapa

texts.es:
La señora Nely Suyapa de 41  años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 10  años al negocio de venta de abarrotería, en su negocio vende, arroz, azúcar, frijoles, huevos, pan, churros, frescos, jugos, lácteos, jabón, pollo,  etc.  También vende golosinas como tajaditas preparadas con ensaladas y encurtido. 
Doña Nely Suyapa  vive en una aldea,  al sur de Honduras, es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Esta solicitando el préstamo para compra granos básicos como ya que este producto se lo están vendiendo a muy buen precio y quiere aprovechar a comprar maíz, frijoles y arroz actualmente tiene un préstamo pero debido a esta oportunidad solicita este otro, ya que su negocio no cuenta con estos productos porque espera el apoyo de este crédito y con este pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente responsable  con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio  bien surtido y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.
San Lorenzo Honduras – Septiembre del 2015.
texts.en:
Ms. Nely Suyapa, 41 years old, lives with her husband and children in her own house. She has worked since she was 10 years old selling items in a small grocery store. Her business sells rice, sugar, beans, eggs, bread, churros, soft drinks, juices, dairy products, soap, chicken, etc. She also sells snacks like banana slices with salads and pickles.

Ms. Nely Suyapa lives in a village in the south of Honduras. She is an entrepreneurial woman with the desire to advance and fights day by day to improve her quality of life.

She is requesting the loan to buy bulk grains since now this product is selling at a very good price and she wants to take the opportunity to buy corn, beans, and rice. She presently has a loan but given this opportunity she is requesting another, now that her business does not have these products because she is awaiting the support of this loan, and with it she expects to improve her income and also her quality of life. She is a responsible client with the desire to work with Prisma.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -- September 2015

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, eggs, bread, churros, soft drinks, juices, dairy products, soap, and chicken, etc. in order to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia con 46 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, vive junto a sus padres, en el distrito de Cayalluc, provincia de Cajamarca, país Perú, en una zona rural. Cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales como laborales por parte de los habitantes de la zona.

Ella se dedica a la destilación de aguardiente, hace más de 15 años.Solicita crédito para realizar los pagos de peones en los deshierbos de caña, cuyo producto lo utiliza para la destilación de aguardiente. Implementación de sus equipos de destilación. Posee conocimientos en el negocio.

Julia es socia recurrente en Edpyme Alternativa, no se encuentra bancarizado.
texts.en:
Julia, 46 years old, is single and lives with her parents in the district of Cayalluc, Cajamarca province, in the country of Peru, in a rural area. She has many good personal and work references from the people in the area.

She has worked distilling aguardiente for more than 15 years. She asks for the loan to pay the workers who weed the sugar cane, whose product she uses to distill aguardiente, and the implementation of her distilling equipment. She has knowledge of the business.

Julia is recurring borrower at Edpyme Alternativa, and she is unbanked.

loans.use: to pay the laborers to weed the sugar cane.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has piped water and electricity. She cites school fees and food as being her greatest monthly expenses.

She has operated a beauty salon business for the past three years. Her potential customers are her fellow neighbours and people at the marketplace. She dreams of earning more income and incorporating hairdressing skills in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her beauty salon business.

She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her beauty salon business

loans.name: Lucas

texts.en: Lucas is a young man living in Kenya. He attended iSmart's sales and marketing training and has taken up a job as sales agent. Lucas sells life-improving products like solar lamps and clean cookstoves. These clean cookstoves have a more efficient design that reduces charcoal consumption, saving customers money and saving the environment. These cookstoves also reduce the toxic smoke emissions and are better for the customer's health. Please help Lucas earn a living and bring these beneficial products to families in his community.

loans.use: to pay for clean cookstoves to sell in informal settlements in Nairobi.

loans.name: Adina

texts.ru: Адина, 27 лет, замужем, есть дочь. Образование- средне-специальное. С 2007 года Адина занимается животноводством. В хозяйстве есть 4 коровы, 10 овец, лошадь. Адина решила развить свою сельскохозяйственную деятельность, так как это единственный источник доходов и обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров. Доходы от бизнеса она будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие хозяйства.
texts.en: Adina is 27 years old, married, and has a daughter. She has a secondary vocational education. Adina has been rearing animals since 2007. She has four cows, ten sheep, and a horse. Adina has decided to develop her agricultural activity since it is her sole source of income and has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy some cows. She will invest the income from the business in the further development of her farm.

loans.use: to purchase additional cows in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Ancelmo

texts.es:
El señor Ancelmo   de 50  años  de edad es casado ,  vive con  su  esposa  en su casa de habitación , se dedica desde hace 04 años al negocio de venta de leña , ubicado en la de la montaña , al sur de Honduras, sus clientes son los amigos y vecinos  de la zona. Don Ancelmo  es una persona trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante y poder vivir una vida mejor.
Esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de más cargas de leña y. Con el apoyo del préstamo el pretende cubrir la demanda de pedidos  hechos por sus clientes y abastecerse de leña ya que en estos meses los pedidos aumentan y así ver crecer su negocio y de esta forma mejorar  su condición de vida para él y su familia.
Su sueño  es compra otra casa para una vida mejor.
San Lorenzo  Honduras  -  Septiembre  del 2015.
texts.en:
Señor Ancelmo is 50 years old, married, and lives with his wife in their home. He has made a living selling wood for four years. His business is located in the mountains in the south of Honduras. His customers are his friends and neighbours. Ancelmo is a hardworking person who dreams of getting ahead and living a better life.

Ancelmo is requesting a loan to buy more bundles of wood. With the support of the loan he hopes to cover the orders placed by his customers and stock up on wood, because orders increase during these months. In this way, he will see his business grow and in turn, improve he and his family's living conditions.

His dream is to buy another home for a better life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - September 2015.

loans.use: to buy more bundles of wood.

loans.name: Richard De Jesús

texts.es: Richard es un habitante del municipio de Soledad y en esta misma localidad emprendió su proyecto de negocio fomentado por su padre, este microempresario está dedicado a la elaboración y venta de mesas para banquetes, los cuales fabrica según las especificaciones de su cliente; mesones redondos y rectangulares. Su clientela integrada por propietarios de las casas de eventos,  realizan sus pedidos cualquier día del año y Richard está dispuesto para a tenderlos todos los días de la semana a partir de las 7 a.m. en jornada continua hasta las 7 p.m. Hace ocho años realiza esta labor con total disposición e interés, ofreciendo calidad, compromiso, puntualidad y seriedad a sus clientes. En actualidad está tramitando su primer credikiva a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  recursos que invertirá en la compra de materias primas como madera, forros, tuberías y platinas con el fin de incrementar su producción para mayores ventas. Su meta es expandir el negocio a nivel nacional y obtener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Richard is a resident of the Soledad municipality where he launched his business encouraged by his father. This micro entrepreneur makes and sells tables for banquets. He makes the tables following the specifications from his customers, round or rectangular tables.

His customers are event organizers and place orders any day of the year. Richard is willing to help them every day of the week from 7 a.m until 7 p.m

He has been doing this type of work for 8 years with total disposition and interest, offering quality, commitment, punctuality and formality to his customers. He is currently requesting his first credikiva loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will invest the resources to purchase basic materials such as wood, covers, pipes, metal bases with the goal of increasing his production to sell more. His goal is to expand his business, become national and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase basic materials such as wood, covers, pipes and metal bases.

loans.name: Azada

texts.ru: Азада, 31 год, замужем, мать 3 детей школьного возраста. У Азады - высшее образование, работает в Центре семейной медицины, получая заработную плату в размере 12,000 сом. Супруг работает в Социальном фонде. Семья занимается сельским хозяйством, есть лошадь, 2 коровы, 18 овец.  Азада обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на ремонт дома и постройку времянки. На кредитные средства приобретут цемент, шифер, кирпичи. Доходы Азада планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее расширение своего бизнеса и улучшение жилищных условий.
texts.en: Azada is 31 years old, married, and the mother of three school-age children. Azada has a higher education and works in a family medical center, receiving a salary of 12,000 som (KGS). Her spouse works for a social fund. Her family is engaged in agriculture, and has a horse, two cows, and 18 sheep. Azada has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to renovate her house and build a temporary shed. She will buy cement, slate, and bricks with the borrowed funds. Azada plans to invest the proceeds in the further expansion of her business and the improvement of her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cement, slate, and bricks to repair her house and build a temporary shed.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a 45-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She has had a sari-sari store or mini-grocery store business for 21 years now, selling goods to the people in her community. She is also a rice farmer. Lorna is a hardworking woman who tries her best to earn a living so that she can help her husband in supporting the needs of their household like buying food and paying bills.

Lorna is asking for a loan to buy additional items to sell like noodles, toiletries, coffee, milk, sugar, salt, detergent, canned food, cooking oil and chips to replenish her stock. With the loan, Lorna will be able to augment her inventory so that she can cater to more customers in their area. Lorna hopes to expand her business so that it will generate more income and pay for the school fees of her youngest son, who is 15.

loans.use: to buy noodles, toiletries, coffee, milk, sugar, salt, detergent, canned food, cooking oil and chips

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio con 40 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su cónyuge y sus 4 menores hijos, en el distrito de San Felipe, provincia de Jaén, departamento de Cajamarca, país Perú.Cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.La población de dicha localidad se dedica en su mayoría a la agricultura siendo el cultivo de maíz y menestras las de mayor producción, así como el comercio en general.

Antonio se dedica al comercio, cuenta con una bodega ubicada en su domicilio, el cuál tiene 05 años de antigüedad. Adicionalmente se dedica a la agricultura cuenta con un terreno agrícola donde cultiva maíz y menestras para su consumo familiar. El préstamo solicitado es para invertir en su negocio en la compra de mercadería para surtir más su bodega, de esta manera adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.

Antonio es socio recurrente,este es su segundo crédito para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Antonio, 40 years old, is in a common-law relationship and lives with his wife and their four young children in the San Felipe district, Jaén province, Cajamarca department, in the country of Peru. He has very good personal and work references from the inhabitants of the zone. The people of the town described work mostly in agriculture, with corn and legumes being of greatest production, as well as business in general.

Antonio works in business. He has a grocery store located in his home which is five years old. Additionally, he works in agriculture. He has agricultural land where he grows corn and legumes for his family's consumption. The requested loan is to invest in his business by buying merchandise to better supply his grocery store and in this way acquire an acceptable income in order to improve his quality of life.

Antonio is a recurring member. This is his second loan with Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to invest in his business by buying merchandise to better supply his grocery store.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
María Teresa con 72 años de edad,de estado civil casada,vive junto a su esposo, en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú, en una zona rural.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

María Teresa se dedica a las actividad de la cría y venta de animales menores,con 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio.Solicita préstamo para la compra de animales y alimento para estos, dicha inversión le servirá para poder atender con mayor numero de ventas.

María Teresa es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa, con 5 créditos anteriores,los cuales fueron cancelados de manera correcta. Desde que es María Teresa es socio de Edpyme Alternativa, su negocio a mejorado, así como su estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Maria Teresa is 72-years-old, has a civil marriage, and lives together with her husband in a rural zone of the district of Cayaltí, the province of Chiclayo, the department of Lambayeque, in the country of Peru. The residents of this town mostly earn a living in agriculture, commerce, and livestock.

Maria Teresa earns a living in the business of breeding and selling small animals. With 10 years of experience in the trade, her business is located in her own home. She is requesting this loan in order to buy animals and food for them. This aforementioned investment will help her be able to tend to a greater number of sales.

Maria Teresa is a recurring client in Edpyme Alternativa, with 5 previous loans which were paid off in the correct way. Since Maria Teresa has been a member of Edpyme Alternativa, her business has improved, just like her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy animals and food for them.

loans.name: Kelly Mariella

texts.es:
kelly Mariella con 38 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su esposo e hijos, en el distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque, en una zona rural.

kelly Mariella se dedica a la venta de comida, como papitas, tortitas, tamales y humitas; con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio, en la foto aparece en su cocina donde realiza sus labores de preparación de sus humitas, tamales, papitas y tortitas,su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Se solicita préstamo para arreglos de vivienda-mejora de infraestructura de cocina, dicha inversión le servirá para tener un mejor confort para realizar sus actividades diarias, con gran influencia en el negocio;Kelly Mariella piensa incrementar su productividad para poder atender las diversas gustos y necesidades de los habitantes de la zona.

Kelly Mariella socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Ha tenido dos créditos de 1500,00 y 1000,00 los cuales los ha cancelado de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Kelly Mairella, who is 38 years old, is in a free-union relationship. She lives with her husband and children in a rural zone of the district of Oyotún in the province of Chiclayo in the department of Lambayeque.

Kelly Mariella sells food such as potato chips, pancakes, tamales, and humitas [a steamed dish made with corn and cheese]. She has more than five years of experience in the business. In the photo, she is in her kitchen, where she does her work of preparing her humitas, tamales, potato chips, and pancakes. Her business is located in her own home.

She is applying for the loan in order to make repairs in her home and improve the infrastructure of the kitchen. This investment will serve her to have better comfort for doing her daily activities, with great influence on the business.

Kelly Mariella is thinking of increasing her productivity in order to be able to serve the various tastes and needs of the residents of the zone.

Kelly Mariella is a repeat member Edpyme Alternativa. She has had two loans of 1500 and 1000 PEN, which she has repaid in a punctual manner.

loans.use: to make repairs to her house to improve the infrastructure of the kitchen.

loans.name: Ma. Kressa

texts.en:
Ma. Kressa is a woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Kressa is 24 years old now.

Ma. Kressa has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell.

Ma. Kressa has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Teresa is 46 years old, and one of her children is in school.

Teresa has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Teresa has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Ana Teresa

texts.es: Ana es una emprendedora mujer de 50 años, habitante de un barrio en el municipio de Soledad y madre de cuatro hijos de 27, 25, 18 y 14 años, ella consideró que tenía oportunidad de generar ingresos para su hogar al comercializar carne de cerdo y no dudó en iniciar con su proyecto, sin embargo con el trascurrir del tiempo ella consideró que el pescado, las frutas y las verduras, le ofrecían un mejor margen de utilidad y decidió cambiar de productos.  Diariamente a partir de las 5 a.m. hasta las 4 p.m. sus clientes llegan hasta su punto de venta y le solicitan alimentos frescos para abastecer las demandas de la canasta familiar a buenos precios y excelente calidad. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en variedad de pescados, frutas y verduras al por mayor. Su meta a futuro es capitalizarse e incrementar sus ventas y con ello sus utilidades, y a nivel personal desea mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is an enterprising 50-year-old woman who lives in a neighborhood of the city of Soledad and is the mother of four children ages 27, 25, 18 and 14. She saw that she had the opportunity to generate earnings for her household by selling pork and she didn't hesitate to start her business. Over time, however, she learned that fish, fruit and vegetables offered her the best utility margin and she decided to change her products. From 5 a.m. to 4 p.m. each day, her customers come to where she sells and request fresh food to keep their families' homes stocked at good prices and with excellent quality.

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing she has gotten from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to invest in a variety of fish, fruit and vegetables wholesale. In the future her goal is capitalize on and increase her sales and thus her utility. On a personal level, she wants to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to invest in a variety of fish, fruit and vegetables wholesale

loans.name: Jesús Antonio

texts.es: Jesús es habitante del municipio de Soledad y en esta localidad emprendió su proyecto de negocio que con el transcurrir del tiempo ha logrado consolidar como uno de los sitios de comidas rápidas más visitados por sus moradores.  En el año 2008, Jesús inició su negocio con una campaña de promoción entre sus conocidos los cuales llegaron hasta su punto de venta a degustar sus exquisiteces y quedaron fidelizados a la gran variedad de comidas que ofrecía, con el paso del tiempo su demanda se incrementó y su capacidad ya no era suficiente, entonces tomó en alquiler el local en donde actualmente funciona su negocio, dando un paso firme a la prosperidad. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en materias primas e insumos y en la adquisición de un activo fijo que le permitirá ofrecer un servicio más ágil, y su promesa de servicio estará más ajustada a la realidad. Su meta a futuro es comprar un local comercial y continuar apoyando a su familia.
texts.en:
Jesús lives in the town of Soledad, where he learned how to run his business. Over time, it has become one of the most popular fast food outlets in the town. In 2008, Jesús set up his business with a promotion campaign among his acquaintances, who visited his sales outlet to try his delicious food. They became regular clients, enjoying the large variety of dishes he offered.

Over time, demand increased and he ran out of room. As a result, he decided to rent the premises he currently operates out of, taking a solid step towards prosperity.

He is currently applying for a loan from Kiva. This is the first funding he is applying for from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to invest in raw materials and inputs and to buy a fixed asset which will allow him to offer a more dynamic service, and his service promise will be more realistic.

His future goal is to buy a commercial premises and continue supporting his family.

loans.use: to invest in raw materials and inputs and to buy a fixed asset.

loans.name: Otoniel

texts.es: Otoniel es un microempresario residente de un municipio del Atlántico que inició su negocio en el año 2010 con la finalidad de incrementar sus ingresos en beneficio de su familia; él vive con su cónyuge y es padre de una hija de 24 años de edad.  Él fue motivado por un amigo que se dedica al comercio por intermedio de catálogos y al escuchar los múltiplex beneficios que recibía, consideró incorporarse a este mismo medio de comercialización.  Hoy en día ofrece a conocidos, vecinos y familiares una amplia línea de productos para el aseo del hogar y aseo personal muy conocidos por su respaldo y garantía, de este modo se facilita su labor de ventas, las cuales desarrolla todos los días a partir de las 8 a.m. hasta las 8 p.m.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en detergentes, desinfectantes, blanqueadores, jabones, shampoo entre otros productos de alta rotación los cuales adquirirá mediantes promociones que le permitirán incrementar sus ganancias. Su meta a futuro es ampliar su base de clientes y continuar con las adecuaciones a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Otoniel is a small businessman who lives in the Atlántico municipality. He started his business in the year 2010 in order to increase his earnings for his family's benefit. He lives with his wife, and he has a 24 year old daughter. A friend motivated him to work in commerce by catalogs. Upon hearing about the many benefits that he got, he considered entering into this type of commerce. He now sells an ample line of products for household cleaning and personal grooming to acquaintances, neighbors, and relatives. The products are well-known for their backing and guarantee. This facilitates his sales. He works every day from 8:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m.

He is now applying for a Kiva loan, his first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use the loan to buy detergents, disinfectants, bleach, soap, shampoo, and other products that have a high turnover. He will get them through sales that will allow him to increase his earnings.

His goal for the future is to increase his customer base and to continue fixing up his house.

loans.use: to buy detergents, disinfectants, bleach, soap, and shampoo, among other high turnover products.

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en:
Suleiman is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, he would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, he can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, he will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare.

Suleiman is thankful that he now has the opportunity to to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Tursunbubu

texts.ru: Турсунбубу, 60 лет, не замужем, есть 2 взрослых детей. Образование-среднее. Турсунбубу на пенсии, также занимается животноводством. Благодаря своей трепетной работе и ответственности, Турсунбубу на сегодняшний день имеет хорошее хозяйство: 4 коровы, 27 овец, 4 лошади. Ежемесячная прибыль ее семьи составляет около 22,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Турсунбубу обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Турсунбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Tursunbubu is 60 years old, unmarried, and has two grown-up children. She has a secondary education. Tursunbubu is retired, and she also rears animals. Thanks to her careful work and responsibility, today Tursunbubu has a good farm: four cows, 27 sheep, and four horses. Her family's monthly profit is about 22,000 som (KGS). In order to develop her farm further, Tursunbubu has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy some livestock. Tursunbubu plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in the further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy some livestock in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Reina Suyapa

texts.es: Reina, de 21 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara junto a su esposo e hijo donde desde hace ya 2 años dirige un negocio de venta de ropa de manera ambulante. Ella ofrece productos como ser: Camisas, Pantalones, Blusas y más. Ella ha solicitado un prestamo por la cantidad de 12,000.00 Lempiras para ampliar su inventario y tener mayores cantidades de producto para surtir su negocio de camisas, blusas y pantalones y atender a más clientes de la zona. Sus metas son hacer crecer aun más su negocio y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y mejorar  su situación económica actual.
texts.en:
Reina, 21 years old, lives in the Macuelizo, Santa Barbara municipality with her husband and son, where for 2 years she has run a business selling clothing as a traveling saleswoman. She offers products like shirts, pants, blouses, and more.

She has sought a loan of 12,000 lempiras to increase her inventory. [With this, she will] have more quantities of products to stock her business of shirts, blouses, and pants, and attend to more customers in the area.

Her goals are to make her business grow more, to give a better quality of life to her son, and to improve her current economic situation.

loans.use: to stock her business with clothing like shirts, blouses, and pants to sell.

loans.name: Salisu

texts.en:
Salisu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, he would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, he can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, he will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare.

Salisu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan con 48 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a sus cónyuge e hijos, vive en casa propia de material rústico, en el distrito de Santo Tomás, provincia de Cutervo, departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú.Cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura y ganadería.

Juan se dedica a la cría-engorde y posterior comercialización de ganado vacuno; cría en inverna propias ubicadas en caserío La Rinconada-sector velo de novia,se dedica a esta actividad hace 15 años.Sus animales luego de engordarlos los comercializa los domingos que es dia de plaza en el distrito de Santo Tomas de Cutervo, donde se reúnen criadores, compradores de todo el distrito y sus caseríos, donde oferta su ganado vacuno que posee. Adicionalmente cultiva café variedad catimor, así mismo productos de pan llevar (yuca,vituca, menestras y otros productos) y cría de animales menores, siendo esto para el consumo y en algunas ocasiones para la venta. Se solicita préstamo para la compra de ganado vacuno para engordarlo y luego de ello sacarlo ha la venta, con ello obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Juan es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa. No esta bancarizado.
texts.en:
Juan at 48 years old is in a common-law realtionship. He lives together with his spouse and children. They live in a house made of basic materials in the district of Santo Tomás, in the province of Cutervo, Cajamarca department of Peru. He has good personal references from the people who live in the area. The inhabitants of this area work mainly in agriculture and raising livestock. Juan works raising, fattening and later selling cattle. He raises them on his own pastures located in the village of La Rinconada, in the Velo de Novia area. He has worked in this activity for 15 years. After fattening his animals he sells them on Sundays in the plaza of the district of Santo Tomas de Cutervo. Producers and buyers from the entire district and it's villages gather here and he offers the cattle he has. Additionally he grows the Catimor variety of coffee and well as food products like yucca, taro, legumes and other products, and raises small animals. These are to eat and sometimes to sell.

He is requesting a loan to buy cattle to fatten and later sell them. Doing this he will obtain greater income and thus be able to improve his quality of living and that of his family. Juan is a partner of Edpyme Alternativa and is unbanked.

loans.use: to buy cattle to fatten and later sell them.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es:
Fidel con 35 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico, vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos de 6 y 4 años de edad, en el distrito de Aramango, provincia de Bagua, departamento de Amazonas, país Perú, en una zona rural. Fidel cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales como laborales por parte de los habitantes de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Fidel se dedica al cultivo de café, variedad catimor de 4 años de edad . El préstamo solicitado lo utilizará para invertir en el mantenimiento y compra de abonos para el cultivo. Esta inversión le permitirá obtener mayores ganancias de esta manera mejorar su condición económica y por ende obtener mejores condiciones de vida.

Fidel es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa sus ganancias van dirigidas mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Fidel at 35 years old lives in his own house build of basic materials. He lives together with his wife and his children aged 4 and 6 years old, in the district of Aramango, Bagua province, in the department of Amazonas, Peru. It is a rural area. Fidel has very good personal as well as work references from the people of the area. The inhabitants of this area work mainly in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock.

Fidel works growing coffee, 4 year old variety called Catimor. He will use the loan he is requesting to buy manure and invest in the maintenance of his crops. This investment will allow him to obtain better income and in this way improve his economic situation and in the end have better living conditions.

Fidel is a new member of Edpyme Alternativa. His profits will go to improve his quality of living.

loans.use: to buy manure and invest in the maintenance of his crops.

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.en:
Aquilina is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Aquilina is 67 years old and has one child in school.

Aquilina has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Aquilina has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Dalida

texts.en:
Dalida is a 29-year-old married mother of two. She opened a gift shop four years ago to help her husband cover the needs and expenses of their children. She is a hard worker who is well known around her region, and she has loyal customers.

Due to her low income, which prevents her from covering any additional expenses, today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her children's school tuition fees. She believes that education is the only guarantee for her children's future.

Dalida hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Las Valientes De Santa Clara Group

texts.es: 5 Personas  responsables de distintas actividades comerciales  todos ellos residen en el distrito de Vitarte. Así son los integrantes del grupo comunal  “LAS VALIENTES DE SANTA CLARA” uno de ellos es la Sra. Marianela    de 34 años de edad soltera  y con 2 hijos menores de edad. La Sra. Marianela se dedica ya más de  2  años al negocio de ventas de zapatos y zapatillas en su propio domicilio todos los días. La Sra. Marianela  nos cuenta que ha llegado a fidelizar a sus clientes lo cual le ha generado ingresos  para cubrir los gastos de su casa.  En el futuro le gustaría poder vender más productos de calzado de distintos modelos  y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar más mercadería (zapatos y zapatillas) y poder generar más ganancias. La Sra. Marianela es la que se encuentra segunda del lado derecho con un polo de color negro. A la vez se despide con un abraso a Kiva y  diciéndoles que cumplirá todas su metas propuestas.
texts.en:
The communal group "Las Valientes de Santa Clara" has five members responsible for a variety of businesses. All of the members reside in the district of Vitarte. One of them is Marianela, who is 34 years old and single and has two underage children. For more than two years, Marianela has made a living with a business selling shoes and slippers in her own home every day. Marianela tells us that she now has loyal customers, which has generated earnings for her to cover her household expenses. In the future she would like to be able to sell more footwear products of different models and to obtain better earnings. 

She will invest the loan granted in buying more merchandise (shoes and slippers) and generating more earnings. Marianela is second from the right with a black shirt. She says goodbye with a hug to Kiva, telling them that she will achieve all of her proposed goals.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (shoes and slippers)

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente de 26 años de edad se dedica a trabajar en su propia tierra cultivando maíz y frijol, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, gracias a su trabajo es como ha podido salir adelante con su familia, el quiere seguir mejorando la otra parte de su casa ya que con lo que obtuvo del primer credito pudo mejorar una parte, hoy nuevamente esta solicitando otro credito para la compra de todos los materiales de construccion necesarios y asi poder terminar de arreglar toda su casa y poder vivir mas comodos y seguros.
texts.en:
The 26-year-old borrower makes a living working his land, growing corn and beans. With his earnings, he is able to pay his household expenses. He lives in his own home with his wife and his two children. His work has enabled him to support his family.

The borrower wants to continue making improvements to the other part of his home. He was able to improve part of his house with his first loan. Now, he is requesting another loan to buy all the building materials he needs so that he can finish fixing up him home and live more comfortably and securely.

loans.use: to buy all the building materials he needs.

loans.name: Shakeel

texts.en:
Shakeel, aged 41, lives in Karachi. He has a rickshaw show room where he sells rickshaws. He recently opened a motorbike show room as well, for which he needs additional investment. That is why he has applied for a second loan from BRAC Pakistan, a Kiva field partner.

He is married and has seven children, all going to school. Shakeel's hard work has made it possible for him to expand his business. But since he has to bear all expenses for the family and is the sole bread winner financing this new venture, it is a challenge. He is therefore happy to find this source of funding.

This is Shakeel's second loan. He first applied for a loan when he just had a rickshaw show room, and now he is applying for his second loan. His business has been doing well and his revenues have been increasing. He has made himself a good reputation in the market and his clients are satisfied with his dealings.

Shakeel's main aim is to educate his children and give them a bright future.

loans.use: to establish his motor bike show room.

loans.name: Obelina

texts.en:
Obelina has been involved in activities since 2015. She started her business with her own working capital of $300.00.

Obelina has a small kiosk. She is requesting a loan of $600.00 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants use it to buy additional supplies according to what people like to buy, including shampoo, soap, lighters, noodles, biscuits, sugar, slippers, cigarettes, candles, sardines, and other things to sell.

She is happy with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she can build her business very big in the future and her income can be increased.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, soap, lighters, noodles, biscuits, sugar, slippers, cigarettes, candles, sardines, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Emma Julieta

texts.es: Emma de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica al cultivo de granos basicos desde hace 5 años y gracias a su trabajo es como ha podido salir adelante con su familia, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda encementando el piso pero con lo que obtiene de su trabjo no le alcanza para realizarlo por esa razon esta solicitando a integral un credito para la compra de los materiales de contruccion necesarios para tener una vivienda digna para ella y su famlia.
texts.en:
Emma is 45 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and her child. She has made a living growing basic grains for the past five years, which has allowed her to support her family.

Emma wants to improve her home by laying cement on the floor, but she does not earn enough money to do this. That is why she is requesting a loan from Integral to buy the building materials she needs, so that she and her family have decent housing.

loans.use: to buy the building materials she needs.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 56-year-old woman who lives a simple life with her family in a town of Carles in Iloilo, Philippines. Her husband is a farmer while Josephine is running a sari-sari (general store) business.

Josephine and her husband work hard to raise their big family. They have 10 children: six adults and four school-aged children. She is asking for a loan to buy commodities to sell such as spices, eggs, cooking oil, noodles, canned goods, chips, biscuits, bread, candies, toiletries, salt, sugar, powdered milk and chocolate drink.

In the future, Josephine wants to uplift her family's livelihood to have enough money to send her children to school so they could have better lives in the future.

loans.use: to buy spices, eggs, cooking oil, noodles, canned goods, chips, biscuits, bread, candies, toiletries, salt, sugar, powdered milk and chocolate drink.

loans.name: Melitona

texts.en:
Melitona is a 51-year-old woman from San Miguel, Bohol. With limited options in her area, Melitona finds selling goods to be helpful for her family. Her husband is a farmer and also works as a carpenter. She also supports two adult children who are still studying.

Melitona has run a sari-sari, or general store, in the community for many years. She sells items such as sugar, coffee, condiments, noodles, toiletries and canned goods.

She is asking a loan to buy stock of canned sardines, beef loaf, shampoo, bath soap, milk, coffee, sugar, matches, biscuits and liquor. Her goal is successfully send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy stock of canned sardines, beef loaf, shampoo, bath soap, milk, coffee, sugar, matches,  biscuits and liquor.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela is 59 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Manuela runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like delicacies and other groceries.

Manuela has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, Manuela would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like delicacies and other groceries.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 48 years old and has four children who are in school.

Marieta has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Marieta has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Melvin Yanira

texts.es: Melvin Yanira vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia donde vende una variedad de productos huevos, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, café, sopas, etc. a buen precio, tiene 5 años de tener el negocio el cual inicio con capital propio, con el credito que solicito anteriormente pudo comprar mas mercaderia y vitrinas y asi ha aumentado sus ganancias y ha podido salir adelante con su familia, ella está solicitando otra vez otro crédito para la compra de mas mercaderia todo por mayor ya que le va muy bien en sus ventas y obtiene buenas ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad de vida.
texts.en:
Melvin Yanira lives in her own home with her husband and her three children. She has a store in her home, in which she sells a variety of products including eggs, beans, oil, sugar, coffee, soup and other items at reasonable prices. She has had the business, which she set up with her own capital, for five years.

She used her previous loan to buy more merchandise and display cases. She was able to increase her profits and move forward with her family.

She is requesting another loan to buy more wholesale merchandise, as things are going very well and she makes a good income, allowing her to give her family more stable lives.

loans.use: to buy wholesale eggs, beans, oil, sugar, coffee, soup and other items.

loans.name: Adan Alberto

texts.es: Adan vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el se dedica a la agricultura al cultivo de maiz y maicillo desde hace 2 años, gracias a su trabajo es como el ha podido salir adelante con su familia, el quiere seguir con su trabajo de agricultor pero necesita los insumos agricolas necesarios y como no posee de suficiente capital esta solicitando un credito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, etc. y asi poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
Adan lives in a house that he owns with his wife and daughter. He has been making a living growing corn and sorghum for two years. Thanks to this work, he has been able to move forward with his family.

Adan wants to continue with his work as a farmer but needs supplies. As he does not have enough capital to buy these supplies, he is applying for a loan in order to buy seeds, fertilisers, manure and more. He can thus continue with his work, which provides him with a good income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilisers, manure and more.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a married woman who lives in Carles, Iloilo. She is 45 years old and is the mother of three children. Her oldest child is 22 years old while her youngest child is 14 years old.

Gina and her husband earn a living through their fishing business. They have been doing this for 23 years since they started their married life. It is a business that helps them sustain their expenses every day, to pay for school fees, bills and daily consumption.

They wanted to enhance their catch and become more profitable so that they could have enough money to send their children to college. Hence, Gina is asking for a bigger loan amount to help them buy a fishing net.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net.

loans.name: Marc Anthony

texts.en:
Marc Anthony successfully started his own business early this year. He owns a sari-sari (general store) where he sells basic commodities such as coffee, powdered milk, chocolate drink, chips, biscuits, candies, toiletries, laundry soap, eggs, cooking oil, noodles, drinks and canned goods . He also buys and sells frozen goods such as hot dogs, ham, and sweetened meat.

Marc Anthony is asking for a loan to help him buy frozen products and assorted commodities, Marc Anthony is a 29-year-old father of a 5-year-old daughter and he wants her to succeed in life. He wants to be able to give his family a good life.

loans.use: to buy coffee, powdered milk, chocolate drink, chips, biscuits, candies, toiletries, laundry soap, eggs, cooking oil, noodles, drinks, hot dogs, ham, and sweetened meat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in buying products and make home improvements.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
At her young age, Divina married early. She is 24 years old and a mother of three children. Her oldest child is seven years old, and her youngest child is seven months old. Her husband works as a time keeper for a private company, while Divina is engaged in raising pigs. They are also engaged in a farming business. 

She is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets and feed. She dreams for business improvement in the future to enhance their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Huda

texts.en:
Huda lives in Aqaba with her husband and her two children. She is a hairdresser and ‎make-up artist and she operates her beauty salon in her home. She likes her profession as a ‎hairdresser and make-up artist and works hard to satisfy her customers.
‎
Huda asks for this loan to purchase equipment for providing cosmetics services to ‎her clients which will improve and expand her business, Huda wants to be a productive woman and ‎help her husband with the household expenses. ‎

loans.use: to purchase equipment for providing cosmetics services to ‎her clients.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 54 years old and has four children who are in school.

Aida has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Aida has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Elda Suyapa

texts.es:
La Joven Elda Suyapa de 25  años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus  hijos  en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 05 años al negocio de venta de rosquillas, quesadillas, pan y tortillas, radica vive en Pespire al sur de Honduras, sus clientes son todos sus vecinos amistades y personas de pespire y otros lugares  vecinos,  ella es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos como maíz, manteca, y Leña, con el apoyo de este crédito ella pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente   con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela  y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia. 

San Lorenzo Honduras-  Septiembre  2015.
texts.en:
Elda Suyapa is 25 years old and lives with her husband and children in a house owned by the family. For five years, Elda has had a business selling doughnut-like pastries, quesadillas, bread and tortillas. She lives in Pespire, in the south of Honduras. Elda's customers are neighbours and others from Pespire and neighbouring areas. Elda is an enterprising woman with a desire to move forward and work hard every day in order to improve her quality of life.

Elda is applying for this loan in order to buy products such as corn, butter and firewood. With the support of this loan, Elda plans to increase her income and improve her quality of life. Elda is a borrower who wants to work with Prisma Honduras.

Elda's dream is to have a good business, increase her customer base and, at the same time, improve her and her family's lives.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, September 2015

loans.use: to sell bread, doughnut-like pastries and quesadilla.

loans.name: Niva

texts.en:
Niva and her husband earn a living by fishing. They have been doing this for 20 years. They have three children, ages 16, 19 and 21.

Niva and her husband work hard to provide for the needs of their family and to give their children a good education.

Niva is asking for a loan to buy a new fishing net and materials for boat repair such as plywood and bamboo for “katig” (the tagalog word for the floats attached to the outriggers).

Niva wants to succeed in the future so her family could have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing net and materials for boat repair such as plywood and bamboo.

loans.name: Bunyonyi Ageteraine Group

texts.en:
Moureen is a member of Bunyonyi Ageteraine Group, where members guarantee each other. She is a 29-year-old lady with 3 children living in Fort Portal Uganda. She operates a pharmacy business selling human drugs, where she works 8 hours a day. 

She started this business with a hope of becoming self reliant and for family sustainability. Moureen faces the challenge of few customers, who also get services on credit since she is based in a rural area. 

However, she has hopes of transforming into a model clinic in the future. She has asked for a loan to buy more human medicine to sell.

loans.use: to buy more human medicine to sell

loans.name: Gulzara

texts.ru: Гулзара успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. На сегодня в хозяйстве Гулзары есть 4 коровы, 8 овец, на 1,80 Га земли выращивает дыню, морковь, капусту. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет 16,000 сом (KGS). Гулзара обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров с телятами. Доходы от кредита она и дальше будет вкладывать в развитие бизнеса, также хочет накопить на покупку автомобиля.
texts.en: Gulzara successfully repaid her loan, having used it for its intended purpose. She is grateful to the Kiva fund and to everyone who helped her with financing. Today Gulzara has four cows and eight sheep, and she grows melons, carrots, and cabbage on 1.8 hectares of land. Her monthly profit is 16,000 som (KGS). Gulzara has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) to buy two cows with calves. She is going to keep investing the proceeds of the loan in the development of the business, and she also wants to save up to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase two cows with calves in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Vilma Marilu

texts.es: La señora Vilma tiene 32 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos (de 9 y 4 años), El mayor va a la escuela y el menor al jardin. Al igual que su esposo, es una agricultora entusiasta que quiere invertir en el cultivo de la tara por ser rentable y generar ingresos para su familia. Dentro de sus sueños está contribuir a dar una buena educación  a sus hijos y hacerlos profesionales. Con 10 años en el negocio de la tara, necesita el préstamo para comprar abono orgánico para incrementar la producción y generar mayores ganancias para su familia.
texts.en:
Vilma is 32 years old, married and has two children, ages nine and four years old. The eldest child attends school while the youngest is in nursery

Vilma and her husband are both enthusiastic farmers who want to invest in their tare crops so that they are profitable and generate an income for the family.

One of VIlma's dreams is to give her children a good education and see them become professionals.

With ten years' experience with the tare business, Vilma needs this loan in order to buy organic manure to increase production and earn higher profits for her family.

loans.use: to buy organic manure to increase tare production.

loans.name: Nartazhi

texts.ru: Нартажи, 62 года, замужем, мать 4 детей. У нее среднее образование, на пенсии. Бизнесом занимается уже 30 лет. Начала Нартажи свой бизнес с 10,000 сом (KGS). В данный момент продолжает заниматься животноводством, у нее есть 2 коровы. Ежемесячный доход Нартажи составляет до 23,000 сом (KGS). По характеру Нартажи очень ответственная и доброжелательная. Она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) для приобретения 2 нетелей для увеличения поголовья скота. В будущем Нартажи собирается и дальше вкладывать в развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Nartazhi is 62 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She has a secondary education and she is retired. She has been running a business for 30 years. Nartazhi started her business with 10,000 som (KGS). At the present time she continues to rear animals: she has two cows. Nartazhi's monthly income is up to 23,000 som (KGS). Nartazhi is very responsible and considerate by her nature. She has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy two heifers to increase the size of her herd. In the future Nartazhi will continue investing in the development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase two heifers in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Seeta

texts.en:
Seetah is a 43-year-old married wife and mother. She has been selling ‎cosmetics made from Dead Sea mud. She wants to improve ‎her family's living standard and to help her husband with the household expenses.

Seetah is acquiring a loan to purchase special cosmetics to increase ‎her income.
She hopes that in the future, she can move her business outside her ‎house and attract more customers.‎

loans.use: to purchase special cosmetics to increase ‎her income.

loans.name: Dufashanye Group

texts.en:
Cansilde is 41 years old and married with six children. She owns a sorghum business. Cansilde is a leader of this group, which is called Dufashanye in the local language; the name means "helping each other" in English. In the photo, she has money in her hands. This is her seventh year in this business, and she works from 6:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. daily.

Cansilde has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase a large quantity of sorghum for sale. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future, pay school fees for her children, reinvest in her business and buy her own business' building.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Don Francisco de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el posee una sastreria ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 7 años tiene muchos clientes por su buen trabajo, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos de los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Don Francisco esta solicitando un credito para la compra de hilos, agujas, variedad de tela, botones, elásticos, etc. y así poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Francisco is 57 years old and lives in a house that he owns with his wife and son. Francisco has had a tailoring workshop in his home for seven years. He has many clients as a result of his good work. With profits from his business he is able to cover some household costs.

Francisco is applying for this loan in order to buy needles, threads and variety of buttons, elastics and material, and other items. He can thus continue with his work, which provides him with good profits.

loans.use: to buy needles, threads and variety of buttons, elastics and material, and other items.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es: Doña candelaria de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, ella se dedica a la venta de mariscos desde hace 10 años y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda terminando de contruir el baño y lavadero pero con lo que obtiene de sus ventas no le alcanza para realizarlo por esa razon esta solicitando nuevamente un credito pero esta vez para la compra de materiales de contruccion y asi poder mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Candelaria is 56 years old and lives in her own house with her daughter.

Candelaria has made a living selling seafood for ten years and, with profits, is able to cover some household costs.

Candelaria wants to improve her home by finishing building the bathroom and washroom. However, income from her business is not enough to carry out this work. Candelaria is therefore applying for another loan in order to buy building materials and thus improve her home.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Seily Raquel

texts.es:
La joven  Seila Raquel de 26  años de edad es casada y  vive con su esposo y su hijo en su casa rentada en pespire,  se dedica desde hace 05 años a la venta de verduras y frutas como, tomates, cebollas, repollos, papas, pepinos, zanahorias, plátanos, patastes, lechugas, brócolis,  manzanas, bananos, y otros mas, sus clientes son todas las personas que transitan por la zona, y también personas de las comunidades que tienen sus negocios, sus clientes la prefieren por su buena atención y sus buenos producto.
Vive en la ciudad de Choluteca  es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de superarse y  de trabajar con Prisma.
Esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de más producto ya que se acerca la temporada buena  en su comunidad y desea surtir aún más su negocio,  con este crédito ella pretende mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.

Su sueño es  crecer con su negocio para mejorar su calidad de vida y construir una casa propia en pespire

San Lorenzo valle, Honduras  Septiembre  2015.
texts.en:
Seila Raquel is 26 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and son is a rented home in Pespire. For five years Seila has made a living selling fruits and vegetables, such as tomatoes, onions, cabbage, potatoes, cucumbers, carrots, plantains, lettuce, broccoli, apples, bananas and more. Seila's customers are passers-by and other local traders. Customers come to Seila because of the good service and good products.

Seila lives in the city of Choluteca. She is enterprising and wants to get ahead and work with Prisma Honduras.

Seila is applying for a loan in order to buy more goods as the high season is approaching in her local community and wants to stock up her business further. Seila plans to use this loan to increase her income and improve her quality of life.

Seila's dream is to expand her business in order to improve her quality of life and build her own house in Pespire.

San Lorenzo valley, Honduras, September 2015

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Telescora

texts.en:
Telescora is a resident of Bien Unido, Bohol. People in her area live a simple life. Some are into farming, hog raising and fishing. Telescora on the other hand operates a sari-sari store to cater to their needs.

Since most of the people in her community work hard doing physical labor, they always frequent her store to relax in the afternoon. She is asking for a loan to buy soft drinks and liquor. Most men find drinking liquor to be their time to bond with friends after a long day's work, and they mention that it gives them a good night sleep. For this reason, Telescora needs more stocks of liquor and soft drinks.

Telescora hopes to increase her income so she can send her child, who is 16 years old, to school.

loans.use: to  buy liquor and soft drinks

loans.name: Blezel

texts.en:
Blezel is a live-in woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Blezel is 28 years old, and her two children are in school.

Blezel has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Blezel requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell.

Blezel has been in this business for six years. In the future, Blezel would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 65 years old and married with five children. Concepcion works very hard to provide for them.

Concepcion runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries.

Concepcion has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Concepcion would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 67 years old and has seven children. Conchita is a married woman.

Conchita is in the agricultural business of pig raising in the Philippines. Conchita requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Conchita has been pig raising for 3 years now and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Conchita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 53 years old and married with seven children.

Elisa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

Elisa has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Elisa aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Heide

texts.en:
Heide is a single woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Heide is 25 years old and her child is in school.

Heide has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Heide requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell.

Heide has been in this business for one year. In the future, Heide would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is a widowed woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Arsenia is 62 years old now.

Arsenia has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Arsenia requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as sugar, fruits, etc.

Arsenia has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, Arsenia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as sugar, fruits, etc.

loans.name: Bebiana

texts.en:
Bebiana is 65 years old and married. Bebiana works very hard to provide for them.

Bebiana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal product care, and other groceries.

Bebiana has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Bebiana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Gulumzhan

texts.ru: Гулумжан, 39 лет, замужем, есть 3 детей школьного возраста, они с радостью помогают родителям по хозяйству. У Гулумжан среднее образование, работает уборщицей в детском саду. В 1995 году она стала заниматься животноводством, накопив на старт сумму в 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Гулумжан, на сегодняшний день у нее есть корова и лошадь. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулумжан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 бычков для откорма и реализации. Она планирует расширить свой бизнес и накопить средства на постройку дома и сарая.
texts.en: Gulumzhan is 39 years old, married, and has three school-age children. They happily help their parents on the farm. Gulumzhan has a secondary education and works as a cleaner in a kindergarten. She began rearing animals in 1995, having saved up to start a sum of 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Gulumzhan's hard work, today she has a cow and a horse. In order to develop her business further, Gulumzhan has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy two steers for fattening and resale. She plans to expand her business and save up to build a house and barn.

loans.use: to purchase two steers for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 44 years old and single with one child. Elizabeth works very hard to provide for her child.

Elizabeth runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like cigarettes, junk food, beverages, etc.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like cigarettes, junk food, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 22 years old and lives with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Gina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like noodles, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Gina has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Gina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like noodles, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Gamuchira Group

texts.en:
Some call Roselia a carpenter, some call her an electrician, and some simply call her a recycler. This is due to the fact that she works on abandoned or no longer wanted household furniture, and then resells them to those who cannot afford brand new furniture.

Roselia is a 41-year-old entrepreneur, married and has three children. She resides in a nicely built, high density location of Kuwadzana Extension in the capital of Zimbabwe, Harare. She is a member of Gamuchira Group, which consists of four members who have acquired various skills over the past years and are using such skills to fend for their families.

Roselia specializes on buying old furniture such as sofas, wooden dividers, beds, wooden kitchen units, stoves, wooden coffee tables, deep freezers, and upright fridges. She then thoroughly works on them, making necessary repairs and even making changes to the extent that the repaired furniture will have a brand new look. She restocks the old furniture in her place of residence from the various residents in that area who want to change their old furniture. She testifies that the suppliers of old furniture have grown beyond her current capacity, and she is ready to expand her operations if the problem of capital constraint can be dealt with. In fact, she has become so popular that anyone who wants to replace his/her household furniture will contact her first.

She usually hires an electrician to repair furniture like fridges, electrical irons and television sets. She specifies that she is able to hold a hammer and nail in a right manner, making repairs to all wooden furniture in order to reduce costs; however, when pressure mounts she hires a carpenter who helps her out. She sells her repaired furniture at auctions on farms surrounding Harare. Her products move quickly because they will be priced lower, hence have greater affordability to those who don’t earn much. Currently, she requires a loan of $400 (as part of her group's loan) in order to expand her current operations and meet her ever-increasing clientele demands.

loans.use: To buy more old furniture for refurbishment.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is a determined woman. She is a 37-year-old and lives in the city of Baybay, Leyte. She is a mother of three young children, ages 12, 7, and 6. Teofila raised them alone by buying and selling RTW (ready-to-wear) apparel, beauty products, personal and home care products, and cosmetics. In addition to this, she also sells food in the community.

She is asking for a loan to buy products mentioned earlier and to buy food ingredients such as flour, sugar, and cooking oil. Teofila works hard to provide a good life for her children. Thus, she wants to improve her business in the future to have enough money to sustain each day for her family.

loans.use: to buy beauty products, personal and home care products, cosmetics, and apparel, as well as ingredients for cooking.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna and her husband own a “multicab” (a kind of custom-made vehicle that can accommodate up to 20 passengers) that is used for transportation in most areas here in the Philippines. They have been operating this kind of business for almost four years to earn a living. Lorna is a 45-year-old woman and has four adult children. She wants to own another “multicab” in the future to be able to augment their income. That is the reason why she is asking for a loan. She wants to franchise another type of “multicab”. With our help, she may be able to reach her goal through the money we entrust to her.

loans.use: to buy a multicab.

loans.name: Anna Liza

texts.en:
Anna Liza is a 43-year-old woman. She is married and lives in Concepcion, Iloilo. Her husband is a fisherman, while Anna Liza is running a sari-sari store (general store) business. She has been doing this for 15 years to earn a living.

Anna Liza is asking for a loan to buy additional commodities such as drinks, a sack of rice, flour, spices, canned goods, noodles, candy, chips and biscuits. She will also buy frozen goods, such as hot dogs, ham and sweetened meat to sell.

She is pursuing other business opportunities to enhance their earnings as well. In the future, Anna Liza wants to uplift their livelihood to sustainability.

loans.use: to buy drinks, a sack of rice, flour, spices, canned goods, noodles, candy, chips and biscuits, as well as frozen goods such as hot dogs, ham and sweetened meat.

loans.name: Brigido

texts.en:
Brigido is 60 years old and married. He has a sari-sari store located in Bien Unido, Bohol. He sells items like salt, seasonings, canned food, biscuits, chips, candy, eggs, noodles, shampoo, toothpaste, and milk. He requested this loan to buy more items to sell such as school supplies, canned sardines, beef loaf, shampoo, bath soap, milk, coffee, sugar, matches, biscuits and liquor.

Brigido is excited to make improvements in his inventory to attract more customers. His income will provide him and his wife healthy meals and will cover the monthly expenses on their household.

loans.use: to  buy school supplies, canned sardines,  beef loaf, shampoo, bath soap, milk, coffee, sugar, matches, biscuits and liquor.

loans.name: Basma's Group

texts.en:
Basma, who is 46 years old, lives beside her friend, Khawla, who is 37 years old. They are married ‎and have children.‎
