Their lovely friendship helps them to start their own business and ‎improve their life. They want to provide a good education to their ‎children and to improve their standards of living. They are raising livestock and always pay careful attention to caring ‎for them and to the food they give them.‎
‎
Basma and Khawla are requesting this microloan so that they can ‎buy more sheep to increase their products and hope to be able to sell ‎the sheep's milk. In the future, they hope to be able to improve their houses so ‎that they can live comfortably with their families.‎

loans.use: To ‎buy more sheep to increase their products

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 54 years old and has six children.  She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Emma requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy animal feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Emma has been raising pigs for one year now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF.

In the future, Emma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Evangeline is 42 years old and has one child in school.

Evangeline has a fishing business in the Philippines. Evangeline requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy nets and other fishing supplies.

Evangeline has been in this business for ten years. 

In the future, Evangeline would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy nets and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 45 years old, single, and has four children, two of whom are in school. Gina works very hard to provide for them.

Gina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, personal care products, and other groceries.

Gina has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, personal care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Suha

texts.en:
Suha is a 28-year-old, single women living in Tulkarem, Palestine. She lives with her parents, and she has a little farm in front of the house.

Suha has been raising rabbits in her farm for nearly one year. She says that lately the main challenges she faces are the weather conditions and the lack of liquidity.

Suha has requested this loan to buy some rabbits in order to raise them and the sell them. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business capital and that she will invest in her business by expanding it which will contribute to improving her family's standards of living.

Suha plans to improve and expand her business by adding new animal types to her little farm in the future.

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy some rabbits to raise on her farm and then sell them to make some profit.

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is a 48-year-old woman. She is married and has a two lovely ‎children. Sahar works hard every day in order to secure a good future ‎for her family and help her husband with the household expenses. She ‎makes a living by selling clothes in her home.
‎
Sahar feels that she does not have enough products to sell. Therefore, ‎she applied for loan which will allow her to get more products to sell ‎and increase her income.‎

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Huda

texts.en:
Huda, age 56, is single mother of five children. Her husband ‎has been dead for 10 years. Many years ago, Huda used to sell clothes. Once she got good experience, she started sewing dresses ‎and clothes. Huda is running her business alone.
‎
The loan that she is requesting is to buy fabrics and yarns to be able ‎to sew more dresses and clothes to sell and increase her income.

Huda dreams of having a large place to sell clothes, a sewing shop, and being able to buy a vehicle to use for her business. She also ‎wishes to be able to build a big house for her children.‎

loans.use: To buy fabrics and yarns to be able ‎to sew more dresses and clothes to sell

loans.name: Los Pensamientos Group

texts.es: Este grupo está emprendiendo su segundo ciclo. Este es el segundo crédito que la Sra. Sara tiene con el grupo “Los Pensamientos”. La Sra. Sara tiene 53 años separada y con un hijo que aún esta estudiando en el nivel secundaria. Sara se dedica hace tres años a la venta de abarrotes en un pequeño local en su propia vivienda. Con el fruto de su esfuerzo Sara solventa los gastos de su hogar y la educación de su hijo. El mayor anhelo de Sara es ampliar su negocio. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en la  compra de más mercadería de abarrotes de primera necesidad (arroz,azúcar,leche y aceite) para sus ventas diarias. Sara viste falda de color blanco y una blusa color rosado. Sara agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por confiar en ella.
texts.en:
This group is starting its second loan cycle.

This will be the second loan that Sara takes out through the "Los Pensamientos" loan group. Sara is 53 years old. She is separated and has one son who attends secondary school.

For three years Sara has made a living selling groceries from small premises in her own home. With the fruits of her labour she is able to cover household costs and to pay for her son's up-bringing.

Sara's biggest wish is to expand her business.

Sara will use this loan to buy groceries and staple goods (rice, sugar, milk and oil) for everyday sales.

In the photo, Sara is wearing a white skirt and pink blouse. Sara is grateful to Kiva lenders for trusting in her.

loans.use: to buy groceries and staple goods (rice, sugar, milk and oil).

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is 43 years old and has four children. She is married and has four children who are in school.

Florita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Florita requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy animal feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Florita has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF.

In the future, Florita would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy animal feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Mauricio David

texts.es:
Mauricio David con 21 años de edad, de estado civil soltero,vive en casa familiar, junto a su madre,en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, departamento de Cajamarca, país Perú.Mauricio David cuenta con buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Mauricio David se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público en la localidad de Pucará y caseríos aledaños, cuenta con una mototaxi propia con la cual brinda dicho servicio.Mauricio David cuenta con más de 2 años de experiencia en el rubro.Se solicita préstamo para invertir en arreglos,mantenimiento de su unidad móvil y para compra de accesorios de hogar.

Mauricio David es socio recurrente para nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa. Firma con aval.
texts.en:
Mauricio David is 21 years old. He is single and lives in his family home, together with his mother, in the town of Pucará, in the province of Jaén, in the state of Cajamarca in Perú. Mauricio David has good personal and work references from the residents in this area. The residents in this community mostly work in agriculture, commerce and livestock farming.

Mauricio David works providing public transportation services in the town of Pucará and adjacent hamlets. He has his own mototaxi with which he provides the aforementioned services. Mauricio David has more than two years of experience performing this work. He is seeking a loan to invest in repairs to maintain his vehicle and to purchase accessories for his home.

Mauricio David is an recurring member of our institution, Edpyme Alternativa, which has a firm guarantee.

loans.use: to invest in repairs to maintain his vehicle and to purchase accessories for his home.

loans.name: Atilano

texts.es:
Atilano con 29 años de edad,de estado civil casado, vive junto a su esposa e hijos, en el distrito de Callayuc, provincia de Cutervo, provincia de Cajamarca,país Perú. Atilano cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.

Atilano se dedica al servicio de talado de madera con motosierra, desde hace 08 años. solicita préstamo para invertir en lograr mejoras en sus herramientas de trabajo así como en el amoblamiento de su casa.

Atilano es socio recurrente en nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa. Ha manejado dos créditos los cuáles los a cancelado de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Atilano is 29 years old. He is married and he lives with his wife and children in the town of Callayuc, in the province of Cutervo, in the state of Cajamarca in Perú. Atilano has very good personal and work references from the residents in this area.

Atilano has worked providing the service of cutting down trees with a chainsaw for 8 years. He is seeking a loan to invest in improving his work tools as well as the furnishings in his home.

Atilano is a recurring member of our institution, Edpyme Alternativa. He has managed two loans which he repaid on time.

loans.use: to invest in improving his work tools as well as his furnishings in his home.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 33 years old and married with two children. With two children in school, Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, home care products and other groceries. Jocelyn has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods,  snack foods, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a married woman with three children. She is 53 years old and has one of her children is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Juliet has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years. Juliet requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell.

In the future, Juliet would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a married woman with five children. She is 37 years old and four of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Lilibeth has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy abaca fiber to use in her business.

In the future, Lilibeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber to use in her business

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 28 years old and married with three children.

Lorna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like coffee, sugar, home care products and other groceries.

Lorna has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Lorna aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like coffee, sugar, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a 45-year-old woman and runs a sari-sari store business. She has been doing this for 10 years to earn a living and to help her husband provide for the needs of their family. Her husband works hard as a fisherman.

Aside from running a sari-sari store she is also engaged in buri weaving (the largest palm in the Philippines). Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy grocery items such as coffee, sugar, powdered milk, powdered chocolate drink, chips, candies, biscuits, spices, canned goods, noodles and drinks. She will also buy buri leaves used in weaving.

In the future, Alma wants to improve her business to enhance their livelihood and have better lives.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, powdered milk, powdered chocolate drink, chips, candies, biscuits, spices, canned goods, noodles drinks and buri leaves (palm leaves).

loans.name: Roxana Jackeline

texts.es: Roxana de 33 años de edad, tiene 30 años de residir en vivienda propia, dentro de la cual vive al lado de su hijo de 13 años, su hija 15 años y su madre. Ella es una persona que se esfuerza día a día en su negocio de venta de productos de belleza, joyería y ropa, el cual tiene 8 años de administrar y es el que le permite sostener la economía del hogar, y cubrir con esto las necesidades básicas de su familia. Debido al tiempo que tiene de administrar el negocio ha crecido la cantidad de clientes, y con ello la demanda de los productos, es por esto que Roxana necesita invertir en el negocio, pero no cuenta con la liquidez económica necesaria y decide solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: blusas, pantalones, aretes, anillos, mascarillas, maquillaje, desodorantes, cremas, etc. para aumentar los productos de su negocio, aumentar las ventas y así también las ganancias.
texts.en:
Roxana is 33 years old. She has spent 30 years living in her own home where she lives at the side of her 13 year old son, her 15 year old daughter and her mother. Roxana is a person who works hard everyday on her business selling beauty products, jewelry and clothing. She has administered the business for 8 years and it is the means that allow her to maintain her household economy and cover the basic needs of her family.

Because of the amount of time that she has spent administering the business her quantity of clients has grown, as has the demand for the products. It is because of this that Roxana needed to invest in the business, but she didn't have the necessary economic liquidity, so she decided to seek a FUSAI loan to invest in: blouses, pants, earrings, rings, masks, makeup, deodorants, creams, etc. to increase the products in her business and to grow the sales and the earnings as well.

loans.use: to invest in: blouses, pants, earrings, rings, masks, makeup, deodorants, etc. for her business selling jewelry, beauty products and clothing.

loans.name: Manolita

texts.en:
Manolita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Manolita is 53 years old and has one child in school.

Manolita has a buy-and-sell beverages business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of beverages to sell.

Manolita has been in this business for one year. In the future, Manolita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of beverages to sell.

loans.name: Preciosa

texts.en:
Preciosa is 49 years old and single with seven children. With three children in school, Preciosa works very hard to provide for them.

Preciosa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, home care products, and other groceries.

Preciosa has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Preciosa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Fulani

texts.en:
Fulani is a maize farmer from Kadanya Biyar village. As a Babban Gona member, Fulani is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Fulani would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. Fulani will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay its sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Fulani no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000/Ha, Fulani hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Gloria, es madre de 3 hijos, ella estudió hasta primer grado por la situación económica que pasaba su familia, actualmente ella es comerciante está casada, su esposo se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos y también trabaja como jornalero, actualmente solo tiene una hija y vive aún con ellos, pues los demás ya formaron sus hogares y solo su hija depende de ella.

Gloria, se dedica a la venta de ropa y también tiene una pequeña tienda desde hace 20 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, a ella sus padres desde muy joven le enseñaron a trabajar y ha hacer los oficios domésticos, ya que ellos tenían que trabajar para mantenerla a ella y a sus hermanos.- Gloria, vende ropa por toda la zona aledaña a su cantón y camina aproximadamente una hora para pasar vendiendo donde las personas que le conocen y regularmente trabaja por la mañana. 

Gloria, utilizara el préstamo para comprar camisas, shorts, faldas, golosinas, aceite, arroz, etc. ella espera poder obtener mayores ingresos y continuar ayudando a su hija para que siga estudiando. 

Gloria, sueña con poder ampliar su casa para que su hija tenga su espacio propio, ya que donde actualmente vive es bastante pequeño y ademas ella espera ampliar su tienda ya que se encuentra muy bien ubicada y las ventas son bastante buenas.
texts.en:
Gloria is the mother of three children. She studied until the first grade because of the economic situation experienced by her family. Currently, she is married and is a merchant. Her husband works farming basic grains and also works as a laborer. She has one daughter at present who still lives with them because the others have formed their own households and only her daughter depends on her.

Gloria works selling clothing and she also has a small store. She has spent 20 years working on this activity. Her parents taught her to work and to complete the housework from a very young age because they had to work to sustain her and her siblings. Gloria sells clothing in all of the areas near to her county and walks approximately one hour to sell her items by passing through the area where the persons who know her are. She regularly works in the morning.

Gloria will use the loan to purchase shirts, shorts, skirts, candies, oil, rice, etc. She hopes to obtain better earnings and to continue helping her daughter so she can continue studying. Gloria dreams of being able to enlarge her house so that her daughter may have her own space because where she currently lives is too small. In addition, she hopes to enlarge her store because it is very well located and her sales are very good.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, shorts, skirts, candies, oil, rice, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Minda

texts.en:
Ma. Minda is a 49-year-old woman from Tubigon, Bohol. She is married and has six children. Her oldest child is 22 years old, while her youngest child is nine years old. Her husband works as a tricycle driver. Ma. Minda is engaged in “buri” (the largest palm in the Philippines) weaving. Woven buri has various usages. It can be made into bags, mats, and native hats. Sometimes it is used for costumes in dance contests and activities.

Ma. Minda has been doing this business for 10 years. She is asking for a loan to help her buy more buri leaves used in weaving. In the future, she is aiming to increase their income for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy buri leaves for weaving.

loans.name: Lubna's Group

texts.en:
Lubna is a 38-year old married woman, living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has requested a Kiva loan to support her husband. Her husband is a shoe manufacturer by profession; he sews rexine shoes by machine, after that he attaches the sole through hand stitching. In this way; he is generating income for his entire family. Due to household expenses, inflation and children's basic necessities, he is compelled to increase his daily production. He wants to buy additional raw materials but does not have enough cash in hand to fulfill his requirement. 
Therefore, Lubna has requested a Kiva loan to financially support her husband so he can buy additional raw material for shoe making and can fulfill the basic necessities his children.
Lubna is very thankful to Kiva, lenders and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.
Note: Lubna is standing with a raised hand in the given picture.

loans.use: to buy raw material for her husband's shoe making business so he can fulfill basic necessities his children.

loans.name: Abubakar

texts.en:
Abubakar is a Babban Gona farmer. Abubakar is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Abubakar would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan Abubakar can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Abubakar has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000/hectare. Abubakar is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to feed his family and children and looks forward to using his additional earnings to move to the city with his family

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Alh. Sale

texts.en:
Alh. Sale is a maize farmer from Kadanya Biyar village. As a member of Babban Gona, Alh. Sale is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alh. Sale would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Alh. Sale can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Alh. Sale is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Muhammadu

texts.en:
Muhammadu is a maize farmer from Kadanya Biyar village. As a Babban Gona member, Muhammadu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Muhammadu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. Muhammadu will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay it’s sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Muhammadu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Hectare, Muhammadu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna is a resident of Baybay, Leyte. She earns a living by selling salted fish and varieties of food ingredients such as spices, eggs, dried noodles and vegetables. Lorna has been engaged in this business since then, when she started her married life. Lorna has three children and she was determined to work hard to give them the best as she can do. Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy more salted fish and food ingredients to be able to increase her profitability. In addition, Lorna is still planning of other business opportunities such as selling dried fish in the future.

loans.use: to buy salted fish and food ingredients such as spices, eggs, dried noodles and vegetables

loans.name: Nacor

texts.es:
Nacor con 30 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su cónyuge e hijos,en casa propia de material rústico, en el distrito de Pimpingos, provincia de Cutervo, departamento de Cajamarca, país Perú, en una zona rural. Nacor cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura y ganadería.

Nacor se dedica al cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 1 hectárea variedad catimor; plantación tiene 3 años de edad en primer año de producción. El cuenta con amplia experiencia en el rubro ya que sus padres toda la vida han cultivado variedad nacional; con estos ingresos han sido criados por sus padres plantación que a cultivado todo el tiempo.Ahora por cuestiones de enfermedades y plagas han renovado plantación variedad catimor que es mucho más resistente a enfermedades. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cría de animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, chanchos y otros) y cultivo de productos de pan llevar (yuca, plátano, vituca).El destino del crédito será para el mantenimiento de parcela agrícola 1 hectárea de café variedad catimor de 4 años de edad, asegurando campaña 2016, reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Nacor es socio nuevo para nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa. Nacor firma con cónyuge.
texts.en:
Nacor is 30 years old, is in a common law marriage and lives with his partner and children in their own home made of rustic materials in the Pimpingos district of the Cutervo province, department of Cajamarca, Perú. Nacor has many good personal and professional references. The residents of this area work mostly in agriculture and ranching.

Nacor works in a coffee plantation, and to date has 1 hectare of the catimor coffee variety. His crop is 3 years old and it is in the first year of production. He has a lot of experience in this trade since his parents have grown the national variety of coffee all their lives. His parents raised them with the revenue generated from their coffee plantation. Currently, due to plant illnesses and plagues, they have renovated the crop with the catimor coffee variety which is more resistant to plant illnesses. In addition, he raises small animals (chickens, guinea pigs, pigs and others) and also grows grain products (cassava, plantain, vituca).

The loan will be used to maintain the 1 hectare farm of the 4 years catimor coffee plantation, securing a better production for the 2016 season. This will result in a higher volume of sales and hence will obtain more income to improve the quality of life for him and his family.

Nacor is a new member of the Edpyme Alternativa organization. Nacor signs with his spouse.

loans.use: to maintain a hectare of his 4 year catimor coffee plantation to secure the 2016 harvest.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a single woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use. Her business goal is to have a modern salon within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a role model to other businesses. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
This is Rosalie’s food stall located in Talisay City, Cebu that sells banana cue which is a popular snack food in the Philippines. It’s made from “saba”, a type of banana, deeply fried and coated with caramelized brown sugar and skewered on a bamboo stick. To match her banana cue, Rosalie also sells softdrinks and other beverages. Furthermore, she placed a coin-operated karaoke machine inside her stall to encourage more buyers. They can sing while taking their snacks. 

Ariel, her live-in partner, is into buy-and-sell business. They sell separately in different areas in order to find more customers. Their combined income sustains their everyday needs but they can hardly afford their children’s education. Rain or shine, they patiently work hard for the sake of their children. They want them to finish schooling so as to have brighter future.

This time, Rosalie plans to add more snacks like camote (sweet potato) cue, camote fries, cookies and chips. She appeals for PHP 50,000 loan to buy ingredients like banana, sweet potato, sugar, flour, cooking oil, beverages, and other snack items. Part of the loan will be allotted for her husband’s buy-and-sell business. Hopefully, they could earn higher profit, a step forward in realizing their dream of enjoying a more comfortable life someday.

Rosalie is a devoted member of CCT Credit Cooperative and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like banana, sweet potato, sugar, flour, cooking oil, beverages, and other snack items

loans.name: Sisa

texts.en:
Sisa is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one child.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. and is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Sisa dreams that one day, She will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben is pleased and he mentions that he hardly can find words for his thankfulness and regards towards Kiva lenders who once already helped him to solve his health problems. Now he hopes for one more deal fortunately with another reason. He lives with his mother in Kapan city of Syunik region.

Ruben as previously is very laborious young man and he still works in several places and being very skilled electrician and already master in his work, he is employed both at the theater and at the city’s hospital and he also takes private orders for doing different electric repai works.

Ruben during summer period made some repairs to his flat and all he did by himself since being a jack of all trades. Now he wants to furnish his flat and he greatly hopes that Kiva lenders will help him with loam amount of 150.000 as he wants to buy furniture for his living room and he also mentions that maybe it will be more comfortable and a nicer flat so he will finally get married.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his living room and that maybe by making it more comfortable and nicer, he will finally get married.

loans.name: Nayrouz

texts.en:
Nayrouz, 20, was an outstanding student when she was in high school. Now she is studying at the university to pursue a bachelor’s degree in sports management. Nayrouz`s house was robbed and all her family`s money lost, so it can be hard for her parents to pay tuition fees.

Therefore Nayrouz is applying for a loan to cover her semester fees. When she finishes her bachelor’s degree, she wants to find a good job with a good salary.

loans.use: to cover her semester fees.

loans.name: Burulkan

texts.ru: Бурулкан, 39 лет, в разводе, есть 4 дочери, самой старшей 17 лет. У нее среднее образование, занимается продажей косметики, также сельским хозяйством. Она приложила все усилия для развития своего бизнеса, на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве есть 5 коров с телятами, 30 овец. Также есть земельный надел, где ежегодно Бурулкан выращивает картофель и кукурузу. Ежемесячная прибыль около 17,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на содержание семьи и воспитание детей. Поэтому для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бурулкан обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для откорма с последующей реализацией. В будущем, она планирует расширить свою деятельность и сделать дома ремонт.
texts.en: Burulkan is 39 and divorced with four daughters, of whom the oldest is 17. She has a high school education and works both in cosmetics sales and in agriculture. She has put all her strength into developing her business and currently has five cows with calves and 30 sheep on her farm as well as land where she grows an annual harvest of potatoes and corn. Her monthly income is about 17,000 KGS, which is insufficient to care for her family and feed her children. Therefore she has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 KGS to purchase calves for fattening and resale, in order to further develop her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business and to do home renovations.

loans.use: to purchase some calves for fattening and resale in order to increase her income

loans.name: Shibani Shg Group

texts.en:
Arati, who is a 48-year-old married rice farmer with five children, two of them married, can only make 500 INR per day to support her family. Arati resides in a rural area of Bolangir District, Odisha, India. She has been involved in this work for nearly 20 years now.

Because it is hard to find a place to go to the toilet, Arati, along with her group member, would like to get a low-interest, Kiva-funded loan from People's Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a hygienic latrine for her house. She is very happy with this loan, since it will promote her health, the environment, and her living standard.

She would like to thank all the lenders for their generosity in providing such a great loan for less fortunate people like her. She is the one standing on the left-hand side in the photograph.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine for her house.

loans.name: Sonia Margarita

texts.es:
Sonia, de 39 años de edad, no estudio debido a que sus padres eran de escasos recursos económico y no contaban con el suficiente dinero para que ella pudiese estudiar, actualmente está casada y tiene 3 hijos, 1 de ellos está fuera del país y los demás hijos aún están estudiando, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y de ella solo dependen los 2 hijos que aún viven con ella.

Sonia, se dedica a la venta de platillos típicos, como yuca frita, nuégados, pasteles, atol de maíz tostado y atol de elote; ella se dedica a este negocio desde hace 5 años, su mamá se dedicaba a este negocio y fue ella quien le enseño, ella sale a vender sus productos en toda su comunidad y todos los días camina un aproximado de 20 kilometros.

Sonia, utilizara el préstamo para comprar yuca, maíz, elote y aceite, ella los piensa comprar por mayor para que estos materiales le salgan mucho más baratos y por ende obtener mejores ganancias y con estas ganancias satisfacer las necesidades de alimentación, vestuario y salud de su familia.

Sonia, sueña con tener un negocio grande, que le genere la suficiente fuente de ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia y que sus hijos terminen una carrera universitaria para que sean profesionales, ella espera mejorar su negocio poco a poco y lo piensa lograr con la ayuda de este préstamo.
texts.en:
Sonia is 39 years old. She did not attend school because her parents had very little economic resources and they did not have sufficient money to permit her to study. Currently she is married and has three children. One of her children is outside of the country and the other two are still studying. Her husband works in agriculture. Only her two children who still live with her are dependent on her.

Sonia works selling typical meals, such as fried yuca, fritters, cakes, toasted corn gruel and corncob gruel. She has worked on this business for 5 years. Her mother worked on this business and she was the one who taught Sonia. Sonia departs to sell her products throughout her community and everyday she walks about 20 kilometers.

Sonia will use the loan to purchase yuca, corn, corncob and oil. She is thinking of purchasing it in bulk because the materials will be a lot cheaper, therefore she can obtain better earnings and with these earnings satisfy the need to feed, dress and take care of the health of her family.

Sonia dreams of having a big business that generates a sufficient source of income to get her family ahead and that her children complete university degrees so they can become professionals. She hopes to improve her business little by little and she thinks she will accomplish this with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to purchase yuca, corn, corncob and oil.
